analyzed: yang shes bya'i chos rnams ni / mos pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul dang / rigs pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul dang / rnam par 'phro ba med pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul dang / so so rang gis shes pa'i spyod yul dang / gzhan gyi bdag nyid shes pa'i spyod yul dang / 'og ma shes pa'i spyod yul dang /
translated: Moreover, the dharmas that are objects of knowledge are:ðŸ”½the domain of the knowledge of devoted interest, the domain of the knowledge of reasoned contemplation, the domain of the knowledge of non-discursiveness, the domain of the knowledge of personal realization, the domain of the knowledge of the self-existence of others, the domain of the knowledge of the lower,

original: gong ma shes pa'i spyod yul dang / rnam par sun 'byin pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul dang / kun nas mi ldang ba shes pa'i spyod yul dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i spyod yul dang / shes pa shes pa'i spyod yul dang / mthar thug pa shes pa'i spyod yul dang /
analyzed: gong ma shes pa'i spyod yul dang / rnam par sun 'byin pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul dang / kun nas mi ldang ba shes pa'i spyod yul dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i spyod yul dang / shes pa shes pa'i spyod yul dang / mthar thug pa shes pa'i spyod yul dang /
translated: the domain of the knowledge of the higher, the domain of the knowledge of the counteractive, the domain of the knowledge of the non-arising of things, the domain of the knowledge of the knowledge itself, the domain of the knowledge of the ultimate,

original: don chen po shes pa'i spyod yul gyi phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: don chen po shes pa'i spyod yul gyi phyir yang ngo //
translated: and the domain of the knowledge of the great meaning.

original: bdag la shes pa po dang / mthong ba por mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la shes pa po dang / mthong ba por mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: with the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is a knower and a seer.

original: ji ltar na rnam par shes par bya ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par shes par bya ba yin /
translated: What is the knowable?ðŸ”½How many are knowable?

original: rnam par shes par bya ba rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir rnam par shes par bya bar brtag ce na /
analyzed: rnam par shes par bya ba rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir rnam par shes par bya bar brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim is the knowable investigated?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / rgyu dang / 'jug pa dang / rgyu mtshan dang / rgyu mtshan las byung ba dang / mi mthun pa dang / gnyen po dang / phra ba'i rab tu dbye bas kyang rnam par shes par bya bar blta'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / rgyu dang / 'jug pa dang / rgyu mtshan dang / rgyu mtshan las byung ba dang / mi mthun pa dang / gnyen po dang / phra ba'i rab tu dbye bas kyang rnam par shes par bya bar blta'o //
translated: The knowable should be understood as non-discrimination, discrimination, cause, engagement, sign, what arises from the sign, the adverse, the counteractive, and the subtle distinction.

original: thams cad kyang rnam par shes par bya ba dag go //
analyzed: thams cad kyang rnam par shes par bya ba dag go //
translated: All are knowable.

original: bdag la mthong ba po la sogs par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ðŸ”½ji ltar na mngon par shes par bya ba yin /
analyzed: bdag la mthong ba po la sogs par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na mngon par shes par bya ba yin /
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is a seer, etc.ðŸ”½What is the supernormal knowledge?

original: mngon par shes pa bya ba rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir mngon par shes par bya bar brtag ce na /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa bya ba rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir mngon par shes par bya bar brtag ce na /
translated: How many are supernormal knowledge? With what aim is supernormal knowledge investigated?

original: kun tu 'gro ba dang / rjes su thos pa dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / 'ong bas dang / 'gro ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba dang / rjes su thos pa dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / 'ong bas dang / 'gro ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i phyir yang ngo //
translated: because it is all-pervading, because it is heard in succession, because it is applied to action, because it is the cause of coming, because it is the cause of going, and because it is the cause of liberation.

original: thams cad kyang mngon par shes par bya ba dag go //
analyzed: thams cad kyang mngon par shes par bya ba dag go //
translated: All are to be known by superknowledge.

original: bdag la mthu dang bcas par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la mthu dang bcas par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self endowed with power.

original: ji ltar na gzugs can yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzugs can yin /
translated: What is having form?

original: gzugs can rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir gzugs can du brtag ce na /
analyzed: gzugs can rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir gzugs can du brtag ce na /
translated: How many have form? With what aim is that which has form investigated?

original: gzugs de'i bdag nyid dang / 'byung ba rten du gyur pa dang / dga' ba'i kun 'byung ba dang / phyogs dang bcas @57b pa dang / yul la khyab pa dang / yul nye bar bstan du rung ba dang / yul spyod yul du 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gzugs de'i bdag nyid dang / 'byung ba rten du gyur pa dang / dga' ba'i kun 'byung ba dang / phyogs dang bcas @57b pa dang / yul la khyab pa dang / yul nye bar bstan du rung ba dang / yul spyod yul du 'gyur ba dang /
translated: That which has form should be understood as having the nature of form, as the support of the great elements, as the origin of pleasure, as having a place, as pervading the object, as being the object that is shown, as being the object that is the domain of action,

original: gnyis spyod yul du mtshungs pa dang / 'brel pa dang / rjes su 'brel ba dang / rab tu rtog pa dang / gnod par bya ba yin pa dang / go bar byed pa dag /
analyzed: gnyis spyod yul du mtshungs pa dang / 'brel pa dang / rjes su 'brel ba dang / rab tu rtog pa dang / gnod par bya ba yin pa dang / go bar byed pa dag /
translated: They are similar as objects of the two kinds of grasping, they are related, they are related as consequences, they are related as investigations, they are related as injuries, and they are related as understandings.

original: bsags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / phyi rol du bltas pa dang / nang du bltas pa dang / rgyun ring ba dang / dus yongs su chad pa dang / de'i dus dang / nges par bstan pa'i phyir yang gzugs can du blta'o //
analyzed: bsags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / phyi rol du bltas pa dang / nang du bltas pa dang / rgyun ring ba dang / dus yongs su chad pa dang / de'i dus dang / nges par bstan pa'i phyir yang gzugs can du blta'o //
translated: They are also considered material because they are accumulations, because they are directed outward, because they are directed inward, because they are long-lasting, because they are interrupted, because they are timely, and because they are taught.

original: thams cad kyang gzugs can dag go //
analyzed: thams cad kyang gzugs can dag go //
translated: All are material.

original: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: Or, they are all immaterial.

original: bdag la gzugs can du mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la gzugs can du mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The investigation of materiality is to be undertaken in order to abandon attachment to a material self.

original: ji ltar na gzugs can ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzugs can ma yin /
translated: What is immaterial?

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir gzugs can ma yin par brtag ce na /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir gzugs can ma yin par brtag ce na /
translated: How many are immaterial? With what aim is the immaterial investigated?

original: gzugs can las bzlog pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa dag go //
analyzed: gzugs can las bzlog pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa dag go //
translated: The immaterial should be understood as the opposite of the material.

original: thams cad kyang gzugs can ma yin pa dag go //
analyzed: thams cad kyang gzugs can ma yin pa dag go //
translated: All are immaterial.

original: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, the explanation should be understood as appropriate.

original: bdag la gzugs can ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la gzugs can ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is not material.

original: ji ltar na bstan du yod pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na bstan du yod pa yin /
translated: What is having form?

original: bstan du yod pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir bstan du yod par brtag ce na /
analyzed: bstan du yod pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir bstan du yod par brtag ce na /
translated: How many have form? With what aim is that which has form investigated?

original: mig gi yul ni bstan du yod pa'o //ðŸ”½lhag ma'i rab tu dbye ba ni gzugs can bzhin no //
analyzed: mig gi yul ni bstan du yod pa'o // lhag ma'i rab tu dbye ba ni gzugs can bzhin no //
translated: The object of the eye is having form.ðŸ”½The rest of the classification is like that of the material.

original: thams cad kyang bstan du yod pa dag go //
analyzed: thams cad kyang bstan du yod pa dag go //
translated: All have form.

original: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, the explanation should be understood as appropriate.

original: bdag mig gi yul du mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag mig gi yul du mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is the object of the eye.

original: ji ltar na bstan du med pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na bstan du med pa yin /
translated: What is formless?

original: bstan du med pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir bstan du med par brtag ce na /
analyzed: bstan du med pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir bstan du med par brtag ce na /
translated: How many are formless? With what aim is that which is formless investigated?

original: bstan du yod pa las bzlog pa ni bstan du med par blta'o //
analyzed: bstan du yod pa las bzlog pa ni bstan du med par blta'o //
translated: That which is not having form should be understood as the opposite of that which has form.

original: thams cad kyang bstan du med pa dag go //
analyzed: thams cad kyang bstan du med pa dag go //
translated: All are formless.

original: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, the explanation should be understood as appropriate.

original: bdag mig gi yul ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag mig gi yul ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to abandon attachment to the self as not being the object of the eye.

original: ji ltar na thogs pa dang bcas pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na thogs pa dang bcas pa yin /
translated: What is resistant?ðŸ”½How many are resistant?

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir thogs pa dang bcas par brtag ce na /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir thogs pa dang bcas par brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim is that which is resistant investigated?

original: bstan du yod pa gang yi pa de thogs pa dang bcas pa yang de yin no //
analyzed: bstan du yod pa gang yi pa de thogs pa dang bcas pa yang de yin no //
translated: That which is visible is also resistant.

original: yang rnam pa gsum gyis thogs pa dang bcas par blta ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gsum gyis thogs pa dang bcas par blta ste /
translated: Moreover, the resistant should be understood in three ways:

original: rigs dang / nye bar bsags pa dang / yongs su sbyang ba ma byas pas @58a * //
analyzed: rigs dang / nye bar bsags pa dang / yongs su sbyang ba ma byas pas @58a * //
translated: by its nature, by its accumulation, and by its lack of purification.

original: kyang ngo // de la rigs ni gang phan tshun du sgrib par byed pa dang / bsgrib par bya ba'o //
analyzed: kyang ngo // de la rigs ni gang phan tshun du sgrib par byed pa dang / bsgrib par bya ba'o //
translated: Among them, by its nature, it is that which mutually obstructs and is obstructed.

original: de la nye bar bsags pa ni rdul phra rab las gong bur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la nye bar bsags pa ni rdul phra rab las gong bur gyur pa'o //
translated: Among them, by its accumulation, it is the aggregation of atoms.

original: de la yongs su sbyang ba ma byas pa ni gang ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis ma bsgyur ba'i gzugs so //
analyzed: de la yongs su sbyang ba ma byas pa ni gang ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis ma bsgyur ba'i gzugs so //
translated: Among them, by its lack of purification, it is form that is not transformed by the power of concentration.

original: yang rab tu 'khrug pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pas thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: yang rab tu 'khrug pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pas thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: They are also impeded because they are the basis of the most violent agitation.

original: thams cad kyang thogs pa dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: thams cad kyang thogs pa dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: All are impeded.

original: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, as is appropriate, they are not impeded.

original: bdag la thams cad du song ba ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la thams cad du song ba ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is not all-pervading.

original: ji ltar na thogs pa med pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na thogs pa med pa yin /
translated: What is non-impeded?ðŸ”½How many are non-impeded?

original: thogs pa med pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir thogs pa med par brtag ce na /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir thogs pa med par brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim is that which is non-impeded investigated?

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa las bzlog pa ni thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa las bzlog pa ni thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Non-impeded should be understood in the opposite sense to impeded.

original: thams cad kyang thogs pa med pa dag go //
analyzed: thams cad kyang thogs pa med pa dag go //
translated: All are non-impeded.

original: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, as is appropriate, they are impeded.

original: bdag la thams cad du song bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ðŸ”½ji ltar na zag pa dang bcas pa yin /
analyzed: bdag la thams cad du song bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na zag pa dang bcas pa yin /
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is all-pervading.ðŸ”½What is with outflows?ðŸ”½How many are with outflows?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir zag pa dang bcas par brtag ce na /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir zag pa dang bcas par brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim is that which is with outflows investigated?

original: zag pa de'i bdag nyid dang / zag pa dang 'brel ba dang / zag pas bcings pa dang / zag pa'i rjes su 'brel pa dang / zag pa'i rjes su mthun pa dang / zag pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zag pa dang bcas par blta'o //
analyzed: zag pa de'i bdag nyid dang / zag pa dang 'brel ba dang / zag pas bcings pa dang / zag pa'i rjes su 'brel pa dang / zag pa'i rjes su mthun pa dang / zag pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zag pa dang bcas par blta'o //
translated: It should be regarded as defiled because it is the nature of defilement, it is associated with defilement, it is bound by defilement, it is related to defilement, it is in conformity with defilement, and it arises from the cause of defilement.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams dang / khams bcva lnga dang / skye mched bcu dang / khams gsum dang / skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs ni zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams dang / khams bcva lnga dang / skye mched bcu dang / khams gsum dang / skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs ni zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: The five appropriative aggregates, fifteen elements, ten spheres, three realms, and part of the two other spheres are defiled.

original: bdag zag pa dang bcas par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag zag pa dang bcas par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self endowed with defilement.

original: ji ltar na zag pa med pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na zag pa med pa yin /
translated: What is undefiled?

original: zag pa med pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir zag pa med par brtag ce na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir zag pa med par brtag ce na /
translated: How many are undefiled? With what aim is that which is undefiled investigated?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa las bzlog pa ni zag pa med par blta'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa las bzlog pa ni zag pa med par blta'o //
translated: That which is defiled should be regarded as undefiled.

original: nye bar len pa med pa'i phung po lnga rnams dang / khams gsum dang / skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa med pa'i phung po lnga rnams dang / khams gsum dang / skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs so //
translated: the five aggregates without appropriation, the three realms, and part of the twelve sense bases.

original: bdag zag pa dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag zag pa dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self free from defilements.

original: ji ltar na 'thab pa dang bcas pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'thab pa dang bcas pa yin /
translated: What is accompanied by conflict?ðŸ”½How many are accompanied by conflict?

original: 'thab pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir 'thab pa dang bcas par brtag ce na /
analyzed: 'thab pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir 'thab pa dang bcas par brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim is that which is accompanied by conflict investigated?

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi ngo bo gang @58b la brten nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi ngo bo gang @58b la brten nas /
translated: That which is accompanied by conflict should be understood as having the nature of attachment, hostility, and benightedness,

original: mtshon cha len pa dang / chad pas gcod pa dang / 'thab rtsod dang / mtshang 'bru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa rnams 'byung ba de'i bdag nyid dang / de dang 'brel pa dang / des bcings pa dang / de'i rjes su 'brel pa dang /
analyzed: mtshon cha len pa dang / chad pas gcod pa dang / 'thab rtsod dang / mtshang 'bru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa rnams 'byung ba de'i bdag nyid dang / de dang 'brel pa dang / des bcings pa dang / de'i rjes su 'brel pa dang /
translated: as well as that which arises on the basis of weapons, violence, quarrels, disputes, contention, and arguments, as well as that which is associated with them, that which is bound to them, that which is related to them,

original: de'i rjes su mthun pa dang / de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir 'thab pa dang bcas par blta'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su mthun pa dang / de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir 'thab pa dang bcas par blta'o //
translated: that which is in conformity with them, and that which arises from them.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa ji snyed pa 'thab pa dang bcas pa'ang de snyed do //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa ji snyed pa 'thab pa dang bcas pa'ang de snyed do //
translated: To the extent that there are those with outflows, to that extent there are those with conflict.

original: bdag 'thab pa dang ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag 'thab pa dang ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are investigated in order to abandon attachment to a self that has conflict.

original: ji ltar na 'thab pa med pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'thab pa med pa yin /
translated: Which are those without conflict?ðŸ”½How many are without conflict?

original: 'thab pa med pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir 'thab pa med par brtag ce na /
analyzed: 'thab pa med pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir 'thab pa med par brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim are those without conflict investigated?

original: 'thab pa dang / bcas pa las bzlog pa ni 'thab pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'thab pa dang / bcas pa las bzlog pa ni 'thab pa med pa'o //
translated: Those without conflict should be understood in the opposite sense to those with conflict.

original: zag pa med pa ji snyed par 'thab pa med pa'ang de snyed do //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ji snyed par 'thab pa med pa'ang de snyed do //
translated: To the extent that there are those without outflows, to that extent there are those without conflict.

original: bdag 'thab pa dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag 'thab pa dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are investigated in order to abandon attachment to a self that is without conflict.

original: ji ltar na zang zing dang bcas pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na zang zing dang bcas pa yin /
translated: Which are those with sustenance?ðŸ”½How many are with sustenance?

original: zang zing dang bcas pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir zang zing dang bcas par brtag ce na /
analyzed: zang zing dang bcas pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir zang zing dang bcas par brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim are those with sustenance investigated?

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi ngo bo gang la brten nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi ngo bo gang la brten nas /
translated: Those with sustenance should be understood as those in whom desire, hatred and ignorance are present.

original: yang srid pa'i lus la lhag par chags pa de'i bdag nyid dang / de dang 'brel pa dang / des bcings pa dang ; de'i rjes su 'brel pa dang / de'i rjes su mthun pa dang / de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zang zing dang bcas par blta'o //
analyzed: yang srid pa'i lus la lhag par chags pa de'i bdag nyid dang / de dang 'brel pa dang / des bcings pa dang ; de'i rjes su 'brel pa dang / de'i rjes su mthun pa dang / de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zang zing dang bcas par blta'o //
translated: It is also considered to be with-outflows because it is the nature of that, because it is related to that, because it is bound to that, because it is connected to that, because it is in conformity with that, and because it arises from the cause of that.

original: 'thab pa dang bcas pa ji snyed par zang zing dang bcas pa yang de snyed do //
analyzed: 'thab pa dang bcas pa ji snyed par zang zing dang bcas pa yang de snyed do //
translated: As many as are with conflict are also with-outflows.

original: bdag zang zing dang ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag zang zing dang ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The investigation of with-outflows is to be abandoned in order to abandon the notional attachment to a self with-outflows.

original: ji ltar na zang zing med pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na zang zing med pa yin /
translated: What is without-outflows?

original: zang zing med pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir zang zing med par brtag ce na /
analyzed: zang zing med pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir zang zing med par brtag ce na /
translated: How many are without-outflows? With what aim is that which is without-outflows investigated?

original: zang zing dang bcas pa las bzlog pa ni zang zing med pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing dang bcas pa las bzlog pa ni zang zing med pa'o //
translated: That which is with-outflows should be understood as without-outflows.

original: 'thab pa med pa ji snyed par zang zing med pa yang de snyed do //
analyzed: 'thab pa med pa ji snyed par zang zing med pa yang de snyed do //
translated: As many as are without conflict are also without-outflows.

original: bdag zang zing dang bral bar mngon par zhin pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag zang zing dang bral bar mngon par zhin pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The investigation of without-outflows is to be abandoned in order to abandon the notional attachment to a self without-outflows.

original: ji ltar na zhen pa rten pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na zhen pa rten pa yin /
translated: What is clinging?

original: zhen pa rten pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir zhen pa rten par brtag ce na /
analyzed: zhen pa rten pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir zhen pa rten par brtag ce na /
translated: How many are clinging? With what aim is clinging investigated?

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi ngo bo gang la brten nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi ngo bo gang la brten nas /
translated: Clinging should be understood as the support of craving, hatred and delusion,

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan ldan rnams la lhag par chags pa de'i bdag nyid dang / @59a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan ldan rnams la lhag par chags pa de'i bdag nyid dang / @59a * //
translated: as the nature of attachment to the objects of desire,

original: de dang 'brel pa dang / des bcings pa dang / de'i rjes su 'brel pa dang / de'i rjes su mthun pa dang / de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zhen pa brten par blta'o //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa dang / des bcings pa dang / de'i rjes su 'brel pa dang / de'i rjes su mthun pa dang / de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zhen pa brten par blta'o //
translated: as that which is related to it, as that which is bound by it, as that which is associated with it, as that which is in conformity with it, and as that which arises from its cause.

original: zang zing dang bcas pa ji snyed par zhen pa rten pa'ang de snyed do //
analyzed: zang zing dang bcas pa ji snyed par zhen pa rten pa'ang de snyed do //
translated: Clinging is as numerous as the things that are clung to.

original: bdag zhen pa dang ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ðŸ”½ji ltar na mngon par 'byung ba rten pa yin /
analyzed: bdag zhen pa dang ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na mngon par 'byung ba rten pa yin /
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self endowed with clinging.ðŸ”½What is the support of renunciation?

original: mngon par 'byung ba rten pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir mngon par 'byung ba rten par brtag ce na /
analyzed: mngon par 'byung ba rten pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir mngon par 'byung ba rten par brtag ce na /
translated: How many are the support of renunciation? With what aim is the support of renunciation investigated?

original: zhen pa rten pa las bzlog pa ni mngon par 'byung ba rten pa'o //ðŸ”½zang zing med pa ji snyed par mngon par 'byung ba rten pa'ang de snyed do //
analyzed: zhen pa rten pa las bzlog pa ni mngon par 'byung ba rten pa'o // zang zing med pa ji snyed par mngon par 'byung ba rten pa'ang de snyed do //
translated: The opposite of attachment is the support of renunciation.ðŸ”½Renunciation is as extensive as non-greed.

original: bdag zhen pa dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag zhen pa dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The purpose is to abandon attachment to the self as free from attachment.

original: ji ltar na 'dus byas yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dus byas yin /
translated: What is the conditioned?

original: 'dus byas rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir 'dus byas su brtag ce na /
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir 'dus byas su brtag ce na /
translated: How many are conditioned? With what aim is that which is conditioned investigated?

original: gang la skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba yang snang ba de 'dus byas su blta'o //
analyzed: gang la skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba yang snang ba de 'dus byas su blta'o //
translated: That in which origination, duration, and destruction are evident is considered conditioned.

original: chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig ma gtogs pa thams cad kyang 'dus byas dag go //
analyzed: chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig ma gtogs pa thams cad kyang 'dus byas dag go //
translated: All except for part of the element of mental objects and of the sense-field of mental objects are conditioned.

original: bdag mi rtag par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ðŸ”½ji ltar na 'dus ma byas yin /
analyzed: bdag mi rtag par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na 'dus ma byas yin /
translated: The purpose is to abandon attachment to the impermanent self.ðŸ”½What is the unconditioned?

original: 'dus ma byas rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir 'dus ma byas su brtag ce na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir 'dus ma byas su brtag ce na /
translated: How many are unconditioned? With what aim is the unconditioned investigated?

original: 'dus byas las bzlog pa ni 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: 'dus byas las bzlog pa ni 'dus ma byas so //
translated: The unconditioned should be understood in the opposite sense.

original: chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: It is part of the element and the sense-sphere of mental objects.

original: bdag rtag par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ðŸ”½nye bar len pa'i phung po ma yin pa rnams 'dus byas zhes bya'am /
analyzed: bdag rtag par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // nye bar len pa'i phung po ma yin pa rnams 'dus byas zhes bya'am /
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is permanent.

original: 'dus ma byas zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Are the aggregates which are not appropriated conditioned or unconditioned?

original: 'dus byas kyang ma yin 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyang ma yin 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: They are neither conditioned nor unconditioned.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /ðŸ”½las dang nyon mongs pas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir 'dus byas ma yin no //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / las dang nyon mongs pas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir 'dus byas ma yin no //
translated: Why is that?ðŸ”½They are not conditioned because they are not created by the actions of the defilements.

original: 'dod pa bzhin du byed pas mngon du phyogs pa dang / rgyab kyis lta ba'i dngos po nyid kyi phyir 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa bzhin du byed pas mngon du phyogs pa dang / rgyab kyis lta ba'i dngos po nyid kyi phyir 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin no //
translated: They are not unconditioned because they are favorable to the conditioned and unfavorable to the unconditioned.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba 'di ni gnyis so zhes gang gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba 'di ni gnyis so zhes gang gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the twofold doctrine of the Fortunate One?

original: don gang gis 'dus byas su gyur pa'i don des 'dus ma byas ma yin no //
analyzed: don gang gis 'dus byas su gyur pa'i don des 'dus ma byas ma yin no //
translated: That which is conditioned by a certain meaning is not unconditioned by that same meaning.

original: don gang gis 'dus ma byas su gyur pa'i don de nyid @59b kyis 'dus byas ma yin te /
analyzed: don gang gis 'dus ma byas su gyur pa'i don de nyid @59b kyis 'dus byas ma yin te /
translated: That which is unconditioned by a certain meaning is not conditioned by that same meaning.

original: tshul 'di ni 'di ltar blta bar bya'o /ðŸ”½// / bam po gnyis pa /ðŸ”½ji ltar na 'jig rten pa yin /
analyzed: tshul 'di ni 'di ltar blta bar bya'o / // / bam po gnyis pa / ji ltar na 'jig rten pa yin /
translated: This is the way to see this matter.ðŸ”½How many are mundane?

original: 'jig rten pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir 'jig rten par brtag ce na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir 'jig rten par brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim is that which is mundane investigated?

original: khams gsum par gtogs pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa de ltar snang ba yang 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum par gtogs pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa de ltar snang ba yang 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: That which is included in the three realms of existence, and also that which appears in the aftermath of supramundane states, is mundane.

original: phung po rnams kyi phyogs gcig dang / khams bco lnga dang / skye mched bcu dang / khams gsum dang / skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi phyogs gcig dang / khams bco lnga dang / skye mched bcu dang / khams gsum dang / skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs so //
translated: A part of the aggregates, fifteen elements, ten spheres, three elements of the aggregates, and a part of two elements and two spheres.

original: bdag la 'jig rten du mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la 'jig rten du mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to the self which is the world.

original: ji ltar na 'jig rten las 'das pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'jig rten las 'das pa yin /
translated: How many are supramundane?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das par brtag ce na /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das par brtag ce na /
translated: How many are supramundane? With what aim is that which is supramundane investigated?

original: khams gsum pa'i gnyen po rnam par mi rtog pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i gnyen po rnam par mi rtog pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: That which is supramundane should be understood as the counter-agent to the three worlds, as non-discrimination.

original: phyin ci log dang spros pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log dang spros pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the counter-agent to the three worlds, and because it is the counter-agent to discrimination.

original: yang rnam grangs su na /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs su na /
translated: Moreover, in another way,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa yang yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa yang yin te /
translated: that which is supramundane is also that which is obtained subsequently to the supramundane,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa la rten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa la rten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is based on the supramundane.

original: phung po rnams dang / khams gsum dang / skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: phung po rnams dang / khams gsum dang / skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: It belongs to the aggregates, to three elements and to two spheres.

original: bdag 'ba' zhig tu mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag 'ba' zhig tu mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning at tachment to a self consisting of the elements.

original: ji ltar na byung ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na byung ba yin /
translated: What is the past?

original: byung ba rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir byung bar brtag ce na /
analyzed: byung ba rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir byung bar brtag ce na /
translated: How many are past? With what aim is the past investigated?

original: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba ni byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba ni byung ba'o //
translated: That which is past is the five aggregates.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: A part of all.

original: bdag ther zug ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ther zug ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon attachment to the self as impermanent.

original: yang byung ba ni rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi ste /ðŸ”½dang po byung ba dang / rgyun gyis byung ba dang / rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rten byung ba dang / 'gyur bar byung ba dang / yongs su smin pa byung ba dang / nyams par byung ba dang / khyad par du byung ba dang /
analyzed: yang byung ba ni rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi ste / dang po byung ba dang / rgyun gyis byung ba dang / rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rten byung ba dang / 'gyur bar byung ba dang / yongs su smin pa byung ba dang / nyams par byung ba dang / khyad par du byung ba dang /
translated: There are twenty four kinds of origin:ðŸ”½origin as first occurrence, origin as continuity, origin as increase, origin as support, origin as transformation, origin as complete maturation, origin as degeneration, origin as distinction,

original: 'od gsal bar byung ba dang / 'od gsal ba ma yin par byung ba dang / kun tu 'gro bas byung ba dang / sa bon dang bcas par byung ba dang / sa bon ma yin par byung ba dang / gzugs brnyan dang dbang 'byor ba dang nges par bstan pa'i phyir byung ba dang /
analyzed: 'od gsal bar byung ba dang / 'od gsal ba ma yin par byung ba dang / kun tu 'gro bas byung ba dang / sa bon dang bcas par byung ba dang / sa bon ma yin par byung ba dang / gzugs brnyan dang dbang 'byor ba dang nges par bstan pa'i phyir byung ba dang /
translated: origin as manifestation, origin as non manifestation, origin as pervasion, origin as seed, origin as non seed, origin as reflection, origin as mastery and origin as demonstration.

original: gcig nas gcig tu byung ba dang / skad cig zhig nas byung ba dang / phrad pa dang bral bas byung ba dang / gnas skabs gzhan du @60a * //
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu byung ba dang / skad cig zhig nas byung ba dang / phrad pa dang bral bas byung ba dang / gnas skabs gzhan du @60a * //
translated: arising from one to another, arising from the destruction of an instant, arising from contact or separation, arising from a different state,

original: byung ba dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang skye bas byung ba dang / 'jig pa dang 'chags pas byung ba dang / sngon gyi dus na byung ba dang / 'chi ba'i dus na byung ba dang / bar du byung ba dang / nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i dus na byung ba'o //
analyzed: byung ba dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang skye bas byung ba dang / 'jig pa dang 'chags pas byung ba dang / sngon gyi dus na byung ba dang / 'chi ba'i dus na byung ba dang / bar du byung ba dang / nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i dus na byung ba'o //
translated: arising from death and birth, arising from destruction and evolution, arising in the past, arising at the time of death, arising in the intermediate state, and arising at the time of rebirth.

original: ji ltar na ma byung ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na ma byung ba yin /
translated: What is non-arising?

original: ma byung ba rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir ma byung bar brtag ce na /
analyzed: ma byung ba rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir ma byung bar brtag ce na /
translated: How many are non-arising? With what aim is non-arising investigated?

original: ma 'ongs pa dang 'dus ma byas ni ma byung ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang 'dus ma byas ni ma byung ba'o //
translated: The future and the unconditioned are non-arising.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: A part of everything.

original: bdag ther zug tu mngon par zhen pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ther zug tu mngon par zhen pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to the self as permanent.

original: yang byung ba las bzlog pa ni ma byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang byung ba las bzlog pa ni ma byung ba'o //
translated: Moreover, non-arising is the opposite of arising.

original: ji ltar na 'dzin pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dzin pa yin /
translated: What is grasping?

original: 'dzin pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir 'dzin par brtag ce na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir 'dzin par brtag ce na /
translated: How many are appropriators? With what aim is an appropriator investigated?

original: dbang po gzugs can dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ni 'dzin par blta ste /
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ni 'dzin par blta ste /
translated: The material sense faculties, the mind and mental activities are appropriators.

original: phung po gsum dang / gzugs dang / 'du byed kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / khams bcu gnyis dang / skye mched drug dang ; chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: phung po gsum dang / gzugs dang / 'du byed kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / khams bcu gnyis dang / skye mched drug dang ; chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: Three aggregates, a part of the aggregates of matter and formations, twelve elements, six spheres, a part of the element and the sphere of mental objects, and also the appropriator itself.

original: bdag za ba por mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag za ba por mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is an enjoyer.

original: yang ma phrad pa dang phrad nas 'dzin pa dang / da ltar gyi rang gi mtshan nyid so sor 'dzin pa dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dus thams cad pa'i yul thams cad 'dzin pa yang 'dzin par blta'o //
analyzed: yang ma phrad pa dang phrad nas 'dzin pa dang / da ltar gyi rang gi mtshan nyid so sor 'dzin pa dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dus thams cad pa'i yul thams cad 'dzin pa yang 'dzin par blta'o //
translated: Moreover, an appropriator is that which seizes without contact, that which seizes by contact, that which seizes its own characteristics in the present, and that which seizes its own and general characteristics in all the time periods and with regard to all objects.

original: tshogs na rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir btags pa can yang 'dzin par smra'o zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs na rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir btags pa can yang 'dzin par smra'o zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the appropriator is also called the â€œdesignatedâ€ because consciousness arises in dependence on two.

original: ji ltar na gzung ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzung ba yin /
translated: What is the apprehended?ðŸ”½How many are apprehended?

original: gzung ba rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir gzung bar brtag ce na /
analyzed: gzung ba rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir gzung bar brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim is the apprehended investigated?

original: 'dzin pa gang yin pa gzung ba yang de yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gang yin pa gzung ba yang de yin no //
translated: That which is the apprehending is also the apprehended.

original: gzung ba yin la 'dzin pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gzung ba yin la 'dzin pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also the apprehended which is not the apprehending.

original: 'dzin pa'i spyod yul nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i spyod yul nyid kyi don to //
translated: The object which is the domain of the apprehending.

original: thams cad do //
analyzed: thams cad do //
translated: All are apprehended.

original: bdag la yul du mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la yul du mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is the object.

original: ji ltar na phyi rol tu bltas pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na phyi rol tu bltas pa yin /
translated: What is turned outward?ðŸ”½How many are turned outward?

original: phyi rol tu bltas pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir phyi rol tu bltas par brtag ce na /
analyzed: phyi rol tu bltas pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir phyi rol tu bltas par brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim is that which is turned outward investigated?

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / de'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrubs pas yongs su bsdus pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ma gtogs par 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa ni phyi rol tu bltas pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / de'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrubs pas yongs su bsdus pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ma gtogs par 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa ni phyi rol tu bltas pa'o //
translated: That which is associated with the realm of desire, with the exception of the mind and mental activities of hearing, memory, introspection and the view of the universal in the teaching of the Buddha, and also with the exception of that which is included in the practice of the teaching in conformity with that.

original: khams bzhi dang / @60b skye mched gnyis dang / de las gzhan pa dag gi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: khams bzhi dang / @60b skye mched gnyis dang / de las gzhan pa dag gi phyogs gcig go //
translated: four elements, two spheres, and part of the others.

original: bdag 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ðŸ”½ji ltar na nang du bltas pa yin /
analyzed: bdag 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na nang du bltas pa yin /
translated: with the aim of abandoning attachment to a self free from passion.ðŸ”½What is internal?

original: nang du bltas pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir nang du bltas par brtag ce na /
analyzed: nang du bltas pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir nang du bltas par brtag ce na /
translated: How many are internal? With what aim is that which is internal investigated?

original: phyi rol tu bltas pa las bzlog pa ni nang du bltas pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol tu bltas pa las bzlog pa ni nang du bltas pa'o //
translated: That which is external should be understood in the opposite sense to that which is internal.

original: khams bzhi dang / skye mched gnyis ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa dag gi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: khams bzhi dang / skye mched gnyis ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa dag gi phyogs gcig go //
translated: four elements, two spheres, and part of the others.

original: bdag 'dod chags dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag 'dod chags dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: with the aim of abandoning attachment to a self free from passion.

original: ji ltar na nyon mongs pa can yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na nyon mongs pa can yin /
translated: What is defiled?

original: nyon mongs pa can rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa can du brtag ce na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa can du brtag ce na /
translated: How many are defiled? With what aim is that which is defiled investigated?

original: mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: The unwholesome and the obscurednondefined are defiled.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni kun tu 'gro ba'i yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang /
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni kun tu 'gro ba'i yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang /
translated: The obscured-indeterminate is the defilement associated with the universal mental organ, and the innate view of individuality and extreme views associated with the mental consciousness,

original: gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: and that which is associated with the form and formless realms.

original: phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / skye mched bzhi'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / skye mched bzhi'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: It is part of the aggregates, ten elements, and four sense bases.

original: bdag nyon mongs pa dang ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyon mongs pa dang ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is investigated with the aim of abandoning at tachment to a self endowed with defilement.

original: ji ltar na nyon mongs pa can ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na nyon mongs pa can ma yin /
translated: What is not defiled?

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin par brtag ce na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin par brtag ce na /
translated: How many are not defiled? With what aim is that which is not defiled investigated?

original: dge ba dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: The wholesome and the unobscured-indeterminate are not defiled.

original: khams brgyad dang skye mched brgyad dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched lhag ma rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: khams brgyad dang skye mched brgyad dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched lhag ma rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: eight elements, eight spheres, and part of the aggregates, elements, and spheres that remain.

original: bdag nyon mongs pa dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyon mongs pa dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self free from defilements.

original: ji ltar na 'das pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'das pa yin /
translated: What is the past?

original: 'das pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir 'das par brtag ce na /
analyzed: 'das pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir 'das par brtag ce na /
translated: How many are past? With what aim is the past investigated?

original: byung la 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad zin pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar byed pa las yang dag par shin tu 'das pa dang / rgyu yongs su bzung nas zhig pa dang /
analyzed: byung la 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad zin pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar byed pa las yang dag par shin tu 'das pa dang / rgyu yongs su bzung nas zhig pa dang /
translated: The past is characterized by having arisen and ceased, by having experienced cause and effect, by having completely transcended defilement and purification, by having perished after having seized its cause,

original: 'bras bu dang rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa dang / med pa dang / dran pa dang / dran pa'i kun tu @61a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa dang / med pa dang / dran pa dang / dran pa'i kun tu @61a * //
translated: by the existence and non-existence of its own characteristics, by memory, by the present and future not being united, and by the past and present being united.

original: rtog pa'i mtshan ma dang / ltos pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma dang / btang snyoms kyis rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma yin pas kyang 'das par blta'o //
analyzed: rtog pa'i mtshan ma dang / ltos pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma dang / btang snyoms kyis rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma yin pas kyang 'das par blta'o //
translated: It should be understood as the sign of conceptualization, the sign of defilement through dependence, and the sign of purification through equanimity.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: One part of all.

original: bdag 'jug par byed par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag 'jug par byed par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which engages.

original: ji ltar na ma 'ongs pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na ma 'ongs pa yin /
translated: What is future?

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir ma 'ongs par brtag ce na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir ma 'ongs par brtag ce na /
translated: How many are future? With what aim is the future investigated?

original: rgyu yod kyang ma byung ba dang / rang gi mtshan nyid ma thob pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu ma spyad pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i dngos po nye bar mi gnas pa dang / rgyu dang rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa dang /
analyzed: rgyu yod kyang ma byung ba dang / rang gi mtshan nyid ma thob pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu ma spyad pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i dngos po nye bar mi gnas pa dang / rgyu dang rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa dang /
translated: That which has a cause but has not yet arisen, that which has not yet attained its own characteristic, that which has not yet experienced its cause and effect, that which does not yet abide as the basis of defilement and purification, that which has a cause and its own characteristic.

original: med pa dang / mngon par dga' bas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma dang / mngon par dga' ba med pas rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma yin pas kyang ma 'ongs par blta'o //
analyzed: med pa dang / mngon par dga' bas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma dang / mngon par dga' ba med pas rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma yin pas kyang ma 'ongs par blta'o //
translated: It should be understood as future because it is the sign of defilement through delight and the sign of purification through non-delight.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: One part of all.

original: bdag 'jug par byed par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag 'jug par byed par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which engages.

original: ji ltar na da ltar byung ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na da ltar byung ba yin /
translated: What is the present?

original: da ltar byung ba rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir da ltar byung bar brtag ce na /ðŸ”½byung lam 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad zin pa dang / spyad ma zin pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba nye bar gnas pa dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs par rab tu gzhag pa'i rgyu dang /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir da ltar byung bar brtag ce na / byung lam 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad zin pa dang / spyad ma zin pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba nye bar gnas pa dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs par rab tu gzhag pa'i rgyu dang /
translated: How many are present? With what aim is the present investigated?

original: byed pa nye bar gnas pas kyang da ltar byung bar blta'o //
analyzed: byed pa nye bar gnas pas kyang da ltar byung bar blta'o //
translated: The present should be understood as having the characteristic of that which has appeared but not yet disappeared, as cause and effect already produced but not yet consumed, as the presence of defilement and purification, as the cause for positing the past and future, and as the presence of action.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: One part of all.ðŸ”½With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is present.

original: bdag 'jug par byed par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag 'jug par byed par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to abandon attachment to the self as the experiencer.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba ni gtam gyi gzhi yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba ni gtam gyi gzhi yin no //
translated: The past, present and future are the basis of conversation.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Nirvana is not,

original: so so rang gis rig par bya ba dang / brjod du med pa nyid dang / byung ba dang / 'byung ba dang / da ltar gyi tha snyad kyi gnas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so rang gis rig par bya ba dang / brjod du med pa nyid dang / byung ba dang / 'byung ba dang / da ltar gyi tha snyad kyi gnas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is to be personally experienced, inexpressible, and not a basis for the conventions of past, future and present.

original: ji ltar na dge ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na dge ba yin /
translated: What is virtue?ðŸ”½How many are virtue?

original: dge ba rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir dge bar brtag ce na /ðŸ”½ngo bo nyid dang / 'brel ba dang / rjes su 'brel ba dang / slong ba dang / don dam pa dang / skye bas 'thob pa dang / sbyor ba dang / mdun du bya ba dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir dge bar brtag ce na / ngo bo nyid dang / 'brel ba dang / rjes su 'brel ba dang / slong ba dang / don dam pa dang / skye bas 'thob pa dang / sbyor ba dang / mdun du bya ba dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
translated: With what aim is virtue investigated?ðŸ”½Virtue should be understood as nature, as relation, as consequence, as origin, as absolute, as acquisition by birth, as application, as service, as favor, as possession,

original: gnyen po dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / rgyu mthun pas kyang @61b dge bar blta'o //
analyzed: gnyen po dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / rgyu mthun pas kyang @61b dge bar blta'o //
translated: as counteraction, as appeasement, and as natural outcome.

original: phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / skye mched bzhi'i phyogs so //
analyzed: phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / skye mched bzhi'i phyogs so //
translated: The aggregates, ten elements and four sense bases.

original: bdag chos dang ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag chos dang ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self endowed with qualities.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is wholesome by nature?

original: dad pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba'i chos bcu gcig go //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba'i chos bcu gcig go //
translated: It consists of eleven mental factors, such as faith, etc.

original: 'brel pas dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pas dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is wholesome through association?

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: It consists of the dharmas associated with them.

original: rjes su 'brel pas dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pas dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is wholesome through its original nature?

original: de dag nyid kyi bag chags gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi bag chags gang yin pa'o //
translated: It consists of the residues of those dharmas.

original: slong bas dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: slong bas dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is wholesome through its consequences?

original: des kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las so //
analyzed: des kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las so //
translated: It consists of the actions of body and speech which are the consequences of those dharmas.

original: don dam pas dge ba gang zhe na /ðŸ”½de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pas dge ba gang zhe na / de bzhin nyid do //
translated: What is wholesome through its object?ðŸ”½It consists of the wholesome roots, such as the desire for the Dharma, etc.ðŸ”½What is wholesome through its root?ðŸ”½It consists of the wholesome roots, such as absence of greed, etc.

original: skye bas 'thob pas dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: skye bas 'thob pas dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is wholesome through liberation?

original: dge ba'i chos 'di dag nyid sngon goms par byas pa la brten nas /ðŸ”½de'i ngo bo'i rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos 'di dag nyid sngon goms par byas pa la brten nas /ðŸ”½de'i ngo bo'i rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa ste /
translated: It consists of the unconditioned dharmas.

original: des de dag nyid la rang bzhin gyis so sor ma brtags par 'dod pa kun tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: des de dag nyid la rang bzhin gyis so sor ma brtags par 'dod pa kun tu gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the natural, spontaneous desire to do so without any analysis.

original: sbyor bas dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: sbyor bas dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is virtue through application?

original: skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa la brten nas dge ba bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa la brten nas dge ba bsgom pa'o //
translated: It is the cultivation of virtue through reliance on good people, through listening to the true Dharma, through proper attention, and through the practice of the teachings in accordance with the teachings.

original: mdun du bya bas dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mdun du bya bas dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is virtue through performance?

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: It is the performance of worship in the presence of the Tathagata,

original: mchod rten nam /
analyzed: mchod rten nam /
translated: or of a stupa,

original: gzugs su byas pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs su byas pa'am /
translated: or of an image,

original: ri mor bris pa mdun du byas sam /
analyzed: ri mor bris pa mdun du byas sam /
translated: or of a painting,

original: chos sam chos kyi gzhi glegs bam mdun du byas te mchod pa'i las byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos sam chos kyi gzhi glegs bam mdun du byas te mchod pa'i las byed pa'o //
translated: or of the Dharma, or of a book of the Dharma.

original: phan 'dogs pas dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pas dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is virtue through service?

original: gang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po dag gis sems can la phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po dag gis sems can la phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: It is the service to beings through the four means of gathering disciples.

original: yongs su 'dzin pas dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pas dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is virtue through possession?

original: gang sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'am /
analyzed: gang sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'am /
translated: It is the performance of meritorious action which results from generosity,

original: tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos pos mtho ris su skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos pos mtho ris su skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'am /
translated: The merit that results from morality is the cause for taking up a rebirth in the heavens,

original: phyug po dang rigs mthon por skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: phyug po dang rigs mthon por skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'am /
translated: or for taking up a rebirth in a wealthy family, or in a family of high caste,

original: rnam par byang ba'i rjes su mthun pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i rjes su mthun pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: or for taking up a rebirth that is favorable to purification.

original: gnyen pos dge ba gang zhe na /ðŸ”½gang rnam par sun 'byin pa gnyen po dang / spong ba gnyen po dang / gzhi gnyen po dang / thag sring ba gnyen po dang / rnam par gnon pa gnyen po dang / bral ba gnyen po dang / nyon mongs pa'i @62a * //
analyzed: gnyen pos dge ba gang zhe na / gang rnam par sun 'byin pa gnyen po dang / spong ba gnyen po dang / gzhi gnyen po dang / thag sring ba gnyen po dang / rnam par gnon pa gnyen po dang / bral ba gnyen po dang / nyon mongs pa'i @62a * //
translated: What is virtue that consists of counteracting?

original: sgrib pa'i gnyen po dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i gnyen po dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: It is the antidote of rejection, the antidote of separation, the antidote of reliance, the antidote of distance, the antidote of suppression, the antidote of eradication, the antidote of immutability, the antidote of the defilements, and the antidote of the knowable.

original: nye bar zhi bas dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar zhi bas dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is virtue that consists of appeasement?

original: gang 'dod chags mtha' dag spong ba dang / zhe sdang mtha' dag spong ba dang / gti mug mtha' dag spong ba dang / nyon mongs pa mtha' dag spong ba dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: gang 'dod chags mtha' dag spong ba dang / zhe sdang mtha' dag spong ba dang / gti mug mtha' dag spong ba dang / nyon mongs pa mtha' dag spong ba dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang /
translated: the abandonment of all attachment, the abandonment of all hatred, the abandonment of all delusion, the abandonment of all defilements, the cessation of perception and feeling, the realm of Nirvana with remainder,

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: the realm of Nirvana without remainder, and non-abiding Nirvana.

original: rgyu mthun pas dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pas dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is virtue as natural outcome?

original: nye bar zhi ba thob pa de'i dbang gis yon tan khyad par can 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mngon par shes pa la sogs pa thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa rnams so //ðŸ”½ji ltar na mi dge ba yin /
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba thob pa de'i dbang gis yon tan khyad par can 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mngon par shes pa la sogs pa thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa rnams so // ji ltar na mi dge ba yin /
translated: It consists of the special qualities of the mundane and supramundane superknowledges, etc., common and uncommon, which are obtained by the power of the attainment of peace.ðŸ”½What is non-virtue?

original: mi dge ba rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir mi dge bar brtag ce na /
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir mi dge bar brtag ce na /
translated: How many are non-virtuous? With what aim is that which is non-virtuous investigated?

original: ngo bo nyid dang / 'brel pa dang / rjes su 'brel pa dang / slong ba dang / don dam pa dang / skye bas 'thob pa dang / sbyor ba dang / mdun du bya ba dang / gnod pa byed pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / 'brel pa dang / rjes su 'brel pa dang / slong ba dang / don dam pa dang / skye bas 'thob pa dang / sbyor ba dang / mdun du bya ba dang / gnod pa byed pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
translated: 1. by nature, 2. by relationship, 3. by association, 4. by origin, 5. by the absolute, 6. by acquisition through birth, 7. by application, 8. by what is to be done, 9. by harm, 10. by possession,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / bar du gcod pas kyang mi dge bar blta'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / bar du gcod pas kyang mi dge bar blta'o //
translated: 11. by adverse elements, and 12. by obstacles.

original: phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / skye mched bzhi'i phyogs so //
analyzed: phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / skye mched bzhi'i phyogs so //
translated: The aggregates, ten elements, and four spheres.

original: bdag chos ma yin pa dang ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag chos ma yin pa dang ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self provided with what is not Dharma.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis mi dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis mi dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is unwholesome by nature?

original: yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong ba'o //
analyzed: yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / nyes par spyod pa kun nas slong ba'o //
translated: It is the instigation to misconduct, with the exception of the defilements associated with the mental consciousness, and of the defilements of the realms of form and of the formless.

original: 'brel bas mi dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel bas mi dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is unwholesome by relationship?

original: nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: They are the dharmas associated with the defilements and the secondary defilements.

original: rjes su 'brel bas mi dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su 'brel bas mi dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the unwholesome by connection?

original: de dag nyid kyi bag chags so //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi bag chags so //
translated: It is the residues of the defilements and the secondary defilements.

original: slong bas mi dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: slong bas mi dge ba gang zhe na /

original: des kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las so //
analyzed: des kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las so //
translated: It is the actions of body and speech instigated by them.

original: don dam par mi dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: don dam par mi dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the unwholesome by ultimate effect?

original: 'khor ba thams cad do //
analyzed: 'khor ba thams cad do //
translated: It is all the sufferings of transmigration.

analyzed: des @62b mi dge ba nyid la 'dod pa kun tu gnas pa'o //

original: sbyor bas mi dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: sbyor bas mi dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the unwholesome by performance?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the performance of the unwholesome.

original: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la brten nas /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la brten nas /
translated: It is the performance of the unwholesome by relying on the company of bad people, by listening to false teachings, and by wrong application of the mind.

analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa spyod pa dang / ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyad pa spyod pa'o //

original: mdun du bya bas mi dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mdun du bya bas mi dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is unwholesome by being in front?

original: lus kyis nyes par spyod pa spyad pa'am /
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyod pa spyad pa'am /
translated: and to worship it with offerings,

original: ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod pa spyod pas ngan 'gro'am bde 'gror 'bras bu mi 'dod pa'i 'phel pa'am /
analyzed: ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod pa spyod pas ngan 'gro'am bde 'gror 'bras bu mi 'dod pa'i 'phel pa'am /
translated: By engaging in verbal and mental negative actions, one will experience the result of unwanted increase in the lower or higher realms.

original: yongs su rdzogs par byed pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par byed pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the cause of the increase and completion of the undesirable results of the bad destinies and good destinies, by means of the practice of bad conduct of body, speech and mind.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is unwholesome by being adverse?

original: gnyen po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos gang yin pa dag go //
analyzed: gnyen po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos gang yin pa dag go //
translated: It is any adverse element to the wholesome.

original: bar du gcod pas mi dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: bar du gcod pas mi dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is unwholesome by being an obstruction?

original: dge ba'i bar chad byed pa'i chos gang yin pa dag go //
analyzed: dge ba'i bar chad byed pa'i chos gang yin pa dag go //
translated: It is any element which obstructs the wholesome.

original: ji ltar na lung du ma bstan pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na lung du ma bstan pa yin /
translated: What is neutral?

original: lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir lung du ma bstan par brtag ce na /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir lung du ma bstan par brtag ce na /
translated: How many are neutral? With what aim is that which is neutral investigated?

original: ngo bo nyid dang / 'brel pa dang / rjes su 'brel pa dang / slong ba dang / don dam pa dang ; skye bas 'thob pa dang / sbyor ba dang / mdun du bya ba dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / nye bar spyod pa dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / 'brel pa dang / rjes su 'brel pa dang / slong ba dang / don dam pa dang ; skye bas 'thob pa dang / sbyor ba dang / mdun du bya ba dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / nye bar spyod pa dang /
translated: That which is neutral should be understood as to its own-nature, as to its relation, as to its connection, as to its origin, as to its absolute aspect, as to its acquisition by birth, as to its application, as to its service, as to its enjoyment, as to its retribution, as to its transcendence.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gnyen po dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / rgyu mthun pas kyang lung du ma bstan par blta'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gnyen po dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / rgyu mthun pas kyang lung du ma bstan par blta'o //
translated: It should be regarded as neutral through its nature, through its retention, through its antidote, through its pacification, and through its natural outcome.

original: khams brgyad dang / skye mched brgyad dang / phung po dang khams dang skye mched lhag ma rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: khams brgyad dang / skye mched brgyad dang / phung po dang khams dang skye mched lhag ma rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: It is eight elements, eight spheres, and part of the aggregates, elements, and spheres that remain.

original: bdag la chos dang chos ma yin pa dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la chos dang chos ma yin pa dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The purpose is to abandon attachment to a self that is free from virtue and nonvirtue.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis lung du ma bstan pa gang zhe na /ðŸ”½khams dang skye mched gzugs can brgyad dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i yid dang / srog gi dbang po dang / ris mthun pa dang / ming gi @63a * //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis lung du ma bstan pa gang zhe na / khams dang skye mched gzugs can brgyad dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i yid dang / srog gi dbang po dang / ris mthun pa dang / ming gi @63a * //
translated: What is neutral by nature?

original: tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs so //
analyzed: tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs so //
translated: It is the eight physical elements and spheres, the mental faculty with its concomitant factors, the vitality faculty, homogeneity, the collection of names, the collection of phrases, and the collection of letters.

original: 'brel pas lung du ma bstan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pas lung du ma bstan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is neutral through association?

original: sdang ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: sdang ba yang ma yin /
translated: It is neither favorable nor unfavorable.

original: dang ba yang ma yin pa'i sems su gyur pa'i ming dang tshig dang yi ge de dag nyid kyis yongs su zin pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: dang ba yang ma yin pa'i sems su gyur pa'i ming dang tshig dang yi ge de dag nyid kyis yongs su zin pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: It is the mind and mental activities associated with those names, words, and letters which are neither clear nor unclear.

original: rjes su 'brel pas lung du ma bstan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pas lung du ma bstan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is indeterminate through connection?

original: de dag nyid kyis brjod pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyis brjod pa'i bag chags so //
translated: It is the instinct for verbal expression associated with those.

original: slong bas lung du ma bstan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: slong bas lung du ma bstan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is indeterminate through instigation?

analyzed: / don dam par lung du ma bstan pa gang zhe na /

original: nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'o //
translated: It is space and non-analytical cessation.

original: skye bas 'thob pa'i lung du ma bstan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: skye bas 'thob pa'i lung du ma bstan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is indeterminate through acquisition?

analyzed: yang bstan pas kyang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan par blta ste /
translated: Moreover, the wholesome, the unwholesome, and the non-defined should be understood as being revealed.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' dam pa'i pha rol tu son pa rnams kyis sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir ston pa ste /
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' dam pa'i pha rol tu son pa rnams kyis sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir ston pa ste /
translated: It is that which the Buddhas and the Bodhisattvas who have attained perfection reveal for the benefit of beings.

original: de na de dag de bzhin du yongs su grub pa ni gang yang med do //ðŸ”½ji ltar na 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa yin /
analyzed: de na de dag de bzhin du yongs su grub pa ni gang yang med do // ji ltar na 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa yin /
translated: But in reality, there is nothing that is revealed.ðŸ”½How many are related to the realm of desire?
