analyzed: 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan par brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim is that which is related to the realm of desire investigated?

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang / mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa ni 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa blta'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang / mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa ni 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa blta'o //
translated: That which is wholesome, unwholesome, or non-defined, but not free from the craving of the realm of desire, is related to the realm of desire.

original: khams bzhi dang / skye mched gnyis dang / de las gzhan pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: khams bzhi dang / skye mched gnyis dang / de las gzhan pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: four elements, two spheres, and part of the other aggregates, elements and spheres.

original: bdag 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self not free from desire.

original: ji ltar na gzugs dang rab tu ldan pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzugs dang rab tu ldan pa yin /
translated: What is associated with form?

original: gzugs dang rab tu ldan pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir gzugs dang rab tu ldan par brtag ce na /
analyzed: gzugs dang rab tu ldan pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir gzugs dang rab tu ldan par brtag ce na /
translated: How many are associated with form? With what aim is that which is associated with form investigated?

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral la //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral la //
translated: That which is not free from desire for the realm of desire

original: gzugs la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa ni gzugs dang rab tu ldan par blta'o //
analyzed: gzugs la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa ni gzugs dang rab tu ldan par blta'o //
translated: and is wholesome and non-defined is associated with form.

original: khams bzhi dang skye mched gnyis ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa'i phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: khams bzhi dang skye mched gnyis ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa'i phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: Part of the other aggregates, elements and spheres, with the exception of the four elements and two spheres.

original: bdag 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: with the aim of abandoning attachment to a self free from desire.

original: ji ltar na gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa yin /
translated: What is associated with the formless?ðŸ”½How many are associated with the formless?

original: gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan par brtag ce na /ðŸ”½gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral la /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan par brtag ce na / gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral la /
translated: With what aim is that which is associated with the formless investigated?ðŸ”½That which is wholesome and indeterminate is associated with the formless.

original: gzugs med pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa ni gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa blta'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa ni gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa blta'o //
translated: It is associated with the formless when one is free from attachment to the realm of form but not free from attachment to the formless realm.

original: phung po bzhi dang / khams gsum dang @64a * //
analyzed: phung po bzhi dang / khams gsum dang @64a * //
translated: It is the four aggregates, three elements,

original: skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs so //
translated: two sense spheres,

original: bdag gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ðŸ”½'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyang /
analyzed: bdag gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ðŸ”½'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyang /
translated: with the aim of abandoning attachment to a self free from attachment to the realm of form.

original: phyogs gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / mtha' dag las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang ; rtogs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / gnod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / legs par bton pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du blta'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / mtha' dag las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang ; rtogs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / gnod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / legs par bton pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du blta'o //
translated: It should be regarded as freedom from attachment to one side, freedom from attachment to the whole, freedom from attachment through realization, freedom from attachment through harm, and freedom from attachment through good advice.

original: yang 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid bcu ste /
analyzed: yang 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid bcu ste /
translated: Again, there are ten kinds of freedom from attachment:

original: rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / gnod pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / nye bar brtan pas 'dod chags bral ba nyid dang / phul du byung bas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / rmongs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / gnod pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / nye bar brtan pas 'dod chags bral ba nyid dang / phul du byung bas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / rmongs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: freedom from attachment by nature, freedom from attachment through harm, freedom from attachment through stability, freedom from attachment through excellence, freedom from attachment through delusion, freedom from attachment through the path, freedom from attachment through the antidote, freedom from attachment through the object, freedom from attachment through the basis, and freedom from attachment through the root.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / yongs su shes pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / spad bas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / gong ma dang bcas pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / gong na med pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / yongs su shes pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / spad bas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / gong ma dang bcas pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / gong na med pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: detachment through natural purity, detachment through complete knowledge, detachment through abandonment, detachment through the higher, and detachment through the absence of higher.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is detachment through natural purity?

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang ; sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i gnas kyi chos rnams la gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang ; sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i gnas kyi chos rnams la gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: It is the absence of attachment to painful feelings and to the things which cause painful feelings.

original: gnod pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnod pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is detachment through the absence of injury?

original: 'khrig pa la zhugs pa gdung ba dang bral nas gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'khrig pa la zhugs pa gdung ba dang bral nas gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: It is the absence of attachment to the absence of desire, having been freed from the burning of desire.

original: nye bar brtan pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar brtan pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is detachment through stability?

original: 'brangs par bzos pa zas zhim po la yang gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'brangs par bzos pa zas zhim po la yang gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: It is the fact that one does not accept the food of the saints when one is in the stage of the vehicle of the disciples.

original: phul du byung bas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang zhe na /ðŸ”½thabs shin tu chen po thob pa /
analyzed: phul du byung bas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang zhe na / thabs shin tu chen po thob pa /
translated: What is detachment through excellence?

original: thabs dma' ba la gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do /
analyzed: thabs dma' ba la gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do /
translated: It is the fact that one does not accept the means of the disciples when one has attained the great means.

original: rmongs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: rmongs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is detachment through ignorance?

original: byis pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa la gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: byis pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa la gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: It is the fact that fools do not accept Nirvana.

original: gnyen pos 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyen pos 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is detachment through the counteractives?

original: 'jig rten pa'am 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi nyon mongs pa spong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'am 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi nyon mongs pa spong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the abandoning of the defilements by the worldly or transcendental path.

original: yongs su shes pas 'dod chags dang @64b bral ba nyid gang zhe na /ðŸ”½mthong ba'i lam thob pa /
analyzed: yongs su shes pas 'dod chags dang @64b bral ba nyid gang zhe na / mthong ba'i lam thob pa /
translated: What is detachment through complete knowledge?

original: khams gsum pa la gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: khams gsum pa la gang mi 'phrod par 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: It is the fact that one who has attained the path of insight does not accept the three realms.

original: spong bas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: spong bas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is detachment through abandoning?

original: sa dang sar nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ba'i mi mthun par 'dzin pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang sar nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ba'i mi mthun par 'dzin pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the fact of being opposed to the abandonment of the defilements on the different stages.

original: gong ma dang bcas pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: gong ma dang bcas pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the detachment of those who are not free from the higher stages?

original: 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the detachment of the worldly, of the Sravakas and of the Pratyekabuddhas.

original: gong na med pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: gong na med pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the detachment of those who are free from the higher stages?

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the detachment of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the basis of the happiness and benefit of all beings.

original: ji ltar na slob pa yin /ðŸ”½slob pa rnams ni du zhib //
analyzed: ji ltar na slob pa yin / slob pa rnams ni du zhib //
translated: What is a person in training?ðŸ”½How many are in training?

original: ci'i phyir slob par brtag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir slob par brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim is a person in training investigated?

original: thar pa la brtson pa'i dge ba ni slob par blta'o //
analyzed: thar pa la brtson pa'i dge ba ni slob par blta'o //
translated: A person in training should be understood as a virtuous person who is intent on liberation.

original: phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / skye mched bzhi'i phyogs so //
analyzed: phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / skye mched bzhi'i phyogs so //
translated: It is part of the aggregates, of ten elements and of four spheres.

original: bdag thar pa la brtson par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag thar pa la brtson par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: with the aim of abandoning attachment to a self striving for liberation.

original: ji ltar na mi slob pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na mi slob pa yin /
translated: What is not a learner?

original: mi slob pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir mi slob par brtag ce na /
analyzed: mi slob pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir mi slob par brtag ce na /
translated: How many are not learners? With what aim is that which is not a learner investigated?

original: bslab pa mthar phyin pa'i dge ba ni mi slob par blta'o //
analyzed: bslab pa mthar phyin pa'i dge ba ni mi slob par blta'o //
translated: That which is favorable to the completion of the training should be understood as not a learner.

original: phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / skye mched bzhi'i phyogs so //
analyzed: phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / skye mched bzhi'i phyogs so //
translated: It is part of the aggregates, of ten elements and of four spheres.

original: bdag grol bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ðŸ”½ji ltar na slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: bdag grol bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin /
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a liberated self.ðŸ”½What is neither a learner nor a post-learner?

original: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin par brtag ce na /
analyzed: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin par brtag ce na /
translated: How many are neither learners nor post-learners? With what aim is that which is neither a learner nor a post-learner investigated?

original: so so'i skye bo'i dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang / slob pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / mi slob pa'i lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'dus ma byas ni slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin par blta'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang / slob pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / mi slob pa'i lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'dus ma byas ni slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin par blta'o //
translated: The wholesome, unwholesome and neutral factors of ordinary people, the defiled and neutral factors of those in training, the neutral factors of those beyond training, and the unconditioned factors are not factors of those in training or of those beyond training.

original: khams brgyad dang / skye mched brgyad dang / de las gzhan pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: khams brgyad dang / skye mched brgyad dang / de las gzhan pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: Eight elements, eight spheres, and part of the aggregates, elements and spheres which remain.

original: bdag grul ba ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ðŸ”½ji ltar na mthong ba bas spang bar bya ba yin /ðŸ”½mthong bas spang bar bya ba @65a * //
analyzed: bdag grul ba ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na mthong ba bas spang bar bya ba yin / mthong bas spang bar bya ba @65a * //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is not a receptacle.ðŸ”½What is to be abandoned by means of vision?ðŸ”½How many [of the aggregates, etc.] are to be abandoned by means of vision?

original: rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya bar brtag ce na /
analyzed: rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya bar brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim is that which is to be abandoned by means of vision investigated?

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba kun tu brtags pa rnams dang / the tshom dang lta ba'i gnas dang lta ba la log par zhugs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa dag dang / gang yang lta bas kun nas bslang ba'i lus kyi las dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba kun tu brtags pa rnams dang / the tshom dang lta ba'i gnas dang lta ba la log par zhugs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa dag dang / gang yang lta bas kun nas bslang ba'i lus kyi las dang /
translated: The afflicted views are the imaginary views. Doubt and the defilements and secondary defilements which are associated with the views and which are the basis of the views and the entry into the views.ðŸ”½The bodily and vocal actions which are projected by the views,

original: dag gi las dang / ngan song ba'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched thams cad ni mthong ba spang bar bya bar blta'o //
analyzed: dag gi las dang / ngan song ba'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched thams cad ni mthong ba spang bar bya bar blta'o //
translated: all the aggregates, elements and spheres of the unfortunate planes of existence should be understood as being abandoned by means of vision.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: One part of all.

original: bdag mthong ba phun sum tshogs par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ðŸ”½ji ltar na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin /
analyzed: bdag mthong ba phun sum tshogs par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin /
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a perfect self endowed with vision.ðŸ”½What is to be abandoned by mental cultivation?ðŸ”½How many should be abandoned by mental cultivation?

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya bar brtag ce na /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya bar brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim is that which is to be abandoned by mental cultivation investigated?

original: mthong ba'i lam thob pa de yan chad kyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba las bzlog pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams so ;
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam thob pa de yan chad kyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba las bzlog pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams so ;
translated: They are the impure factors which are the opposite of the factors to be abandoned by insight, and which are higher than the acquisition of the path of insight.

original: / thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: / thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: They are a part of all.

original: bdag sgom pa phun sum tshogs par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ðŸ”½ji ltar na spang bar bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: bdag sgom pa phun sum tshogs par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na spang bar bya ba ma yin /
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is endowed with perfect meditation.ðŸ”½What are the factors which should not be abandoned?ðŸ”½How many should not be abandoned?

original: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir spang bar bya ba ma yin par brtag ce na /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir spang bar bya ba ma yin par brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim are the factors which should not be abandoned investigated?

original: zag pa med pa ni spang bar bya ba ma yin par blta'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni spang bar bya ba ma yin par blta'o //
translated: The pure factors should be understood as those which should not be abandoned.

original: des par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ma gtogs par phung po rnams dang / khams gsum dang / skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: des par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ma gtogs par phung po rnams dang / khams gsum dang / skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs so //
translated: They are a part of the aggregates, of three elements and of two spheres, with the exception of the part of the aggregates which is conducive to penetration.

original: bdag grub par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag grub par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is accomplished.

original: ji ltar na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin /
translated: What is origination in dependence?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar brtag ce na /ðŸ”½mtshan nyid dang / yan lag rnam par dbye ba dang / yan lag mdor bsdu pa dang / yan lag rkyen nyid du rnam par gzhag pa dang / yan lag gi las rnam par gzhag pa dang / yan lag kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu ba dang /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar brtag ce na / mtshan nyid dang / yan lag rnam par dbye ba dang / yan lag mdor bsdu pa dang / yan lag rkyen nyid du rnam par gzhag pa dang / yan lag gi las rnam par gzhag pa dang / yan lag kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu ba dang /
translated: How many are dependent origination? With what aim is dependent origination investigated?

original: don dang / zab pa dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun pas kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar blta'o //
analyzed: don dang / zab pa dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun pas kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar blta'o //
translated: Dependent origination should be understood by its characteristics, by its members, by its classification, by its synonyms, by its order of sequence, by its defilement, by its purification, by its profundity, by its analysis, by its conformity, and by its nonconformity.

original: chos kyi khams dang / chos kyi skye mched kyi phyogs gcig ma gtogs pa thams cad do /
analyzed: chos kyi khams dang / chos kyi skye mched kyi phyogs gcig ma gtogs pa thams cad do /
translated: All, with the exception of part of the element and the sphere of mental objects.

original: @65b bdag dang chos rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @65b bdag dang chos rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is not a cause or an absurd cause of the world.

original: mtshan nyid kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is its definition?

original: g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba dang / mi rtag pa'i rkyen las byung ba dang / nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ro //ðŸ”½yan lag rnam par dbye bas ji ltar bu zhe na /ðŸ”½yan lag bcu gnyis rnams te /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba dang / mi rtag pa'i rkyen las byung ba dang / nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ro // yan lag rnam par dbye bas ji ltar bu zhe na / yan lag bcu gnyis rnams te /
translated: because they arise from conditions that are not moving, from conditions that are impermanent, and from conditions that are capable.ðŸ”½How so by the analysis of the members?ðŸ”½The members are twelve.ðŸ”½

original: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: ignorance, conditioning, and consciousness.

original: 'phags pa'i yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the noble limbs?

original: ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba'o //
translated: Name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, and feeling.

original: mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the limbs that produce?

original: sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa'o //
translated: Craving, grasping, and becoming.

original: mngon par grub pa'i yan lag gang zhen /
analyzed: mngon par grub pa'i yan lag gang zhen /
translated: What are the limbs that are produced?

original: skye ba dang / rga shi'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga shi'o //
translated: Birth and old age and death.

original: yan lag rkyen nyid du rnam par bzhag pas ji ltar bu zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag rkyen nyid du rnam par bzhag pas ji ltar bu zhe na /
translated: How are the limbs established as conditions?

original: bag chags dang / shugs dang / yid la byed pa dang / lhan cig 'byung bas kyang yan lag rnams rkyen nyid du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bag chags dang / shugs dang / yid la byed pa dang / lhan cig 'byung bas kyang yan lag rnams rkyen nyid du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The limbs are established as conditions through the power of habitual practice, the power of impetus, the power of attention, and the power of simultaneous arising.

original: de yang ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: This should be understood according to the circumstances.

original: yan lag gi las rnam par gzhan pas ji ltar bu zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag gi las rnam par gzhan pas ji ltar bu zhe na /
translated: How are the limbs distinguished by their functions?

original: ma rig pa ci'i las can zhe na /
analyzed: ma rig pa ci'i las can zhe na /
translated: What is the function of ignorance?

original: srid pa la sems can rnams rmongs par byed pa dang / 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen kyang yin no //
analyzed: srid pa la sems can rnams rmongs par byed pa dang / 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen kyang yin no //
translated: It causes beings to be confused about existence and is the condition for the formations.

original: 'du byed ci'i las can zhe na /
analyzed: 'du byed ci'i las can zhe na /
translated: What is the function of the formations?

original: 'gro ba rnams su sems can dag rnam par 'byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kyi rkyen kyang yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams su sems can dag rnam par 'byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kyi rkyen kyang yin no //
translated: They cause beings to be distributed in the different destinies and are the condition for the propensities of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ci'i las can zhes na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ci'i las can zhes na /
translated: What is the function of consciousness?

original: sems can rnams kyi las 'ching ba 'dzin pa dang / ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen kyang yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las 'ching ba 'dzin pa dang / ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen kyang yin no //
translated: It causes beings to be bound by the fetters of action and is the condition for name-and-form.

original: ming dang gzugs ci'i las can zhe na /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ci'i las can zhe na /
translated: What is the function of name-and-form?

original: sems can rnams @66a * //
analyzed: sems can rnams @66a * //
translated: It causes beings to

original: lus len du 'jug pa dang / skye mched drug gi rkyen kyang yin no //
analyzed: lus len du 'jug pa dang / skye mched drug gi rkyen kyang yin no //
translated: enter into the womb and is the condition for the six sense bases.

original: skye mched drug ci'i las can zhe na /
analyzed: skye mched drug ci'i las can zhe na /
translated: What is the function of the six sense bases?

original: sems can rnams lus yongs su rdzogs par len du 'jug pa dang / reg pa'i rkyen kyang yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams lus yongs su rdzogs par len du 'jug pa dang / reg pa'i rkyen kyang yin no //
translated: They cause beings to enter into the complete body and are the condition for contact.

original: reg pa ci'i las can zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa ci'i las can zhe na /
translated: What is the function of contact?

original: yul gyi longs spyod la sems can rnams 'dzud pa dang / tshor ba'i rkyen kyang yin no //
analyzed: yul gyi longs spyod la sems can rnams 'dzud pa dang / tshor ba'i rkyen kyang yin no //
translated: It causes sentient beings to enter into the enjoyment of objects and it is also the condition of sensation.

original: tshor ba ci'i las can zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba ci'i las can zhe na /
translated: What is the function of sensation?

original: skye ba'i longs spyod la sems can rnams 'dzud pa dang / sred pa'i rkyen kyang yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i longs spyod la sems can rnams 'dzud pa dang / sred pa'i rkyen kyang yin no //
translated: It causes sentient beings to enter into the enjoyment of birth and it is also the condition of craving.

original: sred pa ci'i las can zhe na /
analyzed: sred pa ci'i las can zhe na /
translated: What is the function of craving?

original: sems can rnams kyi skye ba 'dren pa dang / len pa'i rkyen kyang yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi skye ba 'dren pa dang / len pa'i rkyen kyang yin no //
translated: It causes sentient beings to be led to birth and it is also the condition of grasping.

original: len pa ci'i las can zhe na /
analyzed: len pa ci'i las can zhe na /
translated: What is the function of grasping?

original: yang srid pa len pa'i phyir sems can rnams kyi rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa dang bcas par byed pa dang / srid pa'i rkyen kyang yin no //
analyzed: yang srid pa len pa'i phyir sems can rnams kyi rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa dang bcas par byed pa dang / srid pa'i rkyen kyang yin no //
translated: It causes the consciousness of sentient beings to be associated with appropriation in order to appropriate a new existence and it is also the condition of becoming.

original: srid pa ci'i las can zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa ci'i las can zhe na /
translated: What is the function of becoming?

original: yang srid par sems can rnams mngon du phyogs par byed pa dang / skye ba'i rkyen kyang yin no //
analyzed: yang srid par sems can rnams mngon du phyogs par byed pa dang / skye ba'i rkyen kyang yin no //
translated: It causes sentient beings to be directed towards a new existence and it is also the condition of birth.

original: skye ba ci'i las can zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba ci'i las can zhe na /
translated: What is the function of birth?

original: ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / rig pa dang / tshor ba'i rim gyis sems can rnams mngon par 'grub par byed pa dang / rga shi'i rkyen kyang yin no //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / rig pa dang / tshor ba'i rim gyis sems can rnams mngon par 'grub par byed pa dang / rga shi'i rkyen kyang yin no //
translated: and the six sense bases, contact, feeling, birth, and aging-and-death.

original: rga shi ci'i las can zhe na /
analyzed: rga shi ci'i las can zhe na /
translated: What is the function of aging-and-death?

original: yang dang yang na tshod 'gyur ba dang / srog 'gyur ba la sems can rnams sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang na tshod 'gyur ba dang / srog 'gyur ba la sems can rnams sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is the aging of living beings again and again, and their death, and the connection between one birth and the next.

original: yan lag kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu bas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu bas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are the members classified according to their defilement?

original: ma rig pa gang yin pa dang / sred pa gang yin pa dang / len pa gang yin pa 'di ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa gang yin pa dang / sred pa gang yin pa dang / len pa gang yin pa 'di ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu'o //
translated: Ignorance, craving, and grasping are classified as the defilement of the defilements.

original: 'du byed gang yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / srid pa gang yin pa 'di ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: 'du byed gang yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa dang / srid pa gang yin pa 'di ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bsdu'o //
translated: Formations and consciousness are classified as the defilement of action.

original: lhag ma rnams ni tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu'o //
translated: The remaining members are classified as the defilement of suffering.

original: don gyis ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: don gyis ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are they classified according to their meaning?

original: byed pa po med pa'i don ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don dang / rgyu dang bcas pa las byung ba'i don dang / sems can med pa'i don dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi don dang / g-yo ba med pa'i don dang / mi rtag pa'i don dang /
analyzed: byed pa po med pa'i don ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don dang / rgyu dang bcas pa las byung ba'i don dang / sems can med pa'i don dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi don dang / g-yo ba med pa'i don dang / mi rtag pa'i don dang /
translated: The meaning of â€œno creatorâ€ is the meaning of â€œdependent origination,â€ the meaning of â€œarising from causes,â€ the meaning of â€œno sentient beings,â€ the meaning of â€œother-powered,â€ the meaning of â€œunmoving,â€ the meaning of â€œimpermanent,â€

original: skad cig pa'i don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyud rgyun mi 'chad pa'i don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bur @66b mthun pa'i don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu sna tshogs kyi don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu so sor nges pa'i don ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don to //
analyzed: skad cig pa'i don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyud rgyun mi 'chad pa'i don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bur @66b mthun pa'i don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu sna tshogs kyi don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu so sor nges pa'i don ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning of â€œmomentary,â€ the meaning of â€œthe continuity of cause and effect is uninterrupted,â€ the meaning of â€œcause and effect are concordant,â€ the meaning of â€œcause and effect are various,â€ and the meaning of â€œcause and effect are individually distinct.â€

original: zab pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: zab pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it profound?

original: rgyus zab pa dang / mtshan nyid kyis zab pa dang / skye bas zab pa dang / gnas pas zab pa dang / 'byung bas zab pas kyang zab par blta'o //
analyzed: rgyus zab pa dang / mtshan nyid kyis zab pa dang / skye bas zab pa dang / gnas pas zab pa dang / 'byung bas zab pas kyang zab par blta'o //
translated: It should be seen as profound due to the profundity of its causes, the profundity of its characteristics, the profundity of its arising, the profundity of its abiding, and the profundity of its manifestation.

original: yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skad cig pa yang yin la /
analyzed: yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skad cig pa yang yin la /
translated: Moreover, dependent origination is momentary,

original: gnas par yang dmigs /ðŸ”½rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las 'byung ba'ang yin la /
analyzed: gnas par yang dmigs / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las 'byung ba'ang yin la /
translated: It is also observed to be enduring.ðŸ”½It is also observed to arise from conditions that are not moving,

original: nus pa'i rkyen las 'byung bar yang dmigs /
analyzed: nus pa'i rkyen las 'byung bar yang dmigs /
translated: and it is also observed to arise from conditions that are able to produce.ðŸ”½It is also observed to be dependently arisen, without sentient beings,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sems can med pa yang yin la sems can du yang dmigs /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sems can med pa yang yin la sems can du yang dmigs /
translated: and it is also observed to have sentient beings.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba byed pa po yang med la /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba byed pa po yang med la /
translated: It is also observed to be dependently arisen, without a creator,

original: las dang 'bras bu chud mi za bar yang dmigs shing bdag las ma yin gzhan las ma yin gnyi ga las ma yin /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu chud mi za bar yang dmigs shing bdag las ma yin gzhan las ma yin gnyi ga las ma yin /
translated: and it is also observed that actions and results are not lost, and that they are not self-produced, not produced by another, not produced by both,

original: rang gi byed pa dang / gzhan gyi byed pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi byed pa dang / gzhan gyi byed pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: not produced by oneâ€™s own action, not produced by the action of another, and not produced without a cause.

original: de'i phyir zab pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zab pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is profound.

original: rab tu dbye bas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu dbye bas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it profound in terms of its divisions?

original: rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang / phyi'i lo tog 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang / 'jig pa dang chags pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / zas kyis brtan pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang / phyi'i lo tog 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang / 'jig pa dang chags pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / zas kyis brtan pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang /
translated: the differentiation of the arising of consciousness, the differentiation of death, transmigration, and rebirth, the differentiation of the arising of external crops, the differentiation of dissolution and evolution, the differentiation of the stability of food,

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'gro ba rnam par 'byed pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam par dag pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / mthu stobs kyi rab tu dbye bas kyang rab tu dbye bar blta'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'gro ba rnam par 'byed pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam par dag pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / mthu stobs kyi rab tu dbye bas kyang rab tu dbye bar blta'o //
translated: the differentiation of the distinction between desirable and undesirable destinies, the differentiation of purification, and the differentiation of power.

original: lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How so, by conformity and nonconformity?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pas kyang /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pas kyang /
translated: By conformity and nonconformity with the defilement aspect and by conformity and nonconformity with the purification aspect.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pa bstan par blta'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pa bstan par blta'o //
translated: The forward and reverse processes of dependent origination should be understood as the teaching of the conformity and nonconformity with the truth.

original: ji ltar na rkyen yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na rkyen yin /
translated: What is a condition?ðŸ”½How many are conditions?

original: rkyen rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir rkyen du brtag ce na /
analyzed: rkyen rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir rkyen du brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim is a condition investigated?

original: rgyu dang de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang bdag pos kyang rkyen du blta'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang bdag pos kyang rkyen du blta'o //
translated: A condition should be understood as cause, immediate relationship, objective support, and predominance.

original: thams cad kyang rkyen du blta'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang rkyen du blta'o //
translated: All are conditions.

original: chos bdag gi rgyu las byung bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos bdag gi rgyu las byung bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to the self as the cause of things.

original: rgyu'i rkyen gang zhe na @67a * //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen gang zhe na @67a * //
translated: What is a causal condition?

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang dge ba'i bag chags so //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang dge ba'i bag chags so //
translated: The causal condition should be understood as the storeconsciousness and the wholesome permeation.

original: yang ngo bo nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / grogs dang / mthun par rtogs pa dang / rgyas pa dang / bar du gcod pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pas kyang rgyu'i rkyen du blta'o //
analyzed: yang ngo bo nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / grogs dang / mthun par rtogs pa dang / rgyas pa dang / bar du gcod pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pas kyang rgyu'i rkyen du blta'o //
translated: Moreover, the causal condition should be understood as essence, classification, aid, concordance in realization, increase, obstruction, and appropriation.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How as essence?

original: byed rgyu ste rgyu'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: byed rgyu ste rgyu'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It is the efficient cause, the nature of cause.

original: rab tu dbye bas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu dbye bas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are they classified?ðŸ”½

original: 'byung ba'i byed rgyu ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i byed rgyu ni /
translated: What is the cause of origination?

original: dper na rnam par shes pa'i ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rnam par shes pa'i ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The cause of origination is like the totality of conditions for consciousness.ðŸ”½What is the cause of continuance?

original: gnas pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na sems can byung ba rnams dang 'byung bar 'dod pa rnams kyi zas lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na sems can byung ba rnams dang 'byung bar 'dod pa rnams kyi zas lta bu'o //
translated: The cause of continuance is like food for sentient beings who have been born and for those who desire birth.ðŸ”½What is the cause of support?

original: rten pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na sems can rnams kyis lta bu'o //
analyzed: rten pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na sems can rnams kyis lta bu'o //
translated: The cause of support is like the earth for sentient beings.

original: gsal ba'i byed rgyu ni /
analyzed: gsal ba'i byed rgyu ni /
translated: What is the cause of manifestation?

original: dper na gzugs rnams kyi sgron ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs rnams kyi sgron ma lta bu'o //
translated: The cause of manifestation is like a lamp for forms.

original: 'gyur ba'i byed rgyu ni /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i byed rgyu ni /
translated: What is the cause of transformation?

original: dper na shing gi me lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shing gi me lta bu'o //
translated: The cause of transformation is like fire for wood.

original: 'bral ba'i byed rgyu ni /
analyzed: 'bral ba'i byed rgyu ni /
translated: What is the cause of separation?

original: dper na rnga bar byed pa'i zor ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rnga bar byed pa'i zor ba lta bu'o //
translated: The cause of separation is like a sickle for cutting.

original: bsgyur ba'i byed rgyu ni /
analyzed: bsgyur ba'i byed rgyu ni /
translated: What is the cause of change?

original: dper na gser la sogs pa'i bzo'i gnas la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gser la sogs pa'i bzo'i gnas la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The cause of change is like the various crafts of goldsmiths and so on.

original: yid ches pa'i byed rgyu ni /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i byed rgyu ni /
translated: What is the cause of conviction?

original: dper na me'i du ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na me'i du ba lta bu'o //
translated: The cause of conviction is like smoke for fire.

original: yid ches par byed pa'i byed rgyu ni /
analyzed: yid ches par byed pa'i byed rgyu ni /
translated: What is the cause of the production of conviction?

original: dper na bsgrub pa'i dam bca' ba dang / gtan tshigs dang dpe rnams lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bsgrub pa'i dam bca' ba dang / gtan tshigs dang dpe rnams lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the thesis to be established, the reason, and the example.

original: 'thob pa'i byed rgyu ni /
analyzed: 'thob pa'i byed rgyu ni /
translated: The causal condition of attainment is

original: dper na mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam lta bu'o //
translated: for example, the path to nirvana.

original: tha snyad kyi byed rgyu ni /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi byed rgyu ni /
translated: The causal condition of designation is

original: dper na ming dang mtshan ma dang / mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ming dang mtshan ma dang / mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: for example, name, sign, and seeing.

original: ltos pa'i byed rgyu ni /
analyzed: ltos pa'i byed rgyu ni /
translated: The causal condition of dependence is

original: gang la ltos nas gang don du gnyer ba 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gang la ltos nas gang don du gnyer ba 'byung ba ste /
translated: that which is sought after in dependence on something.

original: dper na bkres pa la ltos nas zas lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bkres pa la ltos nas zas lta bu'o //
translated: For example, food in dependence on hunger.

original: 'phen pa'i byed rgyu ni /
analyzed: 'phen pa'i byed rgyu ni /
translated: The causal condition of projection is

original: rgyang ring po'i rkyen te /
analyzed: rgyang ring po'i rkyen te /
translated: a remote condition.

original: dper na rga shi'i ma rig pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rga shi'i ma rig pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ignorance in regard to aging and death.

original: mngon pa 'grub pa'i byed rgyu ni nye ba'i rkyen te /
analyzed: mngon pa 'grub pa'i byed rgyu ni nye ba'i rkyen te /
translated: The causal condition of actualization is a proximate condition.

original: dper na 'du byed rnams kyi ma rig pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'du byed rnams kyi ma rig pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ignorance in regard to the formative factors.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i byed rgyu ni de las gzhan pa'i rkyen te /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i byed rgyu ni de las gzhan pa'i rkyen te /
translated: The causal condition of possession is a condition other than those.

original: dper na lo tog 'byung ba'i zhing dang chu dang lud la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lo tog 'byung ba'i zhing dang chu dang lud la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the field, water, fertilizer, and so on, for the production of a crop.

original: chud par byed pa'i byed rgyu ni mthun pa'i rkyen te /
analyzed: chud par byed pa'i byed rgyu ni mthun pa'i rkyen te /
translated: The cause of inclusion is the favorable condition.

original: dper na rgyal po mnyes par byed pa'i phyir rgyal po la legs par brten pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rgyal po mnyes par byed pa'i phyir rgyal po la legs par brten pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the support of a king for one who is pleasing to the king.

original: so sor nges pa'i byed rgyu ni rkyen sna tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i byed rgyu ni rkyen sna tshogs pa ste /
translated: The cause of determination is the various conditions.

original: dper na 'gro ba lnga po dag gi 'gro ba lnga'i rkyen lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'gro ba lnga po dag gi 'gro ba lnga'i rkyen lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the conditions for the five destinies of the five kinds of beings.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i @67b byed rgyu ni rkyen rnams tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i @67b byed rgyu ni rkyen rnams tshogs pa ste /
translated: The cause of association is the collection of conditions.

original: dper na rnam par shes pa'i dbang po ma ma nyams pa dang / yul yang snang ba dang / de skyed pa'i yid la byed pa yang nye bar gnas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rnam par shes pa'i dbang po ma ma nyams pa dang / yul yang snang ba dang / de skyed pa'i yid la byed pa yang nye bar gnas pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the intact sense organ, the presence of an object, and the attention that produces consciousness.

original: mi mthun pa'i byed rgyu ni bar chad byed pa ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i byed rgyu ni bar chad byed pa ste /
translated: The cause of non-association is the obstruction.

original: dper na lo tog la ser ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lo tog la ser ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like hail for a crop.

original: mi mthun pa ma yin pa'i byed rgyu ni bar chad mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa ma yin pa'i byed rgyu ni bar chad mi byed pa ste /
translated: The cause of non-non-association is the non-obstruction.

original: dper na bar chad byed pa de nyid med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bar chad byed pa de nyid med pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the absence of that obstruction.

original: grogs kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: grogs kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of accompaniment?

original: chos gang dag grogs yod na 'byung gi gang yang rung ba ma tshang na ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos gang dag grogs yod na 'byung gi gang yang rung ba ma tshang na ma yin pa ste /
translated: The factors that are produced when their conditions are complete and are not produced when any one of their conditions is not complete.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are they?

original: 'byung ba rnams dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
translated: The primary elements and the derivative form.

original: mthun par rtogs pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mthun par rtogs pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the case of being understood as being in accordance?

original: chos gang dag lhan cig 'byung ba dmigs pa mthun par rtogs kyi /
analyzed: chos gang dag lhan cig 'byung ba dmigs pa mthun par rtogs kyi /
translated: The factors that are produced together and are understood as being in accordance with their object-field.

original: gang yang rung ba ma tshang na ma yin pa ste /ðŸ”½'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba ma tshang na ma yin pa ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: They are not produced when any one of them is not complete.ðŸ”½What are they?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
translated: The mind and the mental factors.

original: rgyas pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rgyas pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the case of being developed?

original: sngon dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos bsgoms pa rnams phyi ma'i mthar gong nas gong du shin tu rgyas pa dang / mchog tu rgyas par 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos bsgoms pa rnams phyi ma'i mthar gong nas gong du shin tu rgyas pa dang / mchog tu rgyas par 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The wholesome, unwholesome, and non-defined factors that have been cultivated in the past and which arise in the future in a more and more advanced state, in a most advanced state.

original: bar du gcod pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bar du gcod pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the case of being interrupted?

original: gang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyud thag bsring ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa gang yang rung ba'i rgyun rgyas par brtan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyud thag bsring ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa gang yang rung ba'i rgyun rgyas par brtan par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the cause of the prolongation of the stream of existence, because it is the cause of the non-abandonment of the stream of existence.

original: yongs su 'dzin pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the condition of possession?

original: lus yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: lus yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: It is the unwholesome and the wholesome with outflows, because they are the cause of the possession of the body.

original: de ma thag pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ma thag pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the condition as immediate antecedent?

original: rgyun mi 'chad par bar chad med pa dang / mthun pa dang mi mthun pa la sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung ba'i de ma thag pas kyang de ma thag pa'i rkyen du blta'o //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par bar chad med pa dang / mthun pa dang mi mthun pa la sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung ba'i de ma thag pas kyang de ma thag pa'i rkyen du blta'o //
translated: The condition as immediate antecedent should be understood as the uninterrupted and homogeneous immediate antecedent of mind and mental activities.

original: dmigs pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the condition of object?

original: yul yongs su chad pa'i dmigs pa dang / yul yongs su ma chad pa'i dmigs pa dang / yul la bkra bar 'dzin ba med pa'i dmigs pa dang / yul la bkra bar 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa dang / dngos po dang bcas pa'i yul gyi dmigs pa dang /ðŸ”½dngos po med pa'i yul gyi dmigs pa dang / dngos po'i dmigs pa dang / kun brtags pa'i dmigs pa dang / phyin ci log gi dmigs pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i dmigs @68a * //
analyzed: yul yongs su chad pa'i dmigs pa dang / yul yongs su ma chad pa'i dmigs pa dang / yul la bkra bar 'dzin ba med pa'i dmigs pa dang / yul la bkra bar 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa dang / dngos po dang bcas pa'i yul gyi dmigs pa dang / dngos po med pa'i yul gyi dmigs pa dang / dngos po'i dmigs pa dang / kun brtags pa'i dmigs pa dang / phyin ci log gi dmigs pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i dmigs @68a * //
translated: The object of the object condition is the object that is the basis of the mind and mental factors, which is determined as follows:ðŸ”½The object condition should be understood as the object that is limited, the object that is not limited, the object that is not grasped as variegated, the object that is grasped as variegated, the object that is a real entity,ðŸ”½the object that is not a real entity, the object that is a real entity, the object that is imagined, the object that is erroneous, the object that is nonerroneous,

original: pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i dmigs pas kyang dmigs pa'i rkyen du blta'o //
analyzed: pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i dmigs pas kyang dmigs pa'i rkyen du blta'o //
translated: the object that is impeded, and the object that is unimpeded.

original: bdag pos ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bdag pos ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the dominant condition?

original: rten la dbang byed pa dang / 'phen pa la dbang byed pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba la dbang byed pa dang / yul la dbang byed pa dang / skye bar dbang byed pa dang / gnas par dbang byed pa dang / 'bras bu la nye bar spyod par dbang byed pa dang /
analyzed: rten la dbang byed pa dang / 'phen pa la dbang byed pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba la dbang byed pa dang / yul la dbang byed pa dang / skye bar dbang byed pa dang / gnas par dbang byed pa dang / 'bras bu la nye bar spyod par dbang byed pa dang /
translated: dominance over the basis, dominance over projection, dominance over co-existence, dominance over objects, dominance over birth, dominance over abiding, dominance over enjoyment of results,

original: 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa la dbang byed pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa la dbang byed pas kyang bdag po'i rkyen du blta'o //ðŸ”½ji ltar na bsten pa mtshungs pa dang de dang mtshungs pa yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa la dbang byed pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa la dbang byed pas kyang bdag po'i rkyen du blta'o // ji ltar na bsten pa mtshungs pa dang de dang mtshungs pa yin /
translated: dominance over mundane purification, and dominance over supramundane purification.ðŸ”½What is similar support and what is similar to that?ðŸ”½How many are similar support and what is similar to that?

original: bsten pa mtshungs pa dang de dang mtshungs pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir bsten pa mtshungs pa dang de dang mtshungs par brtag ce na /
analyzed: bsten pa mtshungs pa dang de dang mtshungs pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir bsten pa mtshungs pa dang de dang mtshungs par brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim is that which is similar support and what is similar to that investigated?

original: rnam par shes pa dang ma bral zhing de dang 'dra ba'i dbang po yul la rgyun tu 'byung ba dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral zhing rang dang 'dra ba rgyun tu 'byung bas kyang bsten pa mtshungs pa dang de dang mtshungs par blta'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ma bral zhing de dang 'dra ba'i dbang po yul la rgyun tu 'byung ba dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral zhing rang dang 'dra ba rgyun tu 'byung bas kyang bsten pa mtshungs pa dang de dang mtshungs par blta'o //
translated: The similarity of support should be understood as the similarity of the sense faculty and the object, which is not separated from consciousness and is of the same kind as the consciousness, and as the similarity of the object, which is separated from consciousness and is of the same kind as the consciousness.

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / gzugs can gyi khams dang skye mched lnga'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / gzugs can gyi khams dang skye mched lnga'o //
translated: One part of the form aggregate, and the five elements and sense bases that have form.

original: bdag rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa dang me ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa dang me ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self endowed or not endowed with consciousness.

original: ji ltar na zin pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na zin pa yin /
translated: What is the appropriated?

original: zin pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir zin par brtag ce na /
analyzed: zin pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir zin par brtag ce na /
translated: How many are appropriated? With what aim is the appropriated investigated?

original: tshor ba 'byung ba'i gnas kyi gzugs ni zin par blta'o //
analyzed: tshor ba 'byung ba'i gnas kyi gzugs ni zin par blta'o //
translated: Form that is the basis of the origination of sensation is the appropriated.

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / khams dang / skye mched gzugs can lnga dang bzhi'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / khams dang / skye mched gzugs can lnga dang bzhi'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: One part of the form aggregate, and one part of the five elements and sense bases that have form.

original: bdag lus la dbang bsgyur bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag lus la dbang bsgyur bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to abandon attachment to a self that dominates the body.

original: ji ltar na dbang po yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na dbang po yin /
translated: What is a faculty?ðŸ”½How many are faculties?

original: dbang po rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir dbang por brtag ce na /ðŸ”½yul la 'dzin par dbang byed pa dang / rigs kyi rgyud la dbang byed pa dang / ris mthun par gnas par dbang byed pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar spyod par dbang byed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la dbang byed pa dang /
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir dbang por brtag ce na / yul la 'dzin par dbang byed pa dang / rigs kyi rgyud la dbang byed pa dang / ris mthun par gnas par dbang byed pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar spyod par dbang byed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la dbang byed pa dang /
translated: With what aim is a faculty investigated?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la dbang byed pas kyang dbang por @68b blta'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la dbang byed pas kyang dbang por @68b blta'o //
translated: A faculty should be understood as a dominant condition in the grasping of an object, in the continuity of a class, in the maintenance of a class, in the experience of the results of good and bad actions, in the detachment of the world, and in the knowledge of the detachment of the world.

original: tshor ba'i phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang / gzugs dang 'du byed kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / khams bcu gnyis dang / skye mched drug dang / chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang / gzugs dang 'du byed kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / khams bcu gnyis dang / skye mched drug dang / chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: the aggregate of feeling, the aggregate of perception, the aggregate of formations, and part of the aggregate of consciousness, twelve elements, six spheres, and part of the element and the sphere of mental objects.

original: bdag dbang byed par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dbang byed par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: with the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is the master.

original: ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid yin /
translated: What is the suffering of suffering?ðŸ”½How many [of the aggregates, etc.] consist of the suffering of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid du brtag ce na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid du brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim is the suffering of suffering investigated?

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyis kyang sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid du blta'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyis kyang sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid du blta'o //
translated: The suffering of suffering should be understood as the suffering which is the intrinsic nature of a feeling of suffering, and as the suffering which is the intrinsic nature of a dharma that causes suffering.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: Part of all [the aggregates, etc.].

original: bdag sdug bsngal bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ðŸ”½ji ltar na 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yin /
analyzed: bdag sdug bsngal bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yin /
translated: with the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which suffers.ðŸ”½What is the suffering of change?

original: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal rnams ni du zhig /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal rnams ni du zhig /
translated: How many are suffering of change?

original: ci'i phyir 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid du brtag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid du brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim is the suffering of change investigated?

original: bde ba'i tshor ba 'gyur ba rang gi mtshan nyid dang / bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos 'gyur ba rang gi mtshan nyid dang / de la yang rjes su chags pas sems 'gyur bas kyang 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid du blta'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba 'gyur ba rang gi mtshan nyid dang / bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos 'gyur ba rang gi mtshan nyid dang / de la yang rjes su chags pas sems 'gyur bas kyang 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid du blta'o //
translated: The suffering of change should be understood as the suffering of change which is the specific characteristic of pleasant feeling, the suffering of change which is the specific characteristic of the things that cause pleasant feeling, and the suffering of change which is the transformation of the mind that is attached to these two.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: All of them, partially.

original: bdag bde bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ðŸ”½ji ltar na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yin /
analyzed: bdag bde bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yin /
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is happy.ðŸ”½What is the suffering of the formative forces?ðŸ”½How many are suffering of the formative forces?

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid du brtag ce na /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid du brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim is the suffering of the formative forces investigated?

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin ba'i tshor ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang / de gnyi ga'i gnas ngan len yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin ba'i tshor ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang / de gnyi ga'i gnas ngan len yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
translated: The intrinsic nature of the sensation that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant, the intrinsic nature of the factors that are conducive to the sensation that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant, and the negative reflex action of both of these.

original: de gnyi ga las ma thar ba mi rtag pa nyid kyis rjes su bcings pas grub pa dang / bde ba ma yin pas kyang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid du blta'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga las ma thar ba mi rtag pa nyid kyis rjes su bcings pas grub pa dang / bde ba ma yin pas kyang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid du blta'o //
translated: And because of the impermanence of both of these, which is the fetter that does not liberate one from either of them, one should also see the suffering of conditioned states in terms of the absence of happiness.

original: phung po rnams dang / khams gsum dang / skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs gcig ma gtogs par thams cad do //
analyzed: phung po rnams dang / khams gsum dang / skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs gcig ma gtogs par thams cad do //
translated: All of them, with the exception of the aggregates, the three realms, and two of the components.

original: bdag sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //ðŸ”½ji ltar na rnam @69a * //
analyzed: bdag sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na rnam @69a * //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: par smin pa dang bcas pa yin /
analyzed: par smin pa dang bcas pa yin /
translated: How many are with a maturation?

original: rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir rnam par smin pa dang bcas par brtag ce na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir rnam par smin pa dang bcas par brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim is that which is with ripening investigated?

original: mi dge ba dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas par blta'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas par blta'o //
translated: The unwholesome, the wholesome with-outflows are with ripening.

original: phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang ; skye mched bzhi'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang ; skye mched bzhi'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: The aggregates, ten elements, four spheres.

original: bdag phung po 'jog par byed pa dang / nying mtshams sbyor bar byed par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag phung po 'jog par byed pa dang / nying mtshams sbyor bar byed par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which establishes the aggregates and connects with a new existence.

original: rnam par smin pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas par blta'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas par blta'o //
translated: The ripening should be understood as the store-consciousness with its associates.

original: de las gzhan pa dag ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba'o //ðŸ”½ji ltar na zas yin /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba'o // ji ltar na zas yin /
translated: The rest are born of ripening.ðŸ”½What is nutriment?

original: zas rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir zas su brtag ce na /
analyzed: zas rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir zas su brtag ce na /
translated: How many are nutriment? With what aim is nutriment investigated?

original: 'jug pas kyang 'ju bas las gyur pa dang / yul gyis kyang yul las gyur pa dang / re bas kyang re ba las gyur pa dang / len pas kyang len pa las gyur ba nyid ni zas su blta'o //
analyzed: 'jug pas kyang 'ju bas las gyur pa dang / yul gyis kyang yul las gyur pa dang / re bas kyang re ba las gyur pa dang / len pas kyang len pa las gyur ba nyid ni zas su blta'o //
translated: Food should be understood as that which is produced by what is swallowed, by what is transformed, by what is derived from objects, by what is derived from aspiration, and by what is derived from grasping.

original: phung po gsum dang / khams bcu gcig dang / skye mched lnga'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: phung po gsum dang / khams bcu gcig dang / skye mched lnga'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: Three aggregates, eleven elements, five sense spheres, and part of the element and the sphere of mental objects and of the element and the sphere of factors.

original: bdag zas kyis gnas par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag zas kyis gnas par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which subsists by means of food.

original: yang zas ni ma dag pa'i lus gnas par byed pa dang / ma dag pa dang dag pa'i lus gnas par byed pa dang / dag pa'i lus gnas par byed pa dang / gnas par kun tu ston par yang blta'o //
analyzed: yang zas ni ma dag pa'i lus gnas par byed pa dang / ma dag pa dang dag pa'i lus gnas par byed pa dang / dag pa'i lus gnas par byed pa dang / gnas par kun tu ston par yang blta'o //
translated: Moreover, food should be understood as that which causes the impure body to subsist, that which causes the impure and pure body to subsist, that which causes the pure body to subsist, and that which causes the body to be shown.

original: ji ltar na gong ma dang bcas pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na gong ma dang bcas pa yin /
translated: What is associated with something superior?

original: gong ma dang bcas pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir gong ma dang bcas par brtag ce na /
analyzed: gong ma dang bcas pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir gong ma dang bcas par brtag ce na /
translated: How many are associated with something superior? With what aim is that which is associated with something superior investigated?

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi phyogs gcig gis kyang gong ma dang bcas par blta'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi phyogs gcig gis kyang gong ma dang bcas par blta'o //
translated: That which is associated with something superior should be understood as part of the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: chos kyi khams dang skye mched kyi phyogs gcig ma gtogs par thams cad do //
analyzed: chos kyi khams dang skye mched kyi phyogs gcig ma gtogs par thams cad do //
translated: with the exception of one part of the element and the sense-field of mental objects.

original: bdag rdzas ngan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag rdzas ngan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: with the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is a bad substance.

original: ji ltar na gong na med pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na gong na med pa yin /
translated: What is without superior?ðŸ”½How many [of the aggregates, etc.] are without superior?

original: gong na med pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir gong na med par brtag ce na /
analyzed: gong na med pa rnams ni du zhig / ci'i phyir gong na med par brtag ce na /
translated: With what aim is that without superior investigated?

original: 'dus ma byas kyi phyogs gcig ni gong na med par blta'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi phyogs gcig ni gong na med par blta'o //
translated: One part of the unconditioned should be understood as being without superior.

original: chos kyi khams dang skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: chos kyi khams dang skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: It is part of the element and the sense-field of mental objects.

original: bdag rdzas kyi mchog tu mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag rdzas kyi mchog tu mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: with the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is the best substance.

original: de ltar na tshul 'dis rab tu dbye ba'i tshul tshad med do //
analyzed: de ltar na tshul 'dis rab tu dbye ba'i tshul tshad med do //
translated: In this way, the method of distribution is immeasurable.

original: yang mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: yang mdor bsdu na /
translated: Moreover, in brief,

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba ni @69b rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba ni @69b rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: the distribution of the aggregates, elements and sense-fields is threefold:

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam par brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam par brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: The classification of the aggregates, elements, and spheres is threefold: classification according to the imaginary nature, classification according to the nature that is dependent on others, and classification according to the perfected nature.

original: de la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification according to the imaginary nature?

original: phung po khams dang / skye mched rnams la bdag ce'am /
analyzed: phung po khams dang / skye mched rnams la bdag ce'am /
translated: It is the imagination that the aggregates, elements, and spheres are a self,

original: sems can dang / srog dang / skye ba po dang / gso ba dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu zhes gang kun tu rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dang / srog dang / skye ba po dang / gso ba dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu zhes gang kun tu rtog pa'o //
translated: a sentient being, a living being, a nourished being, a man, a human, a certain person, or a human individual.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rang ru dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rang ru dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification according to the nature that is dependent on others?

original: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched de dag nyid do //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched de dag nyid do //
translated: It is the aggregates, elements, and spheres themselves.

original: chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification according to the perfected nature?

original: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched de dag nyid la bdag med cing /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched de dag nyid la bdag med cing /
translated: It is the absence of a self in the aggregates, elements, and spheres,ðŸ”½and the absence of a sentient being, a living being, a nourished being, a man, a human, a certain person, or a human individual.

original: sems can dang / srog dang / skye ba po dang / gso ba dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu med la ;
analyzed: sems can dang / srog dang / skye ba po dang / gso ba dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu med la ;
translated: the living being, the life-force, the nourished one, the person, the human being, the descendant of Manu, the master of the self, the worldling,

original: bdag med pa ni yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag med pa ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: the self does not exist, but selflessness exists.

original: yang rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There is a fourfold classification:

original: mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam pas rab tu dbye ba dang / lus kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / rgyun gyis rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam pas rab tu dbye ba dang / lus kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / rgyun gyis rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: classification according to characteristics, classification according to modes, classification according to bodies, and classification according to continuity.

original: mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is classification according to characteristics?

original: phung po dang khams dang ; skye mched rnams so so'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang ; skye mched rnams so so'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: It is the classification of the aggregates, elements and sense bases according to their own characteristics.

original: rnam pas rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pas rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is classification according to modes?

original: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched de dag nyid kyi rdzas su yod pa dang / btags pa'i yod pa dag /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched de dag nyid kyi rdzas su yod pa dang / btags pa'i yod pa dag /
