translated: It is the classification of the aggregates, elements and sense bases according to their substantial and nominal existence.

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa dang / don dam par yod pa dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa dang / bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa dang / de la sogs pa'i ji skad bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa dang / don dam par yod pa dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa dang / bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa dang / de la sogs pa'i ji skad bstan pa rnams so //
translated: conventional existence, ultimate existence, form, non-form, resistance, non-resistance, etc.

original: lus kyis rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyis rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is classification according to the body?

original: sems can rnams kyi lus ji snyed par phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyang de snyed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lus ji snyed par phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyang de snyed do //
translated: As many are the bodies of beings, so many are the aggregates, elements and spheres.

original: rgyun gyis rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyun gyis rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is classification according to continuity?

original: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi skad cig re re 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi skad cig re re 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is the arising of the aggregates, elements and spheres from moment to moment.

original: mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas ci zhig yongs su shes she na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas ci zhig yongs su shes she na /
translated: What does one fully know by means of the skill in the classification of characteristics?

original: bdag la mngon par zhen pa yongs su shes so //ðŸ”½rnam pas @70a * //
analyzed: bdag la mngon par zhen pa yongs su shes so // rnam pas @70a * //
translated: One fully knows the attachment to a real self.

original: rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas ci zhig yongs su shes she na /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas ci zhig yongs su shes she na /
translated: What does one fully know by means of the skill in the classification of aspects?

original: ril po'i 'du shes yongs su shes so //
analyzed: ril po'i 'du shes yongs su shes so //
translated: One fully knows the notion of totality.

original: lus kyis rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas ci zhig yongs su shes she na /
analyzed: lus kyis rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas ci zhig yongs su shes she na /
translated: What is completely understood by skill in the analysis of the body?

original: ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang / byas pa chud za ba'i 'du shes yongs su shes so /
analyzed: ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang / byas pa chud za ba'i 'du shes yongs su shes so /
translated: The notion of encountering what has not been done and the notion of the destruction of what has been done.

original: rgyun gyis rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas ci zhig yongs su shes she na /
analyzed: rgyun gyis rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pas ci zhig yongs su shes she na /
translated: What is completely understood by skill in the analysis of continuity?

original: brtan pa'i 'du shes yongs su shes so //
analyzed: brtan pa'i 'du shes yongs su shes so //
translated: The notion of stability.

original: yang phung po dang khams dang skye mched 'di dag nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: yang phung po dang khams dang skye mched 'di dag nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug ste /
translated: There are six kinds of analysis of the aggregates, elements and spheres:

original: phyi rol tu bltas pas rab tu dbye ba dang / nang du bltas pas rab tu dbye ba dang / rgyun ring ba'i dus kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / dus yongs su chad pas rab tu dbye ba dang / de'i dus kyis rab tu dbye ba dang /
analyzed: phyi rol tu bltas pas rab tu dbye ba dang / nang du bltas pas rab tu dbye ba dang / rgyun ring ba'i dus kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / dus yongs su chad pas rab tu dbye ba dang / de'i dus kyis rab tu dbye ba dang /
translated: analysis of external objects, analysis of internal objects, analysis of long duration, analysis of limited duration, analysis of the present moment,

original: kun tu ston pas rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: kun tu ston pas rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: and analysis of manifestation.

original: phyi rol tu bltas pas rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol tu bltas pas rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is analysis of external objects?

original: phal cher 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pas rab tu dbye ba'o ;
analyzed: phal cher 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pas rab tu dbye ba'o ;
translated: It is analysis of the majority of the realm of desire.

original: / nang du bltas pas rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: / nang du bltas pas rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification according to the internal?

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa thams cad do //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa thams cad do //
translated: It is all that belongs to the stage of contemplation.

original: rgyun ring ba'i dus kyis rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyun ring ba'i dus kyis rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification according to the long period of time?

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is that of the ordinary man.

original: dus yongs su chad pas rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: dus yongs su chad pas rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification according to the limited period of time?

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams kyi tha ma'i phung po dang khams dang / skye mched rnams ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams kyi tha ma'i phung po dang khams dang / skye mched rnams ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: It is that of the disciples in training and of those beyond training, with the exception of their last aggregates, elements and sense-fields.

original: de'i dus kyis rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i dus kyis rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification according to the immediate period of time?

original: mi slob pa rnams kyi tha ma'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: mi slob pa rnams kyi tha ma'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams so //
translated: It is that of the last aggregates, elements and sense-fields of those beyond training.

original: kun tu ston pas rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun tu ston pas rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification according to manifestation?

original: gang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' dam pa'i pha rol tu son pa rnams kyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag kun tu ston pa'o //ðŸ”½bsdus pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' dam pa'i pha rol tu son pa rnams kyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag kun tu ston pa'o // bsdus pa gang zhe na /
translated: It is the manifestation of the aggregates, elements and sense-fields of the Buddhas and of the Bodhisattvas who are in their last existence.ðŸ”½What is the classification according to inclusion?

original: rnam pa bcu gcig tu blta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gcig tu blta ste /
translated: It is elevenfold:

original: mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa dang / khams kyis bsdus pa dag /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa dang / khams kyis bsdus pa dag /
translated: 2. the inclusion by their realms,ðŸ”½3. the inclusion by their families,ðŸ”½4. the inclusion by their states,ðŸ”½5. the inclusion by their companions,ðŸ”½6. the inclusion by their directions,

original: rigs kyis bsdus pa dang / gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa dang ; grogs kyis bsdus pa dang / phyogs kyis bsdus pa dang / dus kyis bsdus pa dang / phyogs gcig gis bsdus pa dang / mtha' dag gis bsdus pa dang / gcig gis gcig bsdus pa dang /
analyzed: rigs kyis bsdus pa dang / gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa dang ; grogs kyis bsdus pa dang / phyogs kyis bsdus pa dang / dus kyis bsdus pa dang / phyogs gcig gis bsdus pa dang / mtha' dag gis bsdus pa dang / gcig gis gcig bsdus pa dang /
translated: 7. the inclusion by their times,ðŸ”½8. the inclusion by their parts,ðŸ”½9. the inclusion by their wholes,ðŸ”½10. the inclusion by their mutual relations,

original: don dam pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: 11. the inclusion by their ultimates.

original: mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa @70b gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa @70b gang zhe na /
translated: What is inclusion by their characteristics?

original: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi so so'i rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa dag nyid kyis de dag bsdus par blta'o //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi so so'i rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa dag nyid kyis de dag bsdus par blta'o //
translated: The aggregates, elements and spheres are included by their own individual characteristics.

original: khams kyis bsdus pa gang zhe na /ðŸ”½phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams kyi sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: khams kyis bsdus pa gang zhe na / phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams kyi sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de /
translated: What is inclusion by their realms?

original: de dag gi khams bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi khams bsdus pa'o //
translated: The aggregates, elements and spheres are included in the realm of the consciousness of the ground of all seeds.

original: rigs kyis bsdus pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rigs kyis bsdus pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is inclusion by their families?

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams mtshan nyid tha dad kyang phung po'i don brtsan par byas shing khams dang skye mched kyi don brtsan par byas nas thams cad phan tshun gyis bsdus pa dag go //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams mtshan nyid tha dad kyang phung po'i don brtsan par byas shing khams dang skye mched kyi don brtsan par byas nas thams cad phan tshun gyis bsdus pa dag go //
translated: The aggregates, elements and spheres are different in their characteristics, but they are all mutually included when their meanings are investigated.

original: gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is inclusion by state?

original: bde ba'i gnas skabs kyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams ni de dag nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i gnas skabs kyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams ni de dag nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The aggregates, elements and spheres in the state of well-being are included in those same aggregates, elements and spheres.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs kyang de dag nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs kyang de dag nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: Similarly, those in the state of suffering and in the state of neither-suffering-nor-well-being are included in those same aggregates, elements and spheres.

original: grogs kyis bsdus pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: grogs kyis bsdus pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is inclusion by companion?

original: gzugs kyi phung po 'khor dang bcas pa ni de las gzhan pa'i phung po'i grogs su gyur pa rnams kyis grogs kyi bsdu bas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po 'khor dang bcas pa ni de las gzhan pa'i phung po'i grogs su gyur pa rnams kyis grogs kyi bsdu bas bsdus pa'o //
translated: The form aggregate, together with its following, is included in the inclusion by companion of the other aggregates which are its companions.

original: de bzhin du de las gzhan pa'i phung po dang khams dang / skye mched rnams la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de las gzhan pa'i phung po dang khams dang / skye mched rnams la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the other aggregates, elements and spheres.

original: phyogs kyis bsdus pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs kyis bsdus pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is inclusion by direction?

original: shar phyogs kyi phung po dang khams dang / skye mched gang yin pa de rnams de dag nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi phung po dang khams dang / skye mched gang yin pa de rnams de dag nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The aggregates, elements and spheres which are in the east are included in the aggregates, elements and spheres.

original: de bzhin du de gzhan pa'i phyogs rnams la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de gzhan pa'i phyogs rnams la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The same is to be understood in regard to the other directions.

original: dus kyis bsdus pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dus kyis bsdus pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is inclusion by time?

original: 'das pa'i phung po dang khams dang ; skye mched rnams ni de dag nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i phung po dang khams dang ; skye mched rnams ni de dag nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The past aggregates, elements and spheres are included in the past aggregates, elements and spheres.

original: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams kyang de dag nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams kyang de dag nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The future and present ones are included in the future and present ones.

original: phyogs gcig gis bsdus pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis bsdus pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is inclusion by part?

original: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis bsdus pa'i chos ji snyed pa de dag gang yang rung bas bsdus pa ni phyogs gcig gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis bsdus pa'i chos ji snyed pa de dag gang yang rung bas bsdus pa ni phyogs gcig gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The inclusion of any of the factors included in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases is called inclusion by one part.

original: mtha' dag gis bsdus pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtha' dag gis bsdus pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is inclusion by the whole?

original: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis bsdus pa'i chos ji snyed pa de dag ma lus par bsdus pa ni mtha' dag gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //ðŸ”½gcig @71a * //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis bsdus pa'i chos ji snyed pa de dag ma lus par bsdus pa ni mtha' dag gis bsdus par rig par bya'o // gcig @71a * //
translated: The inclusion of all the factors included in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases is called inclusion by the whole.

original: gis gcig bsdus pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gis gcig bsdus pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is inclusion by one in the other?

original: gzugs kyi phung po khams du dang skye mched du dag gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po khams du dang skye mched du dag gis bsdus she na /
translated: By how many elements and sense bases is the form aggregate included?

original: khams bcu dang / skye mched bcu dang / khams dang skye mched gcig gi phyogs gcig gis kyang bsdus so //
analyzed: khams bcu dang / skye mched bcu dang / khams dang skye mched gcig gi phyogs gcig gis kyang bsdus so //
translated: It is included in ten elements and ten sense bases and in one part of one element and of one sense base.

original: tshor ba'i phung po khams du dang skye mched du dag gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po khams du dang skye mched du dag gis bsdus she na /
translated: By how many elements and sense bases is the feeling aggregate included?

original: khams dang skye mched gcig gi phyogs gcig gis bsdus so //
analyzed: khams dang skye mched gcig gi phyogs gcig gis bsdus so //
translated: It is included in one part of one element and of one sense base.

original: tshor ba'i phung po ji ltar 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po'ang de bzhin no //ðŸ”½rnam par shes pa'i phung po khams du dang skye mched du dag gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po ji ltar 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po'ang de bzhin no // rnam par shes pa'i phung po khams du dang skye mched du dag gis bsdus she na /
translated: The aggregate of perception and the aggregate of formations are also like that.

original: khams bdun dang skye mched gcig gis bsdus so //ðŸ”½mig gi khams phung po du dang skye mched du dag gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: khams bdun dang skye mched gcig gis bsdus so // mig gi khams phung po du dang skye mched du dag gis bsdus she na /
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is included in seven elements and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / skye mched gcig gis so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / skye mched gcig gis so //
translated: The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.

original: mig gi khams ji lta bar rna ba'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / lus kyi khams kyang de bzhin no //ðŸ”½gzugs kyi khams phung po du dang skye mched du dag gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: mig gi khams ji lta bar rna ba'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / lus kyi khams kyang de bzhin no // gzugs kyi khams phung po du dang skye mched du dag gis bsdus she na /
translated: The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / skye mched gcig gis so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / skye mched gcig gis so //
translated: The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one sense-sphere.ðŸ”½The element of the eye is included in one aggregate and in one

original: gzugs kyi khams ji ltar bar sgra'i khams dang dri'i khams dang ro'i khams dang / reg bya'i khams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ji ltar bar sgra'i khams dang dri'i khams dang ro'i khams dang / reg bya'i khams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the element of sound, the element of odor, the element of taste, and the element of the tangible.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams phung po du dang skye mched du dag gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams phung po du dang skye mched du dag gis bsdus she na /
translated: How many aggregates and how many sense bases are included in the eye-consciousness element?

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang / yid kyi skye mched kyi phyogs gcig gis so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang / yid kyi skye mched kyi phyogs gcig gis so //
translated: It is included in one aggregate, one sense base, and one element.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams ji lta bar rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang / lus dang ; yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams ji lta bar rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang / lus dang ; yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the ear-, nose-, tongue-, and body-consciousness elements.

original: chos kyi khams phung po du dang skye mched du dag gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: chos kyi khams phung po du dang skye mched du dag gis bsdus she na /
translated: How many aggregates and how many sense bases are included in the mental-consciousness element?

original: phung po gsum dang / gcig gi phyogs gcig dang / skye mched gcig gis bsdus so //
analyzed: phung po gsum dang / gcig gi phyogs gcig dang / skye mched gcig gis bsdus so //
translated: It is included in one aggregate, one sense base, and seven elements.

original: mig gi skye mched phung po du dang khams du dag gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: mig gi skye mched phung po du dang khams du dag gis bsdus she na /
translated: How many aggregates and how many elements are included in the eye sense faculty?

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / khams gcig gis bsdus so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / khams gcig gis bsdus so //
translated: It is included in one aggregate and one element.ðŸ”½How many aggregates and how many sense bases are included in the form sense base?ðŸ”½It is included in one aggregate and one sense base.

original: mig gi skye mched ji lta bar rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang / lus kyi skye mched rnams dang / gzugs dang sgra dang / dri dang ro dang / reg bya'i skye mched rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mig gi skye mched ji lta bar rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang / lus kyi skye mched rnams dang / gzugs dang sgra dang / dri dang ro dang / reg bya'i skye mched rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the sense-fields of the ear, nose, tongue, body and mental organ, and to the sense-fields of sound, smell, taste, touch and the mentally cognizables.

original: @71b yid kyi skye mched phung po du dang khams du dag gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: @71b yid kyi skye mched phung po du dang khams du dag gis bsdus she na /
translated: In how many aggregates, in how many elements are the sense-fields of the mental organ and of the mentally cognizables comprised?

original: phung po gcig dang khams bdun gyis so //
analyzed: phung po gcig dang khams bdun gyis so //
translated: They are comprised in one aggregate, in seven elements.

original: chos kyi skye mched phung po du dang khams du dag gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched phung po du dang khams du dag gis bsdus she na /
translated: In how many aggregates, in how many elements is the sense-field of the mentally cognizables comprised?

original: phung po gsum dang gcig gi phyogs gcig dang / khams gcig gis bsdus so //
analyzed: phung po gsum dang gcig gi phyogs gcig dang / khams gcig gis bsdus so //
translated: It is comprised in three aggregates, in one part of one aggregate, in one element.

original: de bzhin du de las gzhan pa'i chos phung po bstan pa dang / khams dang skye mched bstan pa gang yin pa de dag dang gang de bzhin du ma bstan pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du de las gzhan pa'i chos phung po bstan pa dang / khams dang skye mched bstan pa gang yin pa de dag dang gang de bzhin du ma bstan pa 'di lta ste /
translated: In the same way, the other dharmas which are taught in the aggregates, elements and sense-fields, and those which are not taught in the same way, such as:

original: rdzas su yod pa dang / btags pa'i yod pa dang / kun rdzob tu yod pa dang / don dam par yod pa dang / shes par bya ba dang / rnam par shes par bya ba dang / mngon par shes par bya ba dang / gzugs can dang /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa dang / btags pa'i yod pa dang / kun rdzob tu yod pa dang / don dam par yod pa dang / shes par bya ba dang / rnam par shes par bya ba dang / mngon par shes par bya ba dang / gzugs can dang /
translated: They are also included in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, as appropriate, such as being substantial, imputed, conventional, ultimate, knowable, cognizable, superknowable, having form,

original: gzugs can ma yin pa dang / bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa la sogs pa de dag kyang phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams kyis bsdus par ji ltar mthun mthun du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa dang / bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa la sogs pa de dag kyang phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams kyis bsdus par ji ltar mthun mthun du rig par bya ste /
translated: formless, visible, invisible, and so on.

original: de ni sngar bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni sngar bstan pa nyid do //
translated: This has already been explained above.

original: don dam pas bsdus pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pas bsdus pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is included in the ultimate?

original: gang phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gang phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: It is the suchness of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: de ltar bsdus pa la mkhas pas phan yon ci zhig 'thob ce na /
analyzed: de ltar bsdus pa la mkhas pas phan yon ci zhig 'thob ce na /
translated: What benefit is there in being skilled in this inclusion?

original: dmigs pa mngon par sdud pa'i phan yon 'thob ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa mngon par sdud pa'i phan yon 'thob ste /
translated: The benefit is the inclusion of the objective support.

original: ji lta ji ltar dmigs pa mngon par sdud pa de lta de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'phel lo //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar dmigs pa mngon par sdud pa de lta de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'phel lo //
translated: The more one concentrates on the object, the more one's wholesome roots increase.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is association?

original: rnam pa drug tu blta ste /ðŸ”½tha dad pa med pas mtshungs par ldan pa dang / 'dres par 'gyur pas mtshungs par ldan pa dang / phrad pas mtshungs par ldan pa dang / lhan cig 'byung bas mtshungs par ldan pa dang / bya ba bsgrubs pas mtshungs par ldan pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa drug tu blta ste / tha dad pa med pas mtshungs par ldan pa dang / 'dres par 'gyur pas mtshungs par ldan pa dang / phrad pas mtshungs par ldan pa dang / lhan cig 'byung bas mtshungs par ldan pa dang / bya ba bsgrubs pas mtshungs par ldan pa dang /
translated: It should be understood in six ways:

original: mthun par rtogs pas mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mthun par rtogs pas mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: 1) association by non-differentiation; 2) association by mixture; 3) association by contact; 4) association by co-existence; 5) association by the accomplishment of the same action; 6) association by the same experience.

original: tha dad pa med pas mtshungs par ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pas mtshungs par ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is association by non-differentiation?

original: rdul phra rab kyi phyogs la phyogs can thams cad tha dad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi phyogs la phyogs can thams cad tha dad pa med pa'o //
translated: It is the non-differentiation of the whole in the atom.

original: 'dres par gyur pas mtshungs par ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dres par gyur pas mtshungs par ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is association by mixture?

original: rdul phra rab las gong ma phyogs can rnams 'dres par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab las gong ma phyogs can rnams 'dres par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the mixture of the whole in the atom.ðŸ”½What is association by contact?

original: phrad pas mtshungs par ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: phrad pas mtshungs par ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is association through contact?

original: phyogs can 'dus pa rnams nyid phan tshun phrad pa'o //ðŸ”½lhan cig 'byung bas mtshungs @72a * //
analyzed: phyogs can 'dus pa rnams nyid phan tshun phrad pa'o // lhan cig 'byung bas mtshungs @72a * //
translated: It is the contact of the component parts of the group.

original: par ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: par ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is association through co-existence?

original: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched gang yin pa dag lhan cig 'byung bas 'khod pa ste /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang / skye mched gang yin pa dag lhan cig 'byung bas 'khod pa ste /
translated: It is the co-existence of the aggregates, elements and spheres.

original: skye ba gcig pa dang / gnas pa'i ngang gcig pa dang / 'gag pa gcig pa rnams so //
analyzed: skye ba gcig pa dang / gnas pa'i ngang gcig pa dang / 'gag pa gcig pa rnams so //
translated: It is the co-existence of those that are born, those that endure and those that perish.

original: bya ba bsgrubs pas mtshungs par ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bya ba bsgrubs pas mtshungs par ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is association through the accomplishment of the same action?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is, for example,

original: dge slong gnyis rtsod pa gang yang rung ba la mtshungs par zhugs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dge slong gnyis rtsod pa gang yang rung ba la mtshungs par zhugs pa lta bu'o //
translated: the association of two monks who are engaged in the same activity.

original: mthun par rtogs pas mtshungs par ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mthun par rtogs pas mtshungs par ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is association through the understanding of the same object?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dmigs pa gcig la mthun par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dmigs pa gcig la mthun par rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the understanding of the same object by thought and thought-concomitants.

original: mthun par rtogs pas mtshungs par ldan pa de yang gzhan gyi dngos pos yin gyi bdag gi dngos pos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthun par rtogs pas mtshungs par ldan pa de yang gzhan gyi dngos pos yin gyi bdag gi dngos pos ni ma yin no //
translated: It is associated by the similarity of its object, not by the similarity of its own nature.

original: mthun pa gnyis yin gyi mi mthun pa gnyis ni ma yin no //ðŸ”½dus 'dra ba gnyis yin gyi dus mi 'dra ba gnyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa gnyis yin gyi mi mthun pa gnyis ni ma yin no // dus 'dra ba gnyis yin gyi dus mi 'dra ba gnyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is associated with two things that are similar, not with two things that are dissimilar.ðŸ”½It is associated with two things that are simultaneous, not with two things that are not simultaneous.

original: mthun pa'i khams dang / sa pa gnyis yin gyi mi mthun pa'i khams dang / sa pa gnyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i khams dang / sa pa gnyis yin gyi mi mthun pa'i khams dang / sa pa gnyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is associated with two things that are in the same realm and stage, not with two things that are in different realms and stages.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa kun tu 'gro ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa kun tu 'gro ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Universal association is as follows:

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang / sems pa dang reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang / sems pa dang reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: feeling, conception, volition, contact, mental attention, and consciousness.

original: yang mtshungs par ldan pa kun tu 'gro ba nyon mongs pa can ni yid dang / nyon mongs pa bzhi po rnams so //
analyzed: yang mtshungs par ldan pa kun tu 'gro ba nyon mongs pa can ni yid dang / nyon mongs pa bzhi po rnams so //
translated: Moreover, universal association is also afflicted, such as the four afflictions of the manas.

original: res 'ga' mtshungs par ldan pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' mtshungs par ldan pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Sometimes association is as follows:

original: sems la dad pa la sogs pa dge ba rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems la dad pa la sogs pa dge ba rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: The mind is associated with the wholesome roots of faith, etc., with the defilements such as passion, and with the secondary defilements.

original: gnas skabs las gyur ba'i mtshungs par ldan pa ni bde ba'i tshor ba mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs las gyur ba'i mtshungs par ldan pa ni bde ba'i tshor ba mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i'o //
translated: Association due to state is that of the feeling of pleasure, etc., together with what is associated with it.

original: sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the feeling of pain and the feeling that is neither pleasant nor painful.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par mtshungs par ldan pa ni lus sems dang bcas pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par mtshungs par ldan pa ni lus sems dang bcas pa'i dus na'o //
translated: Association without interval is that of the mind and body together.

original: rgyun chad pa'i mtshungs par ldan pa ni sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pas bar du chod pa'i'o //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa'i mtshungs par ldan pa ni sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pas bar du chod pa'i'o //
translated: Association with interval is that of the mind and body separated by a mindless meditative attainment.

original: phyi rol tu bltas pa'i mtshungs par ldan pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang rab tu ldan pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba rnams las phal cher ro //
analyzed: phyi rol tu bltas pa'i mtshungs par ldan pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang rab tu ldan pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba rnams las phal cher ro //
translated: Association with external objects is that of the mind and mental activities associated with the realm of desire, for the most part.

original: nang du bltas pa'i mtshungs par ldan pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa ba rnams @72b kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams las phal cher ro //
analyzed: nang du bltas pa'i mtshungs par ldan pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa ba rnams @72b kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams las phal cher ro //
translated: The association of internal perception is that of most minds and mental factors in the state of meditative equipoise.

original: 'dris pa'i mtshungs par ldan pa ni so so'i skye ba rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa de dag las kyang kha cig gi'o //
analyzed: 'dris pa'i mtshungs par ldan pa ni so so'i skye ba rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa de dag las kyang kha cig gi'o //
translated: The association of familiarization is that of minds and mental factors of ordinary beings and some of those of trainees and non-trainees.

original: ma 'dris pa'i mtshungs par ldan pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi dang po dang de'i 'og ma rnams dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: ma 'dris pa'i mtshungs par ldan pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi dang po dang de'i 'og ma rnams dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The association of unfamiliarization is that of minds and mental factors of transcendent states, the first and those that follow, and those obtained after transcendent states.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa la mkhas pas phan yon ci zhig 'thob ce na /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa la mkhas pas phan yon ci zhig 'thob ce na /
translated: What benefits are gained by being skilled in association?

original: sems tsam la tshor ba la sogs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyis mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa shes so //ðŸ”½de shes na bdag tshor bar byed do //
analyzed: sems tsam la tshor ba la sogs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyis mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa shes so // de shes na bdag tshor bar byed do //
translated: In the case of the Mind Only school, one understands the relationship between mind and such things as feelings, and between mind and the phenomena of defilement and purification.

original: 'du shes su byed do //ðŸ”½sems par byed do //
analyzed: 'du shes su byed do // sems par byed do //
translated: When one understands this, one abandons the belief in an experiencer,ðŸ”½a conceiver,ðŸ”½a cognizer,

original: dran par byed do //

original: kun nas nyon mongs so //

original: ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is possession?

analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It is as previously described in the chapter on characteristics.

original: rab tu dbye bas ni sa bon dang ldan pa dang / dbang dang ldan pa dang / kun tu 'byung ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye bas ni sa bon dang ldan pa dang / dbang dang ldan pa dang / kun tu 'byung ba dang ldan pa'o //

original: sa bon dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sa bon dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is possession of seeds?

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes par gyur pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes par gyur pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang /
translated: One who is born in the desire realm is endowed with the seeds of the afflictions and branch afflictions associated with the desire realm, and the afflictions and branch afflictions associated with the form and formless realms.

original: skye bas 'thob pa'i dge ba rnams kyi sa bon dang ldan pas ldan pa'o //
analyzed: skye bas 'thob pa'i dge ba rnams kyi sa bon dang ldan pas ldan pa'o //
translated: And he is endowed with the seeds of the virtues obtained from birth.

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes par 'gyur pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes par 'gyur pa ni /
translated: One who is born in the form realm

original: 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi sa bon dang ldan pas ldan pa ma yin pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi sa bon dang ldan pas ldan pa ma yin pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: is not endowed with the seeds of the afflictions and branch afflictions associated with the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang rab tu ldan pa dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / skye bas 'thob pa'i dge ba rnams kyi sa bon dang ldan pas ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang rab tu ldan pa dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / skye bas 'thob pa'i dge ba rnams kyi sa bon dang ldan pas ldan pa'o //
translated: But he is endowed with the seeds of the afflictions and branch afflictions associated with the form and formless realms, and the virtues obtained from birth.

translated: One who is born in the formless realm

original: gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / skye bas 'thob pa'i dge ba rnams kyi sa bon dang ldan pas ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / skye bas 'thob pa'i dge ba rnams kyi sa bon dang ldan pas ldan pa'o //
translated: is said to possess the seeds of the defilements and secondary defilements associated with the realm of desire and the realm of form, and not to possess the seeds of the defilements and secondary defilements associated with the formless realm and the wholesome innate dharmas.

original: khams gsum pa'i gnyen po thob pa ni /ðŸ”½rnam pa gang dang gang gi gnyen po byung ba de dang de'i sa bon dang ldan pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i gnyen po thob pa ni / rnam pa gang dang gang gi gnyen po byung ba de dang de'i sa bon dang ldan pa ma yin gyi /

analyzed: gang gi gnyen po ma byung ba de'i sa bon dang ldan pas ldan pa'o //

original: dbang dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang dang ldan pa gang zhe na /

translated: The world systems of a trichiliocosm are destroyed and created simultaneously.

original: 'di lta ste dper na char gyi rgyun gnya' shing tsam 'bab na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na char gyi rgyun gnya' shing tsam 'bab na /
translated: For example, when a rain falls in the form of great sticks,

original: bar snang la char gyi rgyun 'bab pa rnams kyi bar dang / mtshams med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bar snang la char gyi rgyun 'bab pa rnams kyi bar dang / mtshams med pa de bzhin du /
translated: there is no interval or discontinuity in the rain falling from the sky.

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig pa dang 'chags pa rnams kyi bar dang / mtshams med de gzhan dag ni 'jig go //ðŸ”½gzhan dag ni zhig nas 'dug go //ðŸ”½gzhan dag ni 'chags so //
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig pa dang 'chags pa rnams kyi bar dang / mtshams med de gzhan dag ni 'jig go // gzhan dag ni zhig nas 'dug go // gzhan dag ni 'chags so //
translated: In the same way, there is no interval or discontinuity in the destruction and creation of the world systems in the eastern direction.ðŸ”½Some are being destroyed, some are being created.ðŸ”½Some are destroyed and remain so.

original: gzhan dag ni chags nas 'dug go //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni chags nas 'dug go //
translated: Some are created and remain so.

original: shar phyogs ji lta bar phyogs bcu thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: shar phyogs ji lta bar phyogs bcu thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
translated: As in the east, so in all the ten directions.

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten gang @74b yin pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten gang yin pa las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten gang @74b yin pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten gang yin pa las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa /
translated: The world of sentient beings and the receptacle world, which are produced by actions and defilements,

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis byung ba 'di mtha' dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis byung ba 'di mtha' dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: are the truth of suffering, because they are produced by the power of actions and defilements.

original: yongs su dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams de dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma yin pa blta ste /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams de dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma yin pa blta ste /
translated: But the pure worlds are not the truth of suffering.

original: de dag las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa ma yin /
analyzed: de dag las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa ma yin /
translated: They are not produced by actions and defilements.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis byung ba ma yin gyi //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis byung ba ma yin gyi //
translated: They are not produced by the power of actions and defilements.

original: smon lam dang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dbang gis byung ba dag go //
analyzed: smon lam dang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dbang gis byung ba dag go //
translated: They are produced by the power of vows and of wholesome roots.

original: de lta bas na sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir skye ba'i gnas de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir skye ba'i gnas de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
translated: Therefore, these places of birth are inconceivable, because they are the domain of the Buddhas.

original: de dag ni bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi yul yang ma yin na /
analyzed: de dag ni bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi yul yang ma yin na /
translated: These are not even the domain of the contemplativesâ€™ concentration.

original: rtog ge pa rnams kyi yul ma yin pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: rtog ge pa rnams kyi yul ma yin pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to speak of their being beyond the domain of logicians?

original: yang skye ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: yang skye ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Birth is suffering.

original: rga ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: rga ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Aging is suffering.

original: na ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: na ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Sickness is suffering.

original: 'chi ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: 'chi ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Death is suffering.

original: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Encountering what is unpleasant is suffering.

original: sdug pa dang bral ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sdug pa dang bral ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Separation from what is pleasant is suffering.

original: gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Not getting what one wants is suffering.

original: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: In brief, the five aggregates of appropriation are suffering.

original: ci'i phyir skye ba sdug bsngal zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skye ba sdug bsngal zhe na /
translated: Why is birth suffering?

original: dogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyid dang / de las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyid dang / de las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the suffering of anxiety and because it is the basis for other suffering.

original: ci'i phyir rga ba sdug bsngal zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rga ba sdug bsngal zhe na /
translated: Why is aging suffering?

original: na tshod gyur pa sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: na tshod gyur pa sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the suffering of the change of condition.

original: ci'i phyir na ba sdug bsngal zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na ba sdug bsngal zhe na /
translated: Why is sickness suffering?

original: khams gyur pa sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gyur pa sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the transformation of the elements is suffering.

original: ci'i phyir 'chi ba sdug bsngal zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'chi ba sdug bsngal zhe na /
translated: Why is death suffering?

original: srog gyur pa sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: srog gyur pa sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the transformation of life is suffering.

original: ci'i phyir mi sdug pa dang phrad pa sdug bsngal zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi sdug pa dang phrad pa sdug bsngal zhe na /
translated: Why is association with what is disliked suffering?

original: phrad pa sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phrad pa sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because contact is suffering.

original: ci'i phyir sdug pa dang bral ba sdug bsngal zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sdug pa dang bral ba sdug bsngal zhe na /
translated: Why is separation from what is liked suffering?

original: bral pa sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bral pa sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because separation is suffering.

original: ci'i phyir gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal zhe na /
translated: Why is not obtaining what one longs for suffering?

original: re ba 'bras bu med pa sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: re ba 'bras bu med pa sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because hope is suffering.

original: ci'i phyir mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal zhe na /
translated: In brief, why are the five aggregates of clinging suffering?

original: gnas ngan len sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //ðŸ”½de dag ni brgyad yin yang drug tu 'gyur ro //ðŸ”½drug yin yang brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas ngan len sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro // de dag ni brgyad yin yang drug tu 'gyur ro // drug yin yang brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: Because of the suffering of the transformation of the aggregates.ðŸ”½Although there are eight, they are included in six.

original: dogs pa'i @75a * //
analyzed: dogs pa'i @75a * //
translated: Although there are six, they are included in eight.

original: sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / phrad pa'i sdug bsngal dang / bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / re ba 'bras bu med pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / phrad pa'i sdug bsngal dang / bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / re ba 'bras bu med pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal lo //
translated: the suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, the suffering of the formative forces, the suffering of meeting with what is unpleasant, the suffering of separation from what is pleasant, the suffering of not obtaining what one longs for, and the suffering of the five aggregates of grasping.

original: gang sdug bsngal nyid gsum gsungs na /ðŸ”½ci sdug bsngal nyid gsum po dag gis sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad bsdus sam /
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal nyid gsum gsungs na / ci sdug bsngal nyid gsum po dag gis sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad bsdus sam /
translated: If the three kinds of suffering are taught,ðŸ”½are the eight kinds of suffering included in the three kinds of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad kyis sdug bsngal nyid gsum bsdus she na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad kyis sdug bsngal nyid gsum bsdus she na /
translated: Or are the three kinds of suffering included in the eight kinds of suffering?

original: gcig gis gcig bsdus te /
analyzed: gcig gis gcig bsdus te /
translated: They are mutually inclusive.

original: skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal gang gsungs pa 'dis ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal gang gsungs pa 'dis ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to //
translated: The suffering of birth, the suffering of old age, the suffering of sickness, the suffering of death, and the suffering of meeting with what is unpleasant, which are mentioned, demonstrate the suffering of suffering.

original: sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal zhes gang gsungs pa 'dis ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / gang 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal zhes gang gsungs pa 'dis ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to //
translated: The suffering of being separated from what is pleasant and the suffering of not obtaining what one longs for, which is also suffering, indicate the suffering of change.

original: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal lo zhes gang gsungs pa 'dis ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal lo zhes gang gsungs pa 'dis ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yongs su bstan to //
translated: The statement, â€œIn brief, the five perpetuating aggregates are suffering,â€ indicates the suffering of the formative forces.ðŸ”½The statement, â€œSuffering in terms of conventional truth and suffering in terms of ultimate truth,â€ indicates the suffering of suffering.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden par sdug bsngal ba dang / don dam pa'i bden par sdug bsngal bzhes gang gsungs pa la kun rdzob kyi bden par sdug bsngal ba ni gang yin /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden par sdug bsngal ba dang / don dam pa'i bden par sdug bsngal bzhes gang gsungs pa la kun rdzob kyi bden par sdug bsngal ba ni gang yin /
translated: What is suffering in terms of conventional truth?

original: don dam pa'i bden par sdug bsngal ba ni gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden par sdug bsngal ba ni gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is suffering in terms of ultimate truth?

original: skye ba'i sdug bsngal nas 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'i bar ni kun rdzob kyi bden par sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i sdug bsngal nas 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'i bar ni kun rdzob kyi bden par sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: The suffering of birth up to the statement, â€œThe suffering of not obtaining what one longs for is also suffering,â€ indicates suffering in terms of conventional truth.

original: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pa ni don dam pa'i bden par sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pa ni don dam pa'i bden par sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: In brief, the five aggregates of attachment are suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the general characteristic of the truth of suffering?

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid dang / stong ba'i mtshan nyid dang / bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid dang / stong ba'i mtshan nyid dang / bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is impermanence, it is suffering, it is empty, it is insubstantial.

original: mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of impermanence?

original: gang med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid dang / 'bral ba'i mtshan nyid dang / nye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / skad cig gi @75b mtshan nyid dang / rgyun gyi mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: gang med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid dang / 'bral ba'i mtshan nyid dang / nye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / skad cig gi @75b mtshan nyid dang / rgyun gyi mtshan nyid dang /
translated: It is the characteristic of non-existence, the characteristic of destruction, the characteristic of transformation, the characteristic of separation, the characteristic of proximity, the characteristic of reality, the characteristic of momentariness, the characteristic of continuity,

original: nang la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sems sna tshogs kyi rnam par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa rgud pa'i mtshan nyid dang / snod 'jig pa dang 'chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nang la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sems sna tshogs kyi rnam par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa rgud pa'i mtshan nyid dang / snod 'jig pa dang 'chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: and the characteristics of the destruction and evolution of the receptacle world.

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na ;
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na ;
translated: What is the characteristic of non-existence?

original: gang phung po dang khams dang / skye mched rnams la bdag dang / bdag gi dus rtag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: gang phung po dang khams dang / skye mched rnams la bdag dang / bdag gi dus rtag tu med pa'o //
translated: It is the fact that the aggregates, elements and sense bases are always devoid of a self and of anything pertaining to a self.

original: rnam par 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of destruction?

original: gang 'du byed skyes pa rnams kyi rnam par 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'du byed skyes pa rnams kyi rnam par 'jig pa'o //
translated: It is the destruction of the conditioned forces that have arisen.

original: 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of change?

original: gang 'du byed rnams gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang 'du byed rnams gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the transformation of the conditioned forces from one state to another.

original: 'bral ba'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'bral ba'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of separation?

original: gang 'du byed rnams la dbang byed pa nyams pa dang / gzhan dag gis bdag gir byas pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'du byed rnams la dbang byed pa nyams pa dang / gzhan dag gis bdag gir byas pa'o //
translated: It is the loss of control over conditioned forces and their appropriation by others.

original: nye ba'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: nye ba'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the proximate characteristic?

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis non pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis non pa'o //
translated: It is the state of being oppressed by impermanence.

original: chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of reality?

original: mi rtag pa nyid 'byung ba rgyus 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid 'byung ba rgyus 'brel pa'o //
translated: It is the state of being connected with the cause of the arising of impermanence.

original: skad cig gi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig gi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of momentariness?

original: 'du byed rnams skad cig gcig las phan chad du mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams skad cig gcig las phan chad du mi gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the fact that conditioned things do not remain for a second moment after their first moment.

original: rgyun gyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyun gyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of continuity?

original: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba'i rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba'i rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: It is the uninterrupted continuity of the arising of conditioned things since beginningless time.

original: nad la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: nad la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of sickness, etc. ?

original: khams dang / na tshod dang / srog rnams 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: khams dang / na tshod dang / srog rnams 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the transformation of the elements, of the stages of life, and of life itself.

original: sems sna tshogs kyi rnam par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems sna tshogs kyi rnam par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of the diversity of mental orientation?

original: res 'ga' 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems dang / res 'ga' 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / de bzhin du zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang ; zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: res 'ga' 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems dang / res 'ga' 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / de bzhin du zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang ; zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang /
translated: It is the fact that the mind is sometimes associated with attachment, sometimes free from attachment, sometimes associated with hatred, sometimes free from hatred, sometimes associated with delusion, sometimes free from delusion, and so on.

original: bsdus pa dang / g-yengs pa dang / bying ba dang / rab tu gzung ba dang / rgod pa dang / mi rgod pa dang / nye bar ma zhi ba dang / nye bar ma zhi ba dang / nye bar zhig ba dang / mnyam par gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: bsdus pa dang / g-yengs pa dang / bying ba dang / rab tu gzung ba dang / rgod pa dang / mi rgod pa dang / nye bar ma zhi ba dang / nye bar ma zhi ba dang / nye bar zhig ba dang / mnyam par gzhag pa dang /
translated: It is to be concentrated, distracted,ðŸ”½depressed, uplifted,ðŸ”½excited, not excited,ðŸ”½not peaceful, peaceful,ðŸ”½and in meditative equipoise.ðŸ”½

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par sems kyi 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par sems kyi 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the arising of the mind in the form of concentration, distraction, depression, excitation, tranquility, agitation, non-tranquility, non-agitation, and equipoise.

original: longs spyod 'byor ba rgud pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: longs spyod 'byor ba rgud pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of the decline of wealth?

original: 'byor ba thams cad kyi mtha' ni rgud pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'byor ba thams cad kyi mtha' ni rgud pa nyid do //
translated: The end of all wealth is its decline.

original: snod 'jig pa dang 'chags pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: snod 'jig pa dang 'chags pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of the destruction and evolution of the receptacle world?

original: 'jig par byed pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three destructions:

original: me dang / @76a * //
analyzed: me dang / @76a * //
translated: by fire,

original: chu dang / rlung ngo //
analyzed: chu dang / rlung ngo //
translated: water and wind.

original: 'jig pa na bsdus pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa na bsdus pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three destructions of the world:

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa'o //
translated: the second, third and fourth absorptions.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la ni gzhal med khang rnams dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / lhan cig 'gags pas 'jig cing 'chags so //ðŸ”½bskal pa bar ma gsum ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la ni gzhal med khang rnams dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / lhan cig 'gags pas 'jig cing 'chags so // bskal pa bar ma gsum ste /
translated: In the fourth meditation, the celestial palaces arise and perish with the sentient beings who inhabit them.ðŸ”½There are three intermediate kalpas of creation, duration, and destruction.

original: mu ge'i bskal pa bar ma dang / nad kyi bskal pa bar ma dang / mtshon cha'i bskal pa bar ma ste /ðŸ”½de dag gis bskal pa tshar phyin par 'gyur ro //ðŸ”½mar 'bri ba bar gyi bskal pa gcig dang / yar 'phel ba dang mar 'bri ba bcva brgyad dang / yar skye ba gcig ste /ðŸ”½bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'jig rten 'jig go //
analyzed: mu ge'i bskal pa bar ma dang / nad kyi bskal pa bar ma dang / mtshon cha'i bskal pa bar ma ste / de dag gis bskal pa tshar phyin par 'gyur ro // mar 'bri ba bar gyi bskal pa gcig dang / yar 'phel ba dang mar 'bri ba bcva brgyad dang / yar skye ba gcig ste / bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'jig rten 'jig go //
translated: The three intermediate kalpas are those of creation, duration, and destruction.ðŸ”½The world is created in one intermediate kalpa; it lasts for nineteen intermediate kalpas; and it perishes in one intermediate kalpa.ðŸ”½The world remains destroyed for nineteen intermediate kalpas.

original: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'jig rten zhig par 'dug go //ðŸ”½bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'jig rten 'chags so //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'jig rten zhig par 'dug go // bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'jig rten 'chags so //
translated: The world is created in one intermediate kalpa.ðŸ”½The world remains created for nineteen intermediate kalpas.ðŸ”½The world is destroyed in one intermediate kalpa.

original: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'jig rten chags nas 'dug go //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'jig rten chags nas 'dug go //
translated: The world remains destroyed for nineteen intermediate kalpas.

original: de dag ni bar gyi bskal pa brgyad cu ste /
analyzed: de dag ni bar gyi bskal pa brgyad cu ste /
translated: These make eighty intermediate kalpas.

original: de ni bskal pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de ni bskal pa chen po'o //
translated: This is a great kalpa.

original: bskal pa bgrang ba'i tshul des gzugs na spyod pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad do //
analyzed: bskal pa bgrang ba'i tshul des gzugs na spyod pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad do //
translated: The life expectancy of the gods of the realm of form and the formless realm is calculated in the same way.

original: sems can de dag gi tshe zad cing bsod nams zad la las kyang zad nas /
analyzed: sems can de dag gi tshe zad cing bsod nams zad la las kyang zad nas /
translated: When the life, merit and action of these sentient beings are exhausted,

original: gnas de nas shi 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas de nas shi 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they die and fall from their abode.

original: tshe zad pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: tshe zad pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is death through the exhaustion of life?

original: 'chi ba'i dus la bab pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus la bab pa'o //
translated: It is death when the time has come.

original: bsod nams zad pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bsod nams zad pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is death through the exhaustion of merit?

original: dus ma yin par 'chi ba ste /
analyzed: dus ma yin par 'chi ba ste /
translated: It is untimely death.

original: 'di ltar sems can de dag snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang bas bsod nams zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can de dag snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang bas bsod nams zad par 'gyur te /
translated: In fact, these sentient beings, by tasting the enjoyment of concentration, exhaust their merit;

original: des na dus la ma bab kyang 'chi'o //
analyzed: des na dus la ma bab kyang 'chi'o //
translated: they die before the exhaustion of their life.

original: las zad pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: las zad pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is death through the exhaustion of action?

original: der skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las yongs su gtugs pa'o //
analyzed: der skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las yongs su gtugs pa'o //
translated: It is death when the action which should produce the birth and life of a certain sentient being is exhausted.

original: sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyi gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyi gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal nyid gsum dang / sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad ni sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid gsum dang / sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad ni sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The three kinds of suffering and the eight kinds of suffering are called suffering.

original: ci'i phyir gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal zhes gsungs she na /
translated: Why is it said that whatever is impermanent is suffering?

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni gnyis kyi char gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni gnyis kyi char gtogs pa ste /
translated: Impermanence is included in two categories:

original: skye ba'i char gtogs pa dang / 'jig pa'i char gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i char gtogs pa dang / 'jig pa'i char gtogs pa'o //
translated: included in arising and included in destruction.

original: skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la brten nas sdug bsngal gyi @76b sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la brten nas sdug bsngal gyi @76b sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: Based on impermanence included in arising, the suffering of suffering is understood.

original: 'jig pa'i char gtogs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la brten nas 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i char gtogs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la brten nas 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: Based on impermanence included in destruction, the suffering of change is understood.

original: de gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la brten nas 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la brten nas 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: Based on impermanence included in both, the suffering of conditioned states is understood.

original: de la dgongs te bcom ldan 'das kyis ngas 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed 'gyur ba nyid la dgongs nas /
analyzed: de la dgongs te bcom ldan 'das kyis ngas 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed 'gyur ba nyid la dgongs nas /
translated: With that in mind, the Blessed One said, â€œI teach that the impermanence of conditioned states and the change of conditioned states

original: gang ci tshor yang rung /
analyzed: gang ci tshor yang rung /
translated: Whatever is felt

original: 'di ni 'dir sdug bsngal du gsungs so zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir sdug bsngal du gsungs so zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: is said to be suffering here.

original: yang skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos nyid dang rjes su 'brel ba'i 'du byed rnams la skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal brgyad mngon te /
analyzed: yang skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos nyid dang rjes su 'brel ba'i 'du byed rnams la skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal brgyad mngon te /
translated: Moreover, the eight sufferings are manifest in the formations that are associated with the reality of origination and destruction.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called suffering.

original: stong pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: stong pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of emptiness?

original: gang la gang med pa de ni des stong par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ste /
analyzed: gang la gang med pa de ni des stong par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ste /
translated: Whatever is absent in something, that is seen as empty of that.

original: 'di la lhag ma gang yin pa de ni 'dir yod pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'di la lhag ma gang yin pa de ni 'dir yod pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: Whatever remains there, that is known as it really is as present there.

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid la 'jug pa yang dag pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid la 'jug pa yang dag pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: This is the correct view that enters into emptiness.

original: phyin ci ma log pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called non-erroneous.

original: gang na ci zhig med ce na /
analyzed: gang na ci zhig med ce na /
translated: What is absent in what?

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la rtag pa dang brtan pa dang ther zug pa dang mi 'gyur ba'i chos can dang bdag dang bdag gi med do //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la rtag pa dang brtan pa dang ther zug pa dang mi 'gyur ba'i chos can dang bdag dang bdag gi med do //
translated: The aggregates, elements, and sense bases are devoid of permanence, stability, and enduringness, and of a self and what pertains to a self.

original: de lta bas na de dag ni des stong ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ni des stong ngo //
translated: Therefore, they are empty of that.

original: de la lhag ma yod pa ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de la lhag ma yod pa ci zhig ce na /
translated: What remains there?

original: gang bdag med pa de nyid de /
analyzed: gang bdag med pa de nyid de /
translated: That very selflessness.

original: de ltar bdag ni med kyi bdag med pa ni yod par stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag ni med kyi bdag med pa ni yod par stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand emptiness as the nonexistence of a self, but the existence of selflessness.

original: 'di las dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yod pa yang yod par /ðŸ”½med pa yang med par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'di las dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yod pa yang yod par / med pa yang med par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: With this in mind, the Blessed One said:

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: â€œOne should know that existence is truly as it is, and nonexistence is truly as it is.â€

original: yang stong pa nyid rnams pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang stong pa nyid rnams pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, there are three kinds of emptiness:

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin du yod pa ma yin pa'i stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin du yod pa ma yin pa'i stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid do //
translated: the emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of what is not there, and the emptiness of essential nature.

original: dang po ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid nye bar gzung bar blta'o //
analyzed: dang po ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid nye bar gzung bar blta'o //
translated: The first is to be understood as the imagined reality.

original: gnyis pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid nye bar gzung ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid nye bar gzung ba'o //
translated: The second is to be understood as the relative reality.

original: gsum pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid nye bar gzung bar blta'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid nye bar gzung bar blta'o //
translated: The third is to be understood as the perfect reality.

original: bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /ðŸ”½ji ltar bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis bdag tu btags pa'i mtshan nyid des /ðŸ”½phung po dang khams dang @77a * //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na / ji ltar bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis bdag tu btags pa'i mtshan nyid des / phung po dang khams dang @77a * //
translated: What is the characteristic of selflessness?

original: skye mched rnams mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: skye mched rnams mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is the fact that the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields are devoid of the characteristics imagined by the theorists of self.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams ni bdag gi mtshan nyid kyis bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams ni bdag gi mtshan nyid kyis bdag med pa'o //
translated: The aggregates, elements, and sense-fields are selfless by their very nature.

original: 'di la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes gsungs so //ðŸ”½bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di dag thams cad ni nga'i ba med do //ðŸ”½'di ni nga ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes gsungs so // bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di dag thams cad ni nga'i ba med do // 'di ni nga ma yin pa'o //
translated: With this in mind, the Lord has said, â€œAll things are selfless.â€

original: 'di ni nga'i bdag ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni nga'i bdag ma yin pa ste /
translated: The Lord has said, â€œAll this is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.â€

original: de ni 'di bzhin no zhes yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di bzhin no zhes yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should see it as it is, by means of right wisdom, in this way: â€œIt is thus.â€

original: zhes gsungs pa 'di'i don ci zhe na /ðŸ”½phyi'i dngos po 'di ni bdag gi ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa 'di'i don ci zhe na / phyi'i dngos po 'di ni bdag gi ma yin no //
translated: What is the meaning of this?ðŸ”½â€œThis external thing is not mine.â€

original: nang gi dngos po 'di ni nga ma yin no //
analyzed: nang gi dngos po 'di ni nga ma yin no //
translated: â€œThis internal thing is not I.â€

original: 'di ni nga'i bdag ma yin pa'o zhes bya bar dgongs nas gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni nga'i bdag ma yin pa'o zhes bya bar dgongs nas gsungs pa ste /
translated: â€œThis is not my self.â€

original: 'di ltar phyi'i dngos po la ni bdag gi rnam par dang / nang la ni bdag dang bdag gi rnam par bkag go //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi'i dngos po la ni bdag gi rnam par dang / nang la ni bdag dang bdag gi rnam par bkag go //
translated: Thus, he declares that the external thing is denied in the form of â€œmine,â€ and the internal thing is denied in the form of â€œIâ€ and â€œmine.â€

original: skad cig gi mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig gi mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it that impermanence is the characteristic of momentariness?

original: ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba skad cig ma yin pa de ltar gzugs kyang skad cig par blta ste /
analyzed: ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba skad cig ma yin pa de ltar gzugs kyang skad cig par blta ste /
translated: â€œJust as mind and mental functions are momentary, so too should form be regarded as momentary.â€

original: sems kyis zin pa dang sems dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa dang / sems 'gyur na de 'gyur ba dang / sems kyi gnas yin pa dang / sems kyi dbang gis byung ba dang / sems dbang sgyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyis zin pa dang sems dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa dang / sems 'gyur na de 'gyur ba dang / sems kyi gnas yin pa dang / sems kyi dbang gis byung ba dang / sems dbang sgyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is controlled by the mind.

original: yang mthar 'gyur bar dmigs pa dang / skyes nas kyang rkyen la mi ltos par rang gi ngang gis rnams par 'jig pa'i phyir gzugs kyang skad cig pa nyid du blta'o //
analyzed: yang mthar 'gyur bar dmigs pa dang / skyes nas kyang rkyen la mi ltos par rang gi ngang gis rnams par 'jig pa'i phyir gzugs kyang skad cig pa nyid du blta'o //
translated: Moreover, form should be regarded as momentary because it is observed to change in the end and because, even when it has arisen, it perishes by itself without depending on conditions.

original: gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
translated: Whatever form there is,

original: de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o //
analyzed: de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o //
translated: all of it is the four great elements and what is derived from the four great elements.
