original: zhes gang gsungs pa de ci las dgongs te gsungs she na /
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa de ci las dgongs te gsungs she na /
translated: With what intention was this said?

original: srid pa la dgongs nas gsungs so //
analyzed: srid pa la dgongs nas gsungs so //
translated: It was said with existence in mind.

original: phyogs gcig la brten pa'i dngos po'i don ni rgyur byas pa'i don te /
analyzed: phyogs gcig la brten pa'i dngos po'i don ni rgyur byas pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of derived is the meaning of based on one part.

original: 'dus pa gang las 'byung ba gang dmigs pa de ni de na yod do zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa gang las 'byung ba gang dmigs pa de ni de na yod do zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: If a certain aggregate arises from a certain element, then the latter exists in the former.

original: 'byung ba gcig las gyur pa'i 'dus pa yang yod /
analyzed: 'byung ba gcig las gyur pa'i 'dus pa yang yod /
translated: There is an aggregate that arises from one element,

original: 'byung ba gnyis las gyur pa yod pa nas /
analyzed: 'byung ba gnyis las gyur pa yod pa nas /
translated: there is an aggregate that arises from two elements,

original: 'byung ba thams cad las gyur ba yang yod do //
analyzed: 'byung ba thams cad las gyur ba yang yod do //
translated: up to an aggregate that arises from all elements.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la yang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gang 'dus pa gang la dmigs pa de ni @77b de na yod pa'o zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la yang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gang 'dus pa gang la dmigs pa de ni @77b de na yod pa'o zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: As for derived matter, the derived matter that is perceived in a certain aggregate exists in that aggregate.ðŸ”½The matter that is an aggregate is the accumulation of subtle atoms.

original: rdul phra rab bsags pa ni gzugs 'dus pa'o zhes gang brjod pa de la rdul phra rab lus med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab bsags pa ni gzugs 'dus pa'o zhes gang brjod pa de la rdul phra rab lus med par rig par bya'o //
translated: The subtle atom should be understood as partless.

original: blos mthar rab tu phye nas rdul phra rab tu rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: blos mthar rab tu phye nas rdul phra rab tu rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The subtle atom is established by the intellect as the ultimate limit of matter.

original: ril po'i 'du shes rnams par gzhig pa dang / gzugs la rdzas su yongs su grub pa med par 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ril po'i 'du shes rnams par gzhig pa dang / gzugs la rdzas su yongs su grub pa med par 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is in order to destroy the notion of a whole and to introduce the notion that matter does not exist as a substance.

original: yang sdug bsngal 'di ni shin tu rgyas la ma bsrabs pa dang / bsrabs pa dang / bsrabs pa yang ma yin la ma bsrabs pa'ang yin pa yang yod /
analyzed: yang sdug bsngal 'di ni shin tu rgyas la ma bsrabs pa dang / bsrabs pa dang / bsrabs pa yang ma yin la ma bsrabs pa'ang yin pa yang yod /
translated: There is a suffering that is very extensive and not reduced, that is reduced, that is neither reduced nor not reduced,

original: bar ma ma bsrabs pa yang yod /ðŸ”½bsrabs lam bsrabs pa yang yod /ðŸ”½ches bsrabs la bsrabs pa yang yod /
analyzed: bar ma ma bsrabs pa yang yod / bsrabs lam bsrabs pa yang yod / ches bsrabs la bsrabs pa yang yod /
translated: that is middling and not reduced,ðŸ”½that is reduced and reduced,ðŸ”½that is very reduced and reduced,

original: shin tu ches bsrabs la bsrabs pa yang yod /
analyzed: shin tu ches bsrabs la bsrabs pa yang yod /
translated: that is extremely reduced and reduced,

original: sdug bsngal ma yin la sdug bsngal du snang zhing bsrabs pa chen por nye bar gnas pa yang yod do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ma yin la sdug bsngal du snang zhing bsrabs pa chen por nye bar gnas pa yang yod do //
translated: that is not suffering but appears as suffering and is situated in great reduction.

original: sdug bsngal shin tu rgyas la ma bsrabs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal shin tu rgyas la ma bsrabs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is suffering that is very extensive and not reduced?

original: gang 'dod pa na spyod pa dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa na spyod pa dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is the suffering of those who are in the realm of desire and have not accumulated the roots of good.

original: bsrabs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsrabs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is suffering that is reduced?

original: de nyid thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa skyes pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa skyes pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is the suffering of those who have produced the elements that lead to liberation.

original: bsrabs pa yang yin la ma bsrabs pa yang yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsrabs pa yang yin la ma bsrabs pa yang yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is suffering that is both reduced and not reduced?

original: de nyid 'jig rten pas 'dod chags dang bral ba ba nyid du bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'jig rten pas 'dod chags dang bral ba ba nyid du bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is that of those who have accumulated the roots of good, in order to become detached from the world.

original: bar ma ma bsrabs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bar ma ma bsrabs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the intermediate one which is not reduced?

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnam par spangs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnam par spangs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is that of those who are born in the realm of form and who are devoid of the elements conducive to liberation.

original: bsrabs la ma bsrabs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsrabs la ma bsrabs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the reduced one which is not reduced?

original: gzugs med par skyes par thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams par spangs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gzugs med par skyes par thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams par spangs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is that of those who are born in the formless realm and who are devoid of the elements conducive to liberation.

original: ches bsrabs la bsrabs pa gang zhe na ;
analyzed: ches bsrabs la bsrabs pa gang zhe na ;
translated: What is the reduced one which is reduced?

original: gang slob pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gang slob pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is that of those who are in training.

original: shin tu ches bsrabs la bsrabs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: shin tu ches bsrabs la bsrabs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the very much reduced one which is reduced?

original: gang mi slob pa rnams kyi srog gi dbang po'i rkyen gyi ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: gang mi slob pa rnams kyi srog gi dbang po'i rkyen gyi ming dang gzugs so //
translated: It is the name-and-form which is the condition of the life faculty of those who are beyond training.

original: sdug bsngal ma yin la sdug bsngal du snang zhing bsrabs pa chen por nye bar gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ma yin la sdug bsngal du snang zhing bsrabs pa chen por nye bar gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is that which is not suffering but appears as suffering and which is situated in the great reduction?

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: It is the death of the bodhisattvas who have attained the perfection of the transcendences.

original: bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are born in existence according to their desire.

original: 'chi ba sdug bsngal lo zhes gang gsungs pa de la 'chi ba rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba sdug bsngal lo zhes gang gsungs pa de la 'chi ba rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Death is suffering. There are three kinds of death:

original: dge ba'i sems yod pa dang / mi dge ba'i sems yod pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems yod pa @78a * //ðŸ”½ste ; rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pas sam /ðŸ”½gzhan gyis bsgrubs pas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems yod pa dang / mi dge ba'i sems yod pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems yod pa @78a * // ste ; rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pas sam / gzhan gyis bsgrubs pas kyang rung ste /
translated: death with a virtuous mind, death with a nonvirtuous mind, and death with an ethically neutral mind.

original: sems kyi rgyu ba gsal ba ni dge ba'i sems yod pa'i 'chi bar blta'o //ðŸ”½rang gi mi dge ba'i sems bskyed pas sam /ðŸ”½gzhan gyis bsgrubs pas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyu ba gsal ba ni dge ba'i sems yod pa'i 'chi bar blta'o // rang gi mi dge ba'i sems bskyed pas sam / gzhan gyis bsgrubs pas kyang rung ste /
translated: Death with a virtuous mind should be understood as the clear mental process of one who has generated a virtuous mind, either through the power of his own roots of virtue or through the power of another.

original: sems rgyu ba gsal ba ni mi dge ba'i sems yod pa'i 'chi bar blta'o //
analyzed: sems rgyu ba gsal ba ni mi dge ba'i sems yod pa'i 'chi bar blta'o //
translated: Death with a nonvirtuous mind should be understood as the clear mental process of one who has generated a nonvirtuous mind, either through the power of his own roots of nonvirtue or through the power of another.ðŸ”½Death with a neutral mind should be understood as the clear mental process of one who has generated a neutral mind, either through the power of his own roots of neutral virtue or through the power of another.

original: sems kyi rgyu ba gsal yang rung mi gsal yang rung rkyen de gnyi ga ma tshang ba'i phyir mngon par 'du byed mi nus pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyu ba gsal yang rung mi gsal yang rung rkyen de gnyi ga ma tshang ba'i phyir mngon par 'du byed mi nus pa yang rung ste /
translated: Whether the movement of the mind is clear or not, it is unable to form anything because the two conditions are incomplete.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems yod pa'i 'chi bar blta'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems yod pa'i 'chi bar blta'o //
translated: Death with a neutral mind should be understood in the same way.

original: dge ba byed pa'i lus ni thob ma nyid smad grang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dge ba byed pa'i lus ni thob ma nyid smad grang bar 'gyur /
translated: The body of one who has done good deeds feels cold from below.

original: mi dge ba byed pa'i lus ni stod grang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba byed pa'i lus ni stod grang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The body of one who has done evil deeds feels cold from above.

original: de la mi dge ba byed pa'i bar ma do'i srid pa mngon par 'grub pa ni /ðŸ”½dper na phyar ba nag po'am /
analyzed: de la mi dge ba byed pa'i bar ma do'i srid pa mngon par 'grub pa ni / dper na phyar ba nag po'am /
translated: The manifestation of the intermediate existence of one who has done evil deedsðŸ”½is like a black blanket

original: mtshan mo mun pa mun nag tu snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo mun pa mun nag tu snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: or like the appearance of a very dark night.

original: dge ba byed pa ni dper na snam bu dkar po'am /
analyzed: dge ba byed pa ni dper na snam bu dkar po'am /
translated: The manifestation of one who has done good deeds is like a white blanket

original: zla ba'i 'od dang bcas pa'i mtshan mor snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i 'od dang bcas pa'i mtshan mor snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: or like the appearance of a night with moonlight.

original: bar ma do'i srid pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams su skye ba na'o //
analyzed: bar ma do'i srid pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams su skye ba na'o //
translated: The intermediate existence is in the desire realm and the form realm when one is born there.

original: gzugs med pa nas ni 'chi 'pho ba na'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa nas ni 'chi 'pho ba na'o //
translated: It is in the formless realm when one dies there.

original: de ni yid las byung ba dang dri za zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de ni yid las byung ba dang dri za zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: It is called â€œarisen from the mindâ€ and â€œGandharvaâ€.

original: de ltar thogs na zhig bdun gnas te /
analyzed: de ltar thogs na zhig bdun gnas te /
translated: It lasts seven days at the most.

original: de tshun chad kyis 'chi 'pho'o //
analyzed: de tshun chad kyis 'chi 'pho'o //
translated: It perishes before this period if the causes of its destruction are present.

original: ji ste na ldog go //
analyzed: ji ste na ldog go //
translated: What are these causes?

original: de na gnas pa yang las sog go //
analyzed: de na gnas pa yang las sog go //
translated: The fact of remaining in the intermediate existence, the intermediate existence itself, the action of beings, the action of the gods, the action of the elements.ðŸ”½The intermediate existence of beings who are to be reborn in a hells stays facing the place of rebirth, burning with the fire of lust.ðŸ”½The intermediate existence of beings who are to be reborn in Uttarakuru stays facing the place of rebirth, being in a state of satisfaction.

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i sems can rnams kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i sems can rnams kyang mthong ngo //
translated: The intermediate existence of beings who are to be reborn in the other realms stays facing the place of rebirth.ðŸ”½It is like a Gandharva, that is to say, it is nourished by odors.

original: gang du skye bar 'gyur ba de'i byad gzugs so //
analyzed: gang du skye bar 'gyur ba de'i byad gzugs so //
translated: It perishes through the exhaustion of the impetus of action which produces it, in the same way that a stone thrown into the air perishes with the exhaustion of the impetus which projects it.

original: 'gro ba la thags thogs med do //
analyzed: 'gro ba la thags thogs med do //
translated: It perishes through the exhaustion of its duration, in the same way that the life-force of beings in hell.ðŸ”½It perishes through the exhaustion of the place which serves as its support, in the same way that the sound of a conch shell.ðŸ”½It perishes through the exhaustion of its object, in the same way that the sound of a drum.ðŸ”½It perishes through the exhaustion of its action, in the same way that the sound of a musical instrument.

original: rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa bzhin du myur du 'gro zhing skye ba'i gnas su thogs so //ðŸ”½srang mda'i mthon dman gyi tshul du 'chi 'pho zhing nyid mtshams sbyor ro //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa bzhin du myur du 'gro zhing skye ba'i gnas su thogs so // srang mda'i mthon dman gyi tshul du 'chi 'pho zhing nyid mtshams sbyor ro //
translated: It perishes through the exhaustion of its cause, in the same way that a flame.ðŸ”½It perishes through the exhaustion of its projection, in the same way that the sound of an echo.ðŸ”½It perishes through the exhaustion of its impetus, in the same way that an arrow.ðŸ”½It perishes through the exhaustion of its duration, in the same way that the life-force of beings in hell.ðŸ”½It perishes through the exhaustion of the place which serves as its support, in the same way that the sound of a conch shell.

original: bar ma do'i srid pa na gnas pa ni skye ba'i gnas la 'dod chags bskyed de //
analyzed: bar ma do'i srid pa na gnas pa ni skye ba'i gnas la 'dod chags bskyed de //
translated: It perishes through the exhaustion of its object, in the same way that the sound of a drum.ðŸ”½It perishes through the exhaustion of its action, in the same way that the sound of a musical instrument.

original: de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa ni rkyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa ni rkyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: It perishes through the exhaustion of its cause, in the same way that a flame.ðŸ”½It perishes through the exhaustion of its projection, in the same way that the sound of

original: 'dod chags dang bcas par bar ma do'i srid pa 'gag cing nur nur po rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas par bar ma do'i srid pa 'gag cing nur nur po rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa 'byung ste /
translated: The intermediate existence of one who is subject to lust ceases and the kalala, which is endowed with consciousness, arises.

original: de ni rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: This is the result.

original: de'i 'og tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin /
translated: Then, as it is said in the Pratityasamutpada Sutra,

original: skye gnas bzhi po sgo nga las skye ba dang / mngal nas skye ba dang / drod gsher las @78b skye ba dang / brdzus te skye bar dbang po mgon par 'grub bo //
analyzed: skye gnas bzhi po sgo nga las skye ba dang / mngal nas skye ba dang / drod gsher las @78b skye ba dang / brdzus te skye bar dbang po mgon par 'grub bo //
translated: the faculties are completed in the four modes of birth: from the egg, from the womb, from moisture, and by transformation.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the truth of the origin?

original: nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i las so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i las so //
translated: It is the defilements and the actions which are the effect of the defilements.

original: gtso bor bstan pa ni //
analyzed: gtso bor bstan pa ni //
translated: The principal is taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sred pa yang 'byung ba can dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lan  pa de dang der mngon par dga' ba la kun 'byung ba'i bden par bstan pas bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sred pa yang 'byung ba can dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lan  pa de dang der mngon par dga' ba la kun 'byung ba'i bden par bstan pas bstan to //
translated: The Blessed One has taught craving as the truth of the origin, because it is the cause of the appearance of the new existence, because it is the cause of the continuation of the lineage of the families, and because it is the cause of the appearance of the world.

original: gtso bo'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: gtso bo'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the principal?

original: gang thams cad du 'gro ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang thams cad du 'gro ba'i don to //
translated: It is the meaning of â€œgoing everywhere.â€

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of â€œgoing everywhereâ€?

original: 'di ltar sred pa dngos po thams cad du 'gro ba dang / gnas skabs thams cad du 'gro ba dang / dus thams cad du 'gro ba dang / khams thams cad du 'gro ba dang / tshor ba thams cad du 'gro ba dang / rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sred pa dngos po thams cad du 'gro ba dang / gnas skabs thams cad du 'gro ba dang / dus thams cad du 'gro ba dang / khams thams cad du 'gro ba dang / tshor ba thams cad du 'gro ba dang / rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba'o //
translated: It is craving which goes everywhere in regard to things, goes everywhere in regard to situations, goes everywhere in regard to time, goes everywhere in regard to realms, goes everywhere in regard to feelings, and goes everywhere in regard to modes.

original: nyon mongs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is defilement?

original: grangs dang / mtshan nyid dang / 'byung ba dang / dmigs pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang / rnam grangs dang / log par zhugs pa dang / khams dang / ris dang / spong bas kyang nyon mongs par blta'o //
analyzed: grangs dang / mtshan nyid dang / 'byung ba dang / dmigs pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang / rnam grangs dang / log par zhugs pa dang / khams dang / ris dang / spong bas kyang nyon mongs par blta'o //
translated: It is defilement in regard to number, characteristics, origin, object, association, synonyms, perversion, realm, class, and abandonment.

original: grangs gang zhe na /
analyzed: grangs gang zhe na /
translated: What is number?

original: nyon mongs pa drug gam bcu'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa drug gam bcu'o //
translated: It is six or ten defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six defilements?

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom dang / lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom dang / lta ba'o //
translated: They are desire, anger, pride, ignorance, doubt, and views.

original: de dag nyid lta ba rnams pa lnga'i bye brag gis bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag nyid lta ba rnams pa lnga'i bye brag gis bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: They are ten in number by way of the specific divisions of the five types of views.

original: mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is their characteristic?

original: chos gang 'byung ba na rab tu ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos gang 'byung ba na rab tu ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du 'byung ste /
translated: It is the arising of a phenomenon in an unpeaceful way.

original: de byung bas sems kyi rgyud rab tu ma zhi bar 'byung ba de nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de byung bas sems kyi rgyud rab tu ma zhi bar 'byung ba de nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: When it arises, the mental continuum arises in an unpeaceful way. This is the characteristic of the mental afflictions.

original: 'byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is their origin?

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs par gyur pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnas kyi chos kyang snang bar gyur pa dang / de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs par gyur pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnas kyi chos kyang snang bar gyur pa dang / de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: It is the non-abandonment of the latent tendencies of the mental afflictions, the appearance of objects that are the basis of the mental afflictions, and the presence of incorrect mental activity.

original: de lta bu las nyon mongs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu las nyon mongs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the mental afflictions arise.

original: dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is their object?

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi dmigs par blta'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi dmigs par blta'o //
translated: All the defilements are the objective supports of all the defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gzhi yang dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gzhi yang dmigs pa'o //
translated: The basis of the defilements is also their objective support.

original: ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom ma gtogs par 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa ni sa gong ma la mi dmigs so //ðŸ”½sa gong ma pa'i nyon @79a * //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom ma gtogs par 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa ni sa gong ma la mi dmigs so // sa gong ma pa'i nyon @79a * //
translated: With the exception of ignorance, view and doubt, the defilements of the realm of desire do not have a higher stage for their object.

original: mongs pa ni sa 'og ma la dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mongs pa ni sa 'og ma la dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The defilements of a higher stage do not have a lower stage for their object.

original: 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag la dmigs pa ma yin par blta ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag la dmigs pa ma yin par blta ste /
translated: The defilements that have cessation and the path for their object do not have them for their object in the manner in which you think.

original: de'i dmigs pa ni des yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ni des yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: The object of the defilements is that which is imagined by the defilements.

original: gzhi med pa la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa ni lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi med pa la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa ni lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: The defilements that have a non-existent thing for their object are associated with the views.

original: de las gzhan pa ni gzhi dang bcas pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni gzhi dang bcas pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The others have an existent thing for their object.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is association?

original: 'dod chags ni khong khro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni khong khro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Desire is not associated with hatred.

original: khong khro ba dang ji lta bar the tshom dang yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: khong khro ba dang ji lta bar the tshom dang yang de bzhin no //
translated: Doubt is associated with anger in the same way that it is associated with craving.

original: lhag ma ni de dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni de dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: The other anuÅ›ayas are associated with anger.

original: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba ji lta ba de bzhin du khong khor ba yang 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba ji lta ba de bzhin du khong khor ba yang 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: As with craving, anger is not associated with conceit, the afflicted views, or doubt.

original: nga rgyal ni khong khro ba dang the tshom dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no /
analyzed: nga rgyal ni khong khro ba dang the tshom dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no /
translated: Conceit is not associated with anger or doubt.

original: ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang ma 'dres pa yang yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang ma 'dres pa yang yin no //
translated: Ignorance is associated with all the other anuÅ›ayas, and it is also uncombined.

original: ma 'dres pa ni bden pa rnams mi shes pa'o //ðŸ”½lta ba ni khong khro ba dang the tshom dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa ni bden pa rnams mi shes pa'o // lta ba ni khong khro ba dang the tshom dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Uncombined ignorance is the non-comprehension of the Truths.ðŸ”½The afflicted views are not associated with anger or doubt.

original: the tshom ni 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: the tshom ni 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Doubt is not associated with craving, conceit, or the afflicted views.

original: khro ba la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khro ba la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: The subsidiary defilements such as anger are not mutually concomitant.

original: ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa ni mi dge ba thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa ni mi dge ba thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Lack of self-respect and lack of modesty are concomitant with all unwholesome .

original: rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / bag med pa ni nyon mongs pa can thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / bag med pa ni nyon mongs pa can thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Dullness, agitation, lack of faith, laziness and negligence are concomitant with all defilements.

original: rnam grangs gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam grangs gang zhe na /
translated: What are the synonyms?

original: kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / bag la nyal dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa dang / chu bo dang / sbyor ba dang / nye bar len pa dang / mdud pa dang / sgrib pa dang /
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / bag la nyal dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa dang / chu bo dang / sbyor ba dang / nye bar len pa dang / mdud pa dang / sgrib pa dang /
translated: Fetters, bonds, latent tendencies, subsidiary defilements, entanglements, floods, yokes, clingings, knots, hindrances,

original: tha ba dang / dri ma dang / sdig pa dang / zug rdu dang / ci yang dang / nyes par spyod pa dang / zag pa dang / phongs pa dang / yongs su gdung pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / 'thab pa dang / rims nad dang /
analyzed: tha ba dang / dri ma dang / sdig pa dang / zug rdu dang / ci yang dang / nyes par spyod pa dang / zag pa dang / phongs pa dang / yongs su gdung pa dang / 'khrug pa dang / 'thab pa dang / rims nad dang /
translated: afflictions, stains, sins, arrows, all, misdeeds, outflows, poverty, distress, quarrels, fights, fevers,

original: nags sbyor dang / gags zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: nags sbyor dang / gags zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: and entanglements.

original: kun tu sbyor ba rnams ni du zhig /
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba rnams ni du zhig /
translated: How many fetters are there?

original: ji ltar gang du sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gang du sbyor zhe na /
translated: How are they fetters?

original: kun tu sbyor @79b ba dgu ste /
analyzed: kun tu sbyor @79b ba dgu ste /
translated: There are nine fetters:ðŸ”½the fetters of attachment, repugnance, pride, ignorance, views, adherence,

original: rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / khong khro ba'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / nga rgyal gyi kun tu sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i kun dang sbyor ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang /ðŸ”½the tshom gyi kun tu sbyor ba dang / phrag dog gi kun tu sbyor ba dang / ser sna'i kun tu sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / khong khro ba'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / nga rgyal gyi kun tu sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i kun dang sbyor ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang /ðŸ”½the tshom gyi kun tu sbyor ba dang / phrag dog gi kun tu sbyor ba dang / ser sna'i kun tu sbyor ba'o //
translated: doubt, jealousy, and miserliness.

original: rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: The fetter of attachment is the passion of the three realms.

original: rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / ldan pa ni khams gsum pa la yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / ldan pa ni khams gsum pa la yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is bound by the fetter of attachment does not become disgusted with the three realms.

original: yid mi 'byung bas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod do //
analyzed: yid mi 'byung bas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod do //
translated: Because of not being disgusted, one does not practice the wholesome and practices the unwholesome.

original: des phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang kun tu sbyor ro //
analyzed: des phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang kun tu sbyor ro //
translated: Because of that, one is bound to suffering in the future, since suffering is produced.

original: khong khro ba'i kun tu sbyor ba ni sems can dang sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas kyi chos rnams la sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
analyzed: khong khro ba'i kun tu sbyor ba ni sems can dang sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas kyi chos rnams la sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
translated: The fetter of repugnance is the mental offense with regard to sentient beings, suffering, and things that cause suffering.

original: khong khro ba'i kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni khong khro ba'i rgyu las sems yal bar mi 'dor te /
analyzed: khong khro ba'i kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni khong khro ba'i rgyu las sems yal bar mi 'dor te /
translated: One who is bound by the fetter of repugnance does not abandon the cause of repugnance in the mind.

original: des na mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod do //
analyzed: des na mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod do //
translated: Because of that, one does not practice the wholesome and practices the unwholesome.

original: des phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: des phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyor ro //
translated: Because of that, one is bound to suffering in the future, since suffering is produced.

original: nga rgyal gyi kun tu sbyor ba ni nga rgyal bdun te /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi kun tu sbyor ba ni nga rgyal bdun te /
translated: The fetter of pride is sevenfold:ðŸ”½pride, excessive pride, overweening pride,ðŸ”½pride of â€œI am,â€ excessive pride,ðŸ”½conceptive pride,

original: nga rgyal dang / che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: and false pride.

original: nga rgyal gang zhe na /ðŸ”½chung ngu bas bdag che ba'am /
analyzed: nga rgyal gang zhe na / chung ngu bas bdag che ba'am /
translated: What is pride?

original: mtshungs pa dang mtshungs so snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa dang mtshungs so snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the inflation of the mind which, in relation to others, considers itself superior or considers itself equal.

original: che ba'i nga rgyal gang zhe na /ðŸ”½mtshungs pa bas bdag che ba'am /
analyzed: che ba'i nga rgyal gang zhe na / mtshungs pa bas bdag che ba'am /
translated: What is excessive pride?

original: che ba dang mtshungs so snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: che ba dang mtshungs so snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the inflation of the mind which, in relation to those considered equal, considers itself superior or equal.

original: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal gang zhe na /
analyzed: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal gang zhe na /
translated: What is overweening pride?

original: che ba bas kyang bdag ches che'o snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: che ba bas kyang bdag ches che'o snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the inflation of the mind which, in relation to those considered superior, considers itself superior.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gang zhe na /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gang zhe na /
translated: What is pride of â€œI amâ€?ðŸ”½It is the inflation of the mind which is attached to the idea of â€œI am.â€

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la bdag gam bdag gir yang dag par rjes su lta ba'i sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la bdag gam bdag gir yang dag par rjes su lta ba'i sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the inflation of the mind which considers as the self or as belonging to the self that which is the five aggregates of attachment, or the view that the self possesses the aggregates, or the view that the self is possessed by the aggregates.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gang zhe na /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gang zhe na /
translated: What is the false view of holding to an extreme?

original: gong ma'i khyad par thob par bya ba ma thob par bdag gis thob bo snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //ðŸ”½cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal @80a * //
analyzed: gong ma'i khyad par thob par bya ba ma thob par bdag gis thob bo snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o // cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal @80a * //
translated: It is the view that the world is eternal or that the world is finite, etc.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is the false view?ðŸ”½It is the denial of cause and effect and of action as cause, or the denial of the noble truths, or the denial of the fact that there are ascetics and brahmins who have higher knowledge.ðŸ”½What is the esteeming of views?

original: ches 'phags pa bas bdag cung zad gcig gis chung ngo snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ches 'phags pa bas bdag cung zad gcig gis chung ngo snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the inflation of the mind which considers as the best, the supreme, the highest and the most excellent, a view which is only a private opinion.

original: log pa'i nga rgyal gang zhe na /ðŸ”½yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa la /
analyzed: log pa'i nga rgyal gang zhe na / yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa la /
translated: What is the esteeming of morality and asceticism?

original: bdag yon tan dang ldan no snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //ðŸ”½nga rgyal gyi kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa yongs su mi shes so //
analyzed: bdag yon tan dang ldan no snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //ðŸ”½nga rgyal gyi kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa yongs su mi shes so //
translated: It is the inflation of the mind which considers as purifying that which is not defiled by nature.ðŸ”½What is doubt?ðŸ”½It is indecision about the truths.

original: yongs su ma shes na ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen nas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod de /
analyzed: yongs su ma shes na ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen nas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod de /
translated: If one does not understand them, one becomes attached to the grasping of â€œIâ€ and â€œmine,â€ and one engages in non-virtue and does not engage in virtue.

original: des phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: des phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyor ro //
translated: Because of that, one is connected to suffering, since suffering is produced in the future.

original: ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni khams gsum pa'i mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni khams gsum pa'i mi shes pa'o //
translated: The fetter of ignorance is the lack of understanding of the three realms.

original: ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi chos rnams dang kun 'byung ba'i chos rnams la lhag par chags so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi chos rnams dang kun 'byung ba'i chos rnams la lhag par chags so //
translated: One who possesses the fetter of ignorance is attached to the phenomena of suffering and the phenomena of the origin.

original: de dag la lhag par chags pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod do /
analyzed: de dag la lhag par chags pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod do /
translated: Because of that attachment, one engages in non-virtue and does not engage in virtue.

original: des phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: des phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyor ro //
translated: Because of that, one is connected to suffering, since suffering is produced in the future.

original: lha ba'i kun tu sbyor ba ni lta ba gsum ste /
analyzed: lha ba'i kun tu sbyor ba ni lta ba gsum ste /
translated: The fetter of views is the three views:

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba'o //
translated: the view of the transitory collection, the view of extremes, and wrong views.

original: lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni log pas nges par 'byung ba yongs su tshol lo //
analyzed: lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni log pas nges par 'byung ba yongs su tshol lo //
translated: One who is bound by the fetter of views seeks a false liberation.

original: mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: mngon par zhen to //
translated: One becomes attached to it.

original: log pas nges par 'byung ba la mngon par zhen pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod de /
analyzed: log pas nges par 'byung ba la mngon par zhen pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod de /
translated: Because of attachment to a false liberation, one practices what is not wholesome and does not practice what is wholesome.

original: des phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: des phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyor ro //
translated: Because of that, one is bound to suffering in the future because of the production of suffering.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The fetter of clinging consists of the clinging to false views and the clinging to mere morality and ritualism.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni log pas nges par 'byung ba'i thabs la mngon par zhen pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod do /
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni log pas nges par 'byung ba'i thabs la mngon par zhen pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod do /
translated: One who is bound by the fetter of clinging practices what is not wholesome and does not practice what is wholesome because of attachment to a false means of liberation.

original: des phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: des phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyor ro //
translated: Because of that, one is bound to suffering in the future because of the production of suffering.

original: the tshom gyi kun tu sbyor ba ni bden pa rnams la yid gnyis za ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom gyi kun tu sbyor ba ni bden pa rnams la yid gnyis za ba'o //
translated: The fetter of doubt is uncertainty about the truths.

original: the tshom gyi kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog la som nyi za zhing /
analyzed: the tshom gyi kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog la som nyi za zhing /
translated: One who is bound by the fetter of doubt is uncertain about the Jewel of the Buddha,

original: chos dkon mchog dang dge 'dun dkon mchog la som nyi za ba'o //
analyzed: chos dkon mchog dang dge 'dun dkon mchog la som nyi za ba'o //
translated: uncertain about the Jewel of the Dharma and the Jewel of the Saá¹…gha.

original: dkon mchog rnams la som nyi za bas legs par bsgrub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkon mchog rnams la som nyi za bas legs par bsgrub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of being uncertain about the Jewels, one does not practice well.

original: @80b dkon mchog rnams la legs par mi bsgrub pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod de /
analyzed: @80b dkon mchog rnams la legs par mi bsgrub pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod de /
translated: Because of not practicing well with regard to the Jewels, one does not practice what is wholesome and practices what is unwholesome.

original: des phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sangs rgyas dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: des phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sangs rgyas dang sbyor ro //
translated: Because of that, one brings about the manifestation of suffering in the future.

original: phrag dog gi kun tu sbyor ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags pas pha rol gyi phung sum tshogs pa la mi bzod par byas pa'i sems khong nas 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: phrag dog gi kun tu sbyor ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags pas pha rol gyi phung sum tshogs pa la mi bzod par byas pa'i sems khong nas 'khrug pa'o //
translated: The fetter of envy is the inner disturbance of mind that is made by the intolerance of another's success, due to excessive attachment to gain and honor.

original: phrag dog gi kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti gces su 'dzin pa yin gyi chos gces su 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phrag dog gi kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti gces su 'dzin pa yin gyi chos gces su 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: One who is bound by the fetter of envy values gain and honor, but does not value the Dharma.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti gces su 'dzin pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod de /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti gces su 'dzin pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod de /
translated: Because of valuing gain and honor, one engages in non-virtue and does not engage in virtue.

original: des phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: des phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyor ro //
translated: Because of that, one is bound to suffering in the future, since suffering is produced.

original: ser sna'i kun tu sbyor ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags pa nyid yod byed rnams la sems kun tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ser sna'i kun tu sbyor ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags pa nyid yod byed rnams la sems kun tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The fetter of stinginess is the mind's attachment to one's own possessions.

original: ser sna'i kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni sogs pa gces su 'dzin pa yin gyi yo byed bsnyungs pa gces su 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ser sna'i kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni sogs pa gces su 'dzin pa yin gyi yo byed bsnyungs pa gces su 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: One who is bound by the fetter of stinginess values possessions, but does not value reducing possessions.

original: sogs pa gces su 'dzin pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod de /
analyzed: sogs pa gces su 'dzin pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod de /
translated: Because of valuing possessions, one engages in non-virtue and does not engage in virtue.

original: des phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: des phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyor ro //
translated: Because of that, one is bound to suffering in the future, since suffering is produced.

original: 'ching ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: 'ching ba ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three bonds:

original: 'dod chags kyi 'ching ba dang / zhe sdang gi 'ching ba dang ; gti mug gi 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi 'ching ba dang / zhe sdang gi 'ching ba dang ; gti mug gi 'ching ba'o //
translated: the bond of desire, the bond of hatred, and the bond of ignorance.

original: 'dod chags kyi 'ching bas ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid la 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi 'ching bas ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid la 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The bond of desire binds one to the suffering of change.

original: zhe sdang gi 'ching bas ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid la 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi 'ching bas ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid la 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The bond of hatred binds one to the suffering of pain.

original: gting mug gi 'ching bas ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid la 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gting mug gi 'ching bas ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid la 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The bond of ignorance binds one to the suffering of the formative forces.

original: yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la brten nas /
analyzed: yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la brten nas /
translated: Moreover, desire, hatred, and ignorance are bonds because,

original: dge ba la sbyor ba na 'dod pa bzhin du byed pa mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: dge ba la sbyor ba na 'dod pa bzhin du byed pa mi 'thob ste /
translated: based on them, one is unable to act as one wishes in relation to the wholesome.

original: de'i phyir yang de dag ni 'ching ba rnams so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang de dag ni 'ching ba rnams so //
translated: Therefore, they are called bonds.

original: bag la nyal ni bdun te /
analyzed: bag la nyal ni bdun te /
translated: There are seven latent proclivities:

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal dang / khong khro ba'i bag la nyal dang ; srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal dang / nga rgyal gyi bag la nyal dang / ma rig pa'i bag la nyal dang / lta ba'i bag la nyal dang /ðŸ”½the tshom gyi bag la nyal lo //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal dang / khong khro ba'i bag la nyal dang ; srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal dang / nga rgyal gyi bag la nyal dang / ma rig pa'i bag la nyal dang / lta ba'i bag la nyal dang / the tshom gyi bag la nyal lo //
translated: and view.

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan @81a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan @81a * //
translated: The latent tendency of desire realm attachment is the negative tendency that accords with desire realm attachment.

original: len to // khong khro ba'i bag la nyal ni khong khro ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: len to // khong khro ba'i bag la nyal ni khong khro ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len to //
translated: The latent tendency of anger is the negative tendency that accords with anger.

original: srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len to //
translated: The latent tendency of desire realm attachment to existence is the negative tendency that accords with attachment to existence in the form and formless realms.

original: nga rgyal gyi bag la nyal ni nga rgyal gyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi bag la nyal ni nga rgyal gyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len to //
translated: The latent tendency of pride is the negative tendency that accords with pride.

original: ma rig pa'i bag la nyal ni ma rig pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i bag la nyal ni ma rig pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len to //
translated: The latent tendency to ignorance is the negative reflex that is in conformity with ignorance.

original: lta ba'i bag la nyal ni lta ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: lta ba'i bag la nyal ni lta ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len to //
translated: The latent tendency to views is the negative reflex that is in conformity with views.

original: the tshom gyi bag la nyal ni the tshom gyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: the tshom gyi bag la nyal ni the tshom gyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len to //
translated: The latent tendency to doubt is the negative reflex that is in conformity with doubt.

original: 'dod pa tshol ba ma spangs pas ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal dang / khong khro ba'i bag la nyal rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa tshol ba ma spangs pas ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal dang / khong khro ba'i bag la nyal rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The latent tendency to passion for sense-pleasures and the latent tendency to hostility increase because of the non-abandoning of the search for sense-pleasures.

original: srid pa tshol ba ma spangs pas ni srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa tshol ba ma spangs pas ni srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The latent tendency to passion for existence increases because of the non-abandoning of the search for existence.

original: log pas tshangs par spyod pa tshol bam spangs pas ni nga rgyal gyi bag la nyal dang / ma rig pa'i bag la nyal dang / lta ba'i bag la nyal dang / the tshom gyi bag la nyal rgyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: log pas tshangs par spyod pa tshol bam spangs pas ni nga rgyal gyi bag la nyal dang / ma rig pa'i bag la nyal dang / lta ba'i bag la nyal dang / the tshom gyi bag la nyal rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: The latent tendency to pride, the latent tendency to ignorance, the latent tendency to views, and the latent tendency to doubt increase because of the non-abandoning of the search for a false purity.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni gnyen po chung du tsam gyis kyang khengs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni gnyen po chung du tsam gyis kyang khengs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, they are puffed up by a mere small antidote.

original: bden pa rnams la rmongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa rnams la rmongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are confused about the truths.

original: log pas thar pa dang thar pa'i thabs la rtog par byed do //
analyzed: log pas thar pa dang thar pa'i thabs la rtog par byed do //
translated: They imagine that liberation and the means to liberation are wrong.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi bstan pa dam pa'i chos 'dul ba la som nyi za'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi bstan pa dam pa'i chos 'dul ba la som nyi za'o //
translated: They doubt the teaching of the Buddha, the holy Dharma, and the Vinaya.

original: the tshom za'o //ðŸ”½nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa gang dag yin pa de dag nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang yin no //
analyzed: the tshom za'o // nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa gang dag yin pa de dag nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang yin no //
translated: They are doubtful.ðŸ”½The secondary defilements are the defilements.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin la nyon mongs pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin la nyon mongs pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There are also secondary defilements that are not defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i 'du byed kyi phung po nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i 'du byed kyi phung po nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: The defiled aggregate of formations that is other than the defilements.

original: yang 'dod chags ni sems las byung ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'dod chags ni sems las byung ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, attachment is a secondary defilement of the mind.

original: zhe sdang dang gti mug ni sems las byung ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang gti mug ni sems las byung ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Aversion and delusion are secondary defilements of the mind.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa des sems nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can du gyur na /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa des sems nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can du gyur na /
translated: When the mind is defiled by this secondary defilement,

original: chags pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: chags pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur /
translated: it is not free from attachment,

original: grol bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: grol bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: it is not liberated,

original: sgrib pa de ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa de ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that obscuration has not been abandoned.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
translated: As the Lord has said:

original: sems 'di yun ring po nas 'dod chags kyis kun @81b nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa /
analyzed: sems 'di yun ring po nas 'dod chags kyis kun @81b nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa /
translated: â€œFor a long time this mind has been defiled by attachment,

original: zhe sdang dang gti mug gis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang gti mug gis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: defiled by hatred and delusion.â€ðŸ”½There are eight entanglements:ðŸ”½torpor, sleep, restlessness,

original: kun nas dkris pa ni brgyad de rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa ni brgyad de rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa'o //
translated: worry, envy, avarice, lack of conscience, and lack of shame.

original: zhi gnas kyi dus dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus dang / btang snyoms kyi dus dang / de dag gi gzhi dang po rnam par dag pa'i dus na /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi dus dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus dang / btang snyoms kyi dus dang / de dag gi gzhi dang po rnam par dag pa'i dus na /
translated: At the time of serenity, at the time of exertion, at the time of equanimity, and at the time of the purification of the first basis,

original: yang dang yang shas cher sems la kun nas 'khri bar byed pas kun nas dkris pa dag go //
analyzed: yang dang yang shas cher sems la kun nas 'khri bar byed pas kun nas dkris pa dag go //
translated: They are called fetters because they bind the mind to the object, and they bind the mind again and again.

original: chu bo ni bzhi ste 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo dang / lta ba'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo'o //
analyzed: chu bo ni bzhi ste 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo dang / lta ba'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo'o //
translated: There are four floods: the flood of desire, the flood of existence, the flood of views, and the flood of ignorance.

original: rgyun phyogs su khyer bar byed pa'i phyir chu bo dag go //
analyzed: rgyun phyogs su khyer bar byed pa'i phyir chu bo dag go //
translated: They are called floods because they carry one off in the direction of the stream.

original: 'dod pa tshol ba la zhugs pa'i ni dang po'o //ðŸ”½srid pa tshol ba la zhugs pa'i ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa tshol ba la zhugs pa'i ni dang po'o // srid pa tshol ba la zhugs pa'i ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The first is for those who are engaged in seeking desire.ðŸ”½The second is for those who are engaged in seeking existence.

original: log bas tshangs par spyod pa tshol ba la zhugs pa'i ni tha ma gnyis te /
analyzed: log bas tshangs par spyod pa tshol ba la zhugs pa'i ni tha ma gnyis te /
translated: The last two are for those who are engaged in seeking a false purity.

original: gnas pa dang gnas 'brel pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: gnas pa dang gnas 'brel pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: They are floods because they carry one off in the direction of the stream, and because they are related to the place where one is carried off.

original: sbyor ba ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four yokes:

original: 'dod pa'i sbyor ba dang / srid pa'i sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sbyor ba dang / srid pa'i sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: the yoke of desire, the yoke of existence, the yoke of views, and the yoke of ignorance.

original: 'bral ba'i bar du gcod pa'i phyir sbyor ba rnams te /
analyzed: 'bral ba'i bar du gcod pa'i phyir sbyor ba rnams te /
translated: They are called yokes because they obstruct liberation.

original: de dag kyang tshol ba la zhugs pa gsum po rnams kyi yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang tshol ba la zhugs pa gsum po rnams kyi yin te /
translated: They are for those who are engaged in seeking the three.

original: ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
translated: They are called appropriators because they appropriate the new existence.

original: nye bar len pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four appropriators:

original: 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa dang / lta ba'i nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa dang / lta ba'i nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
translated: the appropriator of desire, the appropriator of view, the appropriator of morality and ascetic practices, and the appropriator of the theory of a self.

original: rtsod pa'i rtsa ba nye bar len pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i rtsa ba nye bar len pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are the root of dispute.

original: de'i phyir yang srid pa nye bar len pa'i phyir nye bar len pa rnams so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang srid pa nye bar len pa'i phyir nye bar len pa rnams so //
translated: They are appropriators because they appropriate a new existence.

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / ltag par zhen pa dang / rnam par bcings pa dang / yongs su zhen pa dang / kun tu 'dod chags kyi rgyus khyim pa rnams dang / khyim pa rnams su rtsod do //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / ltag par zhen pa dang / rnam par bcings pa dang / yongs su zhen pa dang / kun tu 'dod chags kyi rgyus khyim pa rnams dang / khyim pa rnams su rtsod do //
translated: Householders dispute with householders because of desire, attachment, bondage, complete attachment, and complete desire.

original: rtsod pa de'i rtsa ba ni dang po yin no //
analyzed: rtsod pa de'i rtsa ba ni dang po yin no //
translated: The first is the root of that dispute.

original: lta ba la 'dod chags dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / rnam par bcings pa dang / yongs su zhen pa dang / kun tu 'dod chags kyi rgyus rab tu byung ba rnams dang / rab tu byung ba rnams su rtsod de /
analyzed: lta ba la 'dod chags dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / rnam par bcings pa dang / yongs su zhen pa dang / kun tu 'dod chags kyi rgyus rab tu byung ba rnams dang / rab tu byung ba rnams su rtsod de /
translated: They dispute with those who are householders and with those who have gone forth, saying:ðŸ”½â€œYou are not a true householder, you are not a true renunciant.â€

original: rtsod pa de'i rtsa ba ni nye bar len pa gsum po dag ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa de'i rtsa ba ni nye bar len pa gsum po dag ste /
translated: The root of that dispute is the three clingings.

original: lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis ni lta ba'i nye bar @82a * //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis ni lta ba'i nye bar @82a * //
translated: The sixty-two views are the clinging to views.

original: len pa'o // phal cher brtul zhugs dang / dka' thub drag po so so tha dad pa dag ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: len pa'o // phal cher brtul zhugs dang / dka' thub drag po so so tha dad pa dag ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The various extreme austerities are the clinging to observances and rituals.

original: de dag gi gnas 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi gnas 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The belief in a real self, which is the basis of those views, is the clinging to a substantial personality.

original: lta ba'i nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pas ni mu stegs can nang phan tshun rtsod do //
analyzed: lta ba'i nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pas ni mu stegs can nang phan tshun rtsod do //
translated: The dispute among the heterodox is due to the clinging to views and to observances and rituals.

original: bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pas ni mu stegs can rnams dang chos 'di pa rnams su rtsod do //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pas ni mu stegs can rnams dang chos 'di pa rnams su rtsod do //
translated: The dispute between the non-Buddhists and the Buddhists is due to the grasping of the self.

original: de ltar de dag rtsod pa'i rtsa ba nye bar len pa la mngon par zhen pas phyi ma la yang srid pa nye bar len to //
analyzed: de ltar de dag rtsod pa'i rtsa ba nye bar len pa la mngon par zhen pas phyi ma la yang srid pa nye bar len to //
translated: Thus, because of their attachment to the root of dispute, they grasp existence in the future.

original: des na nye bar len pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na nye bar len pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called the appropriators.

original: mdud pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: mdud pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four knots:

original: brnab sems lus kyi mdud pa dang / gnod sems lus kyi mdud pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa lus kyi mdud pa dang / 'di bden no zhes mchog tu 'dzin cing mngon par zhen pa lus kyi mdud pa'o //
analyzed: brnab sems lus kyi mdud pa dang / gnod sems lus kyi mdud pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa lus kyi mdud pa dang / 'di bden no zhes mchog tu 'dzin cing mngon par zhen pa lus kyi mdud pa'o //
translated: the knot of covetousness, the knot of malice, the knot of the conceit â€œI amâ€, and the knot of holding on to a particular view as paramount.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyi bar du gcod pa'i phyir mdud pa rnams te /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyi bar du gcod pa'i phyir mdud pa rnams te /
translated: They are called knots because they obstruct the attainment of the body of concentration.

original: 'di ltar g-yeng ba'i rgyu ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar g-yeng ba'i rgyu ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four causes of distraction:

original: zang zing cung zad tsam gyi rgyus sems g-yeng ba dang / rtsod pa la legs par mi bsgrub pa'i rgyu dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs drag pos sdug bsngal bar gnas pa'i rgyu dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pas shes bya la rtog pa'i rgyus sems g-yeng bar byed do //
analyzed: zang zing cung zad tsam gyi rgyus sems g-yeng ba dang / rtsod pa la legs par mi bsgrub pa'i rgyu dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs drag pos sdug bsngal bar gnas pa'i rgyu dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pas shes bya la rtog pa'i rgyus sems g-yeng bar byed do //
translated: The mind is distracted by the cause of a slight material gain, by the cause of not properly accomplishing the dispute, by the cause of remaining in suffering through a strict moral vow, and by the cause of conceptualizing the knowable through non-conformity.

original: sgrib pa ni lnga ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa ni lnga ste /
translated: Obstructions are five:

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyi sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyi sgrib pa ste /
translated: the obstruction of desire for sense-pleasures, the obstruction of malice, the obstruction of torpor and sleep, the obstruction of restlessness and worry, and the obstruction of doubt.

original: rab tu byung ba la mngon par dga' ba'i dus dang / bskul ba na legs par bsgrub pa'i dus dang / zhi gnas kyi dus dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus dang / btang snyoms kyi dus na dge ba'i phyogs mi rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pas sgrib pa rnams so //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba la mngon par dga' ba'i dus dang / bskul ba na legs par bsgrub pa'i dus dang / zhi gnas kyi dus dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus dang / btang snyoms kyi dus na dge ba'i phyogs mi rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pas sgrib pa rnams so //
translated: They are obstructions because they are the cause of not understanding the wholesome side at the time of delighting in going forth, at the time of properly accomplishing the exhortation, at the time of serenity, at the time of full grasp, and at the time of equanimity.

original: tha ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: tha ba ni gsum ste /
translated: Hardnesses are three:

original: 'dod chags kyi tha ba dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug gi tha ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi tha ba dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug gi tha ba'o //
translated: the hard- ness of desire, the hardness of hatred, and the hardness of ignorance.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de dag la brten nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de dag la brten nas /
translated: On the basis of desire, hatred, and ignorance,

original: sngon goms pa'i tshul gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa la spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon goms pa'i tshul gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa la spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: one engages in desire, etc., in accordance with oneâ€™s previous habituation.
